loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Mr. Batmunh is a 31-year-old borrower from Zavhan province, Mongolia. His wife helps her husband by spreading the message about his business in the area, using her advantage as local school teacher to help increase their client pool. 

He is using his small truck to transport the inventory from the countryside and selling to domestic manufacturers in the capital city. He is now requesting a loan of 1,400,000 MNT to purchase a large quantity of animal pelts and other inventory from herders in the countryside.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of animal pelts and other inventory from herders in the countryside.

loans.name: Silvia Emilia

texts.es:
Es imposible ignorar los colores llamativos que provienen de la tienda de ropa y artesanía de Silvia, cada día recibe clientes, quienes quedan agradecidos por la buena atención y variedad de productos. Tiene la edad de 59 años, es una mujer que a pesar de no haber culminado una carrera universitaria, busco los medios para desarrollarse económicamente. A la edad de 15 años aprendió el arte de las manualidades, lleva 14 años comercializando ropa, el ocio no cabe en su vida. Su principal apoyo son sus cuatro hijos.
Ella solicita el financiamiento para la compra de ropa y zapatos, tanto para mujeres como para hombres. Deposita su confianza en el préstamo, puesto que le ayudará a incrementar su clientela y obtener mejores ganancias. Aspira tener un local propio, ya que en el que comercializa es alquilado. Otra de sus metas es adquirir una máquina bordadora. Su sueño es ofrecer sus productos en diferentes departamentos. Definitivamente, es una mujer activa y emprendedora.
texts.en:
It is impossible to miss the bright colors of Silvia's clothing and crafts store, where her daily customers are grateful for the good service and variety of products. Silvia is a 59-year-old woman. Despite not having completed a university degree, she sought ways to develop economically. At the age of 15 she learned the art of crafts and she has spent 14 years selling clothing; leisure does not fit in her life. Her primary support is her four children.

She is requesting financing to buy clothing and shoes for both men and women. She is confident that the loan will help her to expand her clientele and obtain higher profits. She aspires to get her own premises, since the place where she sells now is rented. Another of her goals is to purchase an embroidery machine. Her dream is to offer her products in other regions. She is definitely a lively and enterprising woman.

loans.use: to buy clothing and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fabric materials and sewing threads.

loans.name: Bharati

texts.en:
Bharati is 38 years old and a married woman with two children. She lives in Maynaguri, in a Kaccha house (made of mud and straw). Her husband is 43 years old. Bharati and her husband both are illiterate, only able to sign their names. Both of her children are going to school. 

 Her husband is a farmer.  Due to lack of capital they are unable to cultivate more crops and thus it has becoming very difficult for them to earn money. Bharati decided to give financial help to her husband. So she applied for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizers for cultivating bitter gourd. 

Bitter gourd is a profitable crop that is in high demand in the summer season in West Bengal. So Bharati has decided to grow this vegetable and according to her it is very easy to attain sufficient money in a short span of time. She hopes she will be successful in her business and she dreams of developing her business in future.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for bitter gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Bulbuli

texts.en:
Bulbuli is a housewife, 42 years old and blessed with four children. Her husband is 47 years old. Both of them are illiterate and can sign their names only. Though they are uneducated, they possess enough courage to educate their children at any cost. All of Bulbuli's children are studying in higher classes of secondary level education.

By occupation, her husband is a farmer who cultivates and sells vegetables at the local market. Due to his inconsistent income, Bulbuli decided to cultivate jute in the same field to generate more income, so that her family will lead a smooth life. She has chosen jute to cultivate because jute is a profitable crop and the summer season is best for growing this crop. 

Bulbuli has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s Partner) to buy seeds and fertilizers for jute cultivation. Then they will sell jute fiber at the wholesale market. She hopes this will make her successful in achieving more profit by fulfilling the market demand.

She is a successful entrepreneur and thankful to BJS and Kiva both for this loan.

loans.use: To cultivate jute to sell in the wholesale market shops for jute crafts.

loans.name: Firoja

texts.en:
Firoja is a 30-year-old married woman who lives with her husband and children .By occupation, her husband is a farmer. Firoja is a mother of four children. All of them are studying in different classes. Firoja lives in a small town called Maynaguri in Jalpaiguri District. 

Her husband’s income is too low to bear all the household costs of the family. Thus Firoja plans to cultivate more vegetables to help her husband.  She has decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds, manure and fertilizers for bitter gourd cultivation in their field. 

She hopes to have a good harvest and great profit from this cultivation. She will be able to meet household expenses and her children’s educational expenses using the profit from her business.

Firoja is thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding her.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, manure and fertilizers for bitter gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Narcisa

texts.es: Es una mujer cordial y luchadora, tiene 55 años de edad, madre soltera de 3 hijos, mayores de edad. Es originaria del Municipio de Prinzapolka, llego a Rosita hace 30 años en busca de un nuevo empleo, debido a que la empresa donde laboraba cerró operaciones. Trabaja como ayudanta en una miscelánea, también tiene 2 tramos en el mercado municipal de Rosita que alquila en C$ 3000 mensuales. Desde hace aproximadamente 10 años ha vivido de manera inestable, ya que aun recuerda que cada seis meses tenía que buscar una vivienda con precio accesible a su salario para alquilarla o vivir posando en casas de familiares. Sin embargo, con el sueño de tener su propia vivienda y vivir de manera segura, solicita su primer préstamo para comprar materiales para construir su casa de madera: Laminas de zinc, clavos, madera cepillada y rustica y cubrir los costos de mano de obra. Su sueño es contar con una vivienda que le brinde las comodidades. Quiere mejorar las condiciones de la infraestructura de sus tramos, ya que actualmente son de madera y se encuentran en regular estado.
texts.en: Narcisa is 55 years old and a polite and plucky woman. She is a single mother to three children, who are now adults. Narcisa is originally from the Prinzapolka municipality and came to Rosita 30 years ago in search of a new job after the company where she worked closed down. Narcisa works as an assistant in a general store. She also has two stalls at the Rosita market, which she rents out for 3000 Córdobas per month. For around 10 years Narcisa has had an unstable life. Every six months she must move a new home that she can afford to rent on her salary, or must stay with relatives. With a dream of owning her own secure home, Narcisa is applying for her first loan in order to buy materials - such as laminate zinc sheeting, nails and different types of wood - to build her house, and to cover the cost of labourers. Narcisa's dream is to have a home with everything she needs. She also wants to improve her market stalls as they are wooden and not in very good condition.

loans.use: to buy materials - such as laminate zinc sheeting, nails and different types of wood - to build her house, and to cover the cost of labourers.

loans.name: Taj

texts.en: Taj is a 22-year-old married woman. She deals in the business of selling cloth to meet her household expenditures.  She buys cloth of different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them to the people of her community. She has a varied customer base and is able to earn enough through her business. She is requesting a loan of 45,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs to attract more customers and expand her inventory. She expects a boost in her earnings with her loan and she plans to spend her profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy a wide variety of cloth in different colors and designs.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en: Rehana is a 51-year-old married woman. She has been running a business of selling cloth for many years. She purchases a variety of cloth from the main city and then sells it to the people of her vicinity. She has become famous for selling good-quality cloth in her community. Rehana requested a loan of PKR 45,000 from Kashf Foundation to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season by taking into account the choices and tastes of her customers. In this way, she will be able to earn more income through greater sales. She hopes to have a good experience with this new loan and wants to grow her business. She dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard efforts in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of different cloth for the summer season.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase livestock and meat products to resell to local residents.

loans.name: Chimeddorj

texts.en:
Mr. Chimeddorj is 46 years old and lives with his 4 children in their Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife passed away few years ago. His older two children attend a local college, his second son helps him to run his business and his youngest son attends local secondary school. 

Chimeddorj has been running his wooden furniture manufacturing business in small workshop on his plot of land for 7 years. He has been manufacturing Ger parts and supplies for a local company for years. 

He is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000 MNT to purchase wooden materials and other necessary materials to manufacture products on time and supply the company. He is a hardworking man and a caring father to his children.

loans.use: to purchase wooden materials and other necessary materials.

loans.name: Alejandrina Benita

texts.es: Alejandrina pertenece al banco comunal "Qory Chaska" de la UMF Arariwa y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú, ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza pues tiene un pequeño deposito y ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar cerveza y gaseosas. Agradece por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Alejandrina is a member of the "Qory Chask" comunal bank at "Arariwa Association". She lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, in the south of Peru and makes a living selling beer at her small store. She has been doing this work for a number of years and it is going very well for her. On this occasion Alejandrina is applying for a loan in order to buy beer and fizzy drinks. Alejandrina is very grateful for this loan and promises to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: to buy beers and fizzy drinks.

loans.name: Homiya

texts.ru: Хомия уроженка города Душанбе. Душанбе является столицей Республики Таджикистана. Хомия в Душанбе живет с двумя детьми. Ее муж находится в Российской Федерации на заработках. Хомия умная и трудолюбивая женщина. Она около 10 лет занимается шитьем национальной таджикской одежды. Она любит свою работу. Хомия научилась шить у своей мамы, когда была юной. Сейчас услуга шитья является важным источником дохода в семью Хомии. На сегодняшний день дом Хомия сильно нуждается в ремонте. Много лет Хомия не ремонтировала дом из-за недостаточной суммы денег, но сейчас ремонт является необходимым. Она просит кредит, чтобы купить стройматериалы и сделать ремонт.
texts.en:
Homiya is a native of the city of Dushanbe, the capital of the Republic of Tajikistan. Homiya lives in Dushanbe with two children. Her husband is working abroad in the Russian Federation. Homiya is a clever and hardworking woman. For about ten years, she has been involved in sewing national Tajik clothing. She loves her work. Homiya learned to sew from her mother, when she was young. Now, the sewing services are an important source of income for Homiya's family.

Currently, Homiya's home is strongly in need of repairs. For many years, Homiya has not done repairs because of insufficient funds, but now the repairs are required. She is requesting a loan to purchase construction materials and to complete repairs.

loans.use: to purchase building materials for making home repairs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase timber and other materials to meet clients' orders on time

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.es:
Erlinda tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lamabayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores en la parte posterior a su domicilio, realiza esta labor para apoyar con los gastos familiares a su esposo, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlo a un mejor precio a sus clientes generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Erlinda is 47 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Cayaltí district of Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region of Peru's north coast. Here the people make a living in agriculture, cattle raising and running businesses.

Erlinda makes a living raising and selling young animals at the back of her house. She does this work in order to help her husband with family expenses. Erlinda is applying for a loan of 2000 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa". She will use it to buy feed for fattening up her animals. She can then sell them at a better price and earn a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten up her animals.

loans.name: Anthony

texts.en:
Anthony, a father of 2, resides in Nkubu, Eastern Kenya. For the past 7 years, Anthony has been practicing livestock farming. He makes ends meet by selling milk, meat and eggs from his farm. He also holds a job that pays him a monthly salary. When he is not on the farm or at work, Anthony is busy offering transportation services on motorcycle. To balance all these activities, Anthony has employed some workers to help out. 

Anthony enjoys selling his products and services at a profit. His biggest challenge is the high labor costs. Most of his income goes to his children’s school fees. Anthony is seeking a loan to purchase beef cattle. There is a high demand for meat in Nkubu. “The market prices keep going up” said Anthony. This loan will help Anthony to uplift his family's living standard.

loans.use: To purchase beef cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Dorayda

texts.es:
Su aspecto pícaro y su sonrisa coqueta hacen que Dorayda ofrezca confianza y tranquilidad a todos los clientes que visitan su pequeño negocio.  Su actitud positiva y optimista en el trabajo la ha llevado a alcanzar poco a poco sus metas con la ayuda de su compañero de vida.  Con el primer financiamiento otorgado por KIVA MiCrédito, consiguió invertir en productos de belleza, como perfumes, ropa y cosméticos	.
Dorayda planea seguir creciendo en su negocio, es por ello que solicitó otro préstamo en KIVA MiCrédito para la compra de productos de belleza, como perfumes, ropa y cosméticos al por mayor, de esa manera logrará satisfacer las necesidades de todos los clientes que la visitan  diariamente. Así mismo, desea continuar su proyecto de un panel solar para el ahorro de energía. Todos sus sueños se están haciendo realidad gracias a la confianza y apoyo  de esta institución.
texts.en:
Dorayda's impish personality and playful smile project confidence and serenity to all the customers who shop in her small business.  Her positive and optimistic attitude on the job have led her to achieve her goals little by little with the help of her life partner. With her first loan from Kiva/MiCrédito she invested in beauty products such as perfume, clothing, and cosmetics.

Dorayda plans to keep on growing in her business, so she's requesting another loan from Kiva/MiCrédito to buy beauty products wholesale, including perfume, clothing, and cosmetics.  That way she'll be able to satisfy the needs of all the customers who visit her every day.

She also wants to continue with her solar-panel project to save energy.  All her dreams are coming true thanks to the trust and support of this institution.

loans.use: to buy perfume, clothing, and cosmetics

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy anti-fungal chemicals and manure.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothes for her business.

loans.name: Kafula

texts.en:
Kafula is 28 years old. He is married and has two children, a five year old girl and one year old boy. He operates his own Zoona mobile money transfer business.  The business provides easily accessibly and affordable financial services to people within his community. He runs his business from Lusaka, the capital city of Zambia.

Kafula works diligently to support his family. He has been operating the business for nearly three years now. Kafula talks about how his community benefits from the business because it is much cheaper and user friendly for customers from all backgrounds. He adds that he is centrally located and therefore convenient for customers to access his shop location.

Kafula’s current challenge is accessing working capital so that he can grow his business and serve more customers. He explains that he wants to grow his business by expanding to new locations within Lusaka. This will enable him to have a growing and new customer base. In serving more customers, Kafula will earn additional income from making commissions off each transaction. Kafula is hopeful that once he starts making this additional profit, he can be in a position to start building his family a house.

Kafula is grateful for the opportunity to be connected with Kiva lenders. He has previously accessed two Kiva loans, which he has successfully paid back. The loans helped him to open a new shop in Kanyama and grow his working capital to serve more customers. Kafula thanks the Kiva lenders for their continued support in assisting him in growing his business and providing a better life for his family.

loans.use: To provide essential transaction cash needed for him to grow his money transfer business

loans.name: Zakaria

texts.en:
Zacharia lives in Ogongo, a small town in Homa Bay county. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, close both the Tanzanian border and Lake Victoria, Africa's largest lake. Despite the proximity to the lake, water infrastructure in Homa Bay remains quite undeveloped, and inconsistent rains and occasional droughts make life difficult for farmers in the area. Nonetheless, farmers have adapted to these challenges, particularly by diversifying their crops to include cassava, sunflower, sorghum, bananas, groundnuts and millet, as well as drought-resistant varieties of papaya and mangoes. Although beekeeping has not traditionally been practiced in the region, many individuals have expressed interest in keeping bees and are knowledgeable about their pollination benefits.

Zacharia is married and has ten children. Both he and his wife are farmers. They have been farming for forty years now and they are currently growing maize, beans, millet and sunflower in their farm. Zacharia is excited about beekeeping as it will earn him some income and provide him with honey for food and medicine.

This is Zacharia’s first loan with Honey Care and he plans to use the proceeds from his beehives to pay school fees for his grandchildren. Zacharia’s hope for the future is to have his children educated from the income earned from his beekeeping project.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Quinter

texts.en:
Quinter lives in Kamato, a small town in Homa Bay County. Homa Bay county is located in south-western Kenya, and borders onto Lake Victoria, the second-largest lake in the world. Populations are dense close to the lake, where many individuals make their living from fishing, and a few work in the small but slowly growing tourism industry. A popular tourist attraction in Homa Bay county is Ruma National Park, a game reserve that is home to the rare roan antelope, a shy species distantly related to the reticulated giraffe. Most people in Homa Bay make their living from farming, and the rolling hills of the area are dotted with fields and fruit tree plantations.

Quinter is married and has four children. She runs a small business selling tomatoes. Both she and her husband are farmers. They have been farming for three years now and they are currently growing maize and beans in their farm. Quinter is excited about beekeeping as it will earn her some income from the sale of honey and provide her with honey for food.

This is Quinter’s first loan with Honey Care and she plans to use the proceeds from her beehives to provide for her family’s basic needs and invest in her business. Quinter’s hope for the future is to invest more in the beekeeping project and earn more income.

loans.use: to buy beehives and apiary materials for honey production.

loans.name: Dipa

texts.en:
Dipa is 23 years, a married woman of Maynaguri . Her husband is 28 years old. By occupation, her husband is a farmer. Dipa has one son who is too small to go to school now. She and her husband are not much educated; studied up to grade 10.

Now she and her husband plan to cultivate chillis. They want to grow their farming business. She has decided to take a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seeds and necessary items to grow chillis. They will harvest chillis in their field and sell them in the local market. Chilli is a very essential vegetable, used in almost every Indian dish, and  that is why she hopes she will gain much profit by selling chillis in the local market. 

With the profit, she hopes she will raise her family’s economic status. Though she is aware of different risks that may occur in the time of cultivation, yet she knows she can overcome those risks and hopes to have a good harvest of chillis. 

Dipa thanks BJS and Kiva for helping her financially.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and necessary items for cultivation of chillis.

loans.name: Otinkorang Group

texts.en: This group is made up of two women who are successful in their businesses and are part of the group called Otinkorang.  Mary, who is 44 years old, and married with five children, represents the group. She makes a living selling underwear, shoes, cooking utensils and onions from door to door.  She needs the loan to buy underwear, shoes, cooking utensils and onions, to sell to customers. With the previous loan she was able to improve her business by purchasing more of the above-mentioned items. This increased her profits and has motivated her to continue borrowing from this institution.  She is taking this loan together with Grace who will invest her portion in toffee, ceramic plates and bowls.

loans.use: to buy underwear, shoes, cooking utensils, and onions to sell to customers.

loans.name: Dipika

texts.en:
Dipika is 26 years old and lives in Maynaguri with her husband and two children. Dipika has struggled a lot in her life. One of her children is receiving an education and the other one is too small for going to school.

Dipika's husband is associated with a small business. She also runs a small fast food business to give financial support to her family. She prepares panipuri (locally known as puchka in West Bengal) on her own and sells it  in front of schools, in the street of local marketplaces, parks and in almost in any congested area.

Panipuri consists of a round, hollow puri, fried crisp and filled with a mixture of flavored water ("pani"), tamarind chutney, chilli, chaat masala, potato, onion and chickpeas. It is generally small enough to fit completely into one's mouth. It is a popular street food dish in India. It is also known as golgappa in India.

Now Dipika wants to expand her business and applied for a loan of INR 10,000 to buy ingredients like flour, spices, potatoes, chilli, masala, chickpeas etc. for preparing panipuri.

Dipika is really thankful to BJS and Kiva for this financial support and she is very happy after getting this loan.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for preparing panipuri (puchka).

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 2 years, Esther has been working hard to manage her saloon business, which deals in plaiting, weaving and treatment of hair. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of 400,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a fridge, dryers and chemicals, and will help Esther to generate greater profits and improve on her business size. Esther hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a house of her own.

loans.use: buy a fridge, dryers and chemicals.

loans.name: Salah

texts.en:
Salah is 17 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past 2 years, Salah has been working hard to manage her charcoal stall, which sells charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Salah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more charcoal, and will help Salah to generate greater profits and increase on business size. Salah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mukono, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Betty has been working hard to manage her boutique, where she sells second-hand clothes and shoes. 

To help expand her business, Betty has requested a loan of UGX 700,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more women's clothes and children's clothes and will help Betty to generate greater profits and buy more clothes to attract more customers. 

Betty hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: buy more women's clothes and children's clothes.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза жительница города Душанбе. Ей 24 года. Она живет с мамой. Она развелась с мужем. После развода Фируза не вышла замуж и нашла в себе силы начать новый не распространенный вид бизнеса. У Фирузы рядом с базаром имеется сортир. Она построила сортир 2 года назад. Сейчас помещение нуждается в ремонте. У Фирузы не хватает определенной суммы денег, чтобы отремонтировать сортир и почистить канализации. Она хочет создать хорошие условия и удобства для посетителей. Так как она самостоятельно не в финансовом состоянии совершить задуманное, она просит поддержки.
texts.en:
Firuza is a resident of the city of Dushanbe. She is 24 years old. She loves with her mother. She is divorced from her husband. After the divorce, Firuza did not remarry and found in herself the strength to start a new and uncommon kind of business. Near the market, Firuza has a public bathroom. She built the bathroom two years ago.

Now the premises are in need of repair. Firuza lacks a certain some of money in order to complete repairs and to clean the pipes. She wants to create a good environment and comfort for visitors. Since she is not financially able to realize her plans on her own, she is requesting support.

loans.use: to repair the public bathroom

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en: Mrs.Enhtuya is a 39-year-old woman, living in a Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt with her family in the capital city of Mongolia. She is running her consumer products business in a rental stall of a local market. Her husband helps her to run their business and her children are university and local primary school students respectively.  She has purchased a small plot of land to live on with her family, and is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to pay for the land she bought a few months ago. She is a hardworking and diligent woman, who wants to build small house on the plot of land to provide a decent living for her family.

loans.use: to pay for the land she bought few months ago.

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es: Balbina pertenece al banco comunal "Qory Chaska" de la UMF Arariwa y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú, ella se dedica a la venta de comida pues tiene un pequeño restaurante donde expede menú y ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como sacos de azúcar, verduras, carne y sacos de arroz. Agradece por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Balbina belongs to the Qory Chaska communal bank, part of the Araiwa microfinance institution. She lives in the beautiful city of Cusco in the south of Peru.

She earns her living selling food, and has a small restaurant where she creates a menu. She's been working this business for several years, and it's going very well.

In this opportunity, she needs the loan to buy goods, like bags of sugar, vegetables, meat and bags of rice. She's thankful for the credit granted and promises to comply with established payments.

loans.use: to buy goods, such as bags of sugar, vegetables, meat and bags of rice.

loans.name: Jamlick

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Jamlick, a father of 3 who has been a mixed farmer for the last 7 years. He owns a small parcel of land Nkubu, Kenya, where he lives with his family. He makes a living selling milk and eggs from the farm. He also grows food crops on the piece of land, runs a transportation service with his motorbike and holds a job that pays him monthly salary.

Jamlick finds farming to be quite flexible. This gives him room to do many things at once. His biggest challenge however is the high cost of farm inputs.
Currently, most of Jamlick’s income goes to school fees. The only way he can expand his business is through taking a loan to acquire assets that would immediately generate income to meet the loan’s scheduled repayments. 

With your loan donations, Jamlick will be able to construct a zero grazing unit. With this unit, Jamlick will improve milk production. A zero grazing unit confines a cow to a small feeding area so that most of its energy is driven to milk production. This unit will also free a lot of space to grow various grass species suitable for dairy animals. Part of the harvested grass will go to silage production and the surplus will be sold to neighbouring dairy farmers.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more oranges for her business.

loans.name: Emelina

texts.es:
Emelina tiene 41 años de edad es agricultora y ama de casa, madre de cinco hijos quienes se involucran en las diferentes actividades en compañía de su padre las cuales son desarrolladas en el campo. Ella tiene un grado de escolaridad primario incompleto cursado hasta el tercer grado y no pudo continuar por la falta de apoyo económico por parte de sus padres ya que la economía no era la mejor. Esta es su tercera temporada en la siembra y cultivo de café siendo sus padres quienes le enseñaran a trabajar en el campo cuando ella era niña pues su experiencia es poca ya en la práctica llevándola a cabo desde hace tres años. Ella tiene mucha fe en el trabajo que realiza en compañía de su esposo e hijos por lo cual espera ser apoyada por los diferentes inversionistas en la plataforma de Kiva para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a proteger y fortalecer al mismo tiempo sus cultivos de café para esta nueva temporada ya que las demás instituciones financieras no pudieron abrirle las puertas hasta el momento como lo ha hecho COMIXMUL.
Sus planes a futuro son los de extender sus cultivos y comprar más tierra para sembrar una mejor variedad de café como: caturra, lempira, que son competitivos en el mercado y el lempira sobre todo más fuerte a las enfermedades y las plagas. Sus sueños como madre es poder apoyar a sus hijos en todo lo necesariamente posible para que cada día que pasa sean mejores personas en la vida.
texts.en:
Emelina is a 41-year old woman who works as a farmer and housewife. She has 5 children who get involved in different farming activities with their father. She only studied until third grade and could not continue with her education due to the lack of financial support from their family, whose financial situation was not favorable. This is her third season cultivating and harvesting coffee, an activity that she learned from her parents when she was a little girl. She has three years of experience and has a strong faith in the work she does with her husband and children. She expects to receive the support of Kiva lenders to buy farming supplies to protect and strengthen her coffee plantations this season. After being rejected by other financial institutions, COMIXMUL opened its doors to her. 

Her plan for the future is to expand her plantation and buy more land to cultivate a wider variety of coffee, such as "caturra" and "lempira", which are very competitive in the market. "Lempira" is stronger against illnesses and plagues. Her dream as a mother is to be able to support her children so that they become better persons each day.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies to assist and maintain her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is widowed and has  seven children, five of whom attend school and two of whom are adults. She operates a charcoal selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and villagers. Her greatest monthly challenge is the high cost of transportation.

Mwaka is requesting for a loan from Yehu, which she will use to purchase charcoal to sell. She joined Yehu to get financial support. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.use: to purchase charcoal

loans.name: Grace Group

texts.en: Greetings from Chipinge in Zimbabwe! This is Jane, the leader of Grace Group. She is 58 years old and widowed. She has four children ages 29, 27, 25 and 20 respectively, and no one is attending school. She operates a general dealer shop under Chipinge branch in Zimbabwe. She has been running this business for 32 years and sells her products to the local market. She has no other source of income. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of capital to purchase groceries for resale. Jane requested this loan of $400 through MicroKing to purchase additional groceries for her shop. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her improve her product range. In the future, she intends to increase her sales and buy a truck with the profits.

loans.use: to pay for additional groceries for her shop.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза жительница района Рудаки. Она в течение 6 лет занимается предпринимательской деятельностью. Фируза на центральном рынке города Душанбе имеет свою торговую точку, где вместе с мужем занимается продажей детской и взрослой обуви. Ей нравится то, чем она занимается. Так как она каждый день общается с разными людьми и консультирует клиентов при выборе хорошей обуви. Поэтому на ее товар всегда имеется спрос. У нее природный талант в сфере продаж. Сейчас Фируза хочет привести сезонный товар для своих покупателей. Для этой цели она обратилась за кредитом в размере 1000 долларов США. Она хочет увеличить ассортимент сезонной обуви и полагается на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Firuza is a resident of the Rudaki region. Over the course of six years, she has been engaged in entrepreneurial activities. In the central market of the city of Dushanbe, she has her own trade booth, where with her husband she sells children's and adults' shoes. She loves what she does for a living. Every day she communicates with different people and consults with customers about choosing good shoes. Therefore in her inventory she always has variety. She has a natural talent in the field of sales.

Now, Firuza wants to fetch seasonal goods for her customers. With this aim, she applied for a loan of US$1,000. She wants to expand her assortment of seasonal shoes and relies on financial support.

loans.use: to buy an assortment of seasonal children's and adults' shoes for developing trade

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 22 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Annet has been working hard to manage her food stall, where she sells tomatoes, vegetables, charcoal, and pineapples. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 800,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more stocks of tomatoes, vegetables, charcoal, matooke, and pineapples, and will help her to generate greater profits and improve her business. Annet hopes that in the future she will be able to construct rental units.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tomatoes, vegetables, charcoal, and pineapples.

loans.name: Dúo Rosario Group

texts.es: Dúo Rosario La encargada de este grupo es la señora Mirna Susana quien tiene una venta de cosméticos en general como cremas, champo, lociones, desodorantes, pinta uñas, talcos , jabones para bebe, también vende pantalones para damas y caballeros en lona fina y sencilla.  Tiene varios años en el negocio y cada día los clientes la están visitando más porque no le gusta quedar mal a las personas que le hacen pedidos. También vende blusas para dama en diferentes tallas y colores y calzado de catálogo.  Tiene varios pedidos de ropa, calzados y cosméticos pero no le es suficiente el dinero que tiene para comprar más producto.  Por eso se ve en la necesidad de pedir un crédito para no quedarles mal a sus clientes y aprovechar las ventas de este verano y tener bonitas ganancias.  La ayuda de su esposo es muy importante y el apoyo de sus tres hijos le dan fuerzas para seguir luchando por sus sueños, tener su local propio y así no pagar tanta renta.
texts.en:
The head of this group, Dúo Rosario, is Señora Mirna Susana who sells cosmetics in general such as creams, shampoos, lotions, deodorants, nail polish, talcs and baby soaps. She also sells pants for women and men in a fine and simple cloth. She has been in the business for many years and each day more customers visit her because she does not like to look bad in front of the people who order from her. She also sells blouses for women in different sizes and colors, and footwear from a catalog. 

She has many orders of clothing, footwear and cosmetics, but the money she has is not sufficient to purchase more product. Because of this, she sees herself in need to request a loan in order to not look bad in front of her customers and to take advantage of the sales this summer and gain profit. 

The help of her husband is very important and his support with their three children gives her strength to continue fighting for her dreams, to have her own locale and therefore not pay as much rent.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell

loans.name: Gita

texts.en:
Gita is a 34-year-old married woman from Maynaguri. She is illiterate, just knows how to sign her name. Her husband pulls a van rented from a local owner. Their poverty has not allowed her only son to receive education; that is why he has to engage himself in mason work to help the family financially. Gita herself is busy with an animal husbandry.

Gita has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for buying a dairy cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. Both Gita and her husband struggle hard all day long to overcome their financial troubles. They work long hours so that they can run a smooth life. 

This loan will give them an opportunity to make their dream true. Gita expects that, by selling her dairy products, she may be able to increase her business. Now Gita lives in a kaccha house (made of straw and mud), but in the future, with the profit, she hopes to build a pakka house (made of bricks and cement) and a cattle farm as well. 

Gita is thankful to Kiva and BJS.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Hema

texts.en:
Hema is a 25-year-old housewife who lives with her husband, Manahar, who is a farmer. They live in a small hut in the village of Maynaguri. Hema is hardworking. 

They have their own land where they cultivate different vegetables in different seasons and sell those vegetables in the market. Experience in the agricultural field is the main reason for choosing cultivation of bitter gourd. Hema helps her husband in the field. 

She wishes to take the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase fertilizer and seeds for bitter gourd cultivation. She wants to purchase more land in the future and plans to build a concrete house to live in with the profit from her business. Environmental disasters like drought, flood and famine are the main challenges in her agricultural business.

 Hema wants to prosper in life after overcoming all the difficulties. She is a very ambitious and courageous lady, who never gives up the fight before she wins. Hema is grateful to the lenders to this loan.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer and seeds for bitter gourd cultivation.

loans.name: Liliana Marisela

texts.es:
Liliana Marisela tiene 26 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Zaña, una comunidad ubicada cerca al valle del río Jequetepeque, lo que le ha permitido desarrollarse mediante la agricultura, también se dedican al comercio, y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo, que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedicada a la enseñanza de actividades deportivas en su propio hogar desde hace 01 año aproximadamente y por la zona y alrededores de su distrito, es una joven emprendedora, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de una máquina para ejercicios de piernas y de esta manera poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Liliana Marisela is 26 years old and lives in the district of Zaña, a community located near the valley of the river Jequetepeque. This location has allowed the community to develop through agriculture, trade and livestock farming. It is located in the province of Chiclayo, belonging to the Lambayeque Region on the north coast of Peru. 

Liliana has been teaching sports at home for about a year and also in the area and around the district. She is a young entrepreneur. She has applied to Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2,000 soles ($725) for the purchase of a machine for leg exercises with which she will be able to provide a better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a machine for leg excercises

loans.name: Miriam

texts.es: Miriam pertenece al banco comunal "Qory Chaska" de la UMF Arariwa y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa y ya son varios años que se dedica a este negocio le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar sabanas y cubre camas. Agradece por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en: Miriam belongs to the village bank "Qory Chaska" of UMF Asociación Arariwa, and she lives in the gorgeous city of Cusco in southern Perú. Miriam has been selling clothes for several years, and her business is going very well. This time she is requesting a loan to purchase sheets and bed covers. Miriam is thankful for the credit granted to her, and she agrees to meet the established payments.

loans.use: purchase sheets and bed covers.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a 44-year-old father to three children. He is living in Fort Portal-Uganda and purely in agriculture and runs a bar business where he has been selling local brew and other types of alcohol since 1989. He began this business in order to raise income for the family. Charles wishes to see his children attain higher educational levels, but complains of limited capital to add to the business. Charles is thus asking for a loan to buy local brew for selling.

loans.use: to buy local brew for selling.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: install electricity in his home.

loans.name: Jharna

texts.en:
Jharna is a housewife, 42 years old and blessed with two children. Her husband is 50 years old and is basically illiterate; they can sign their names only.  Jharna has completed her education up to grade 8. All of her children go to school and receive an education.

By occupation, her husband is a small businessman who sells jute fibre, ropes etc. in the local market, purchasing from a local jute farmer. Due to his inconsistent income, Jharna decided to cultivate jute in her own field so that her husband does not have buy jute from outside. She has chosen jute to cultivate because now-a-days jute is a profitable crop. She took a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy seeds and fertilizers for jute cultivation so that she can sell jute fiber at the wholesale market shop to those who sell jute craft items. 

Jharna hopes this will make her successful in achieving more profit and she can also meet the demand of her customers as well. She also hopes that by fulfilling the market demand she can improve her financial conditions with the help of her business profit. She dreams of giving a better and prosperous life to her children with the profit she will earn.

She is a good entrepreneur and is thankful to BJS and Kiva both.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers for jute cultivation

loans.name: Jhumur

texts.en:
Jhumur is 38 years old and a married woman; she has two children. Her husband is 45 years old and as an occupation, he sells wood in the market. Both of them have completed their education up to grades 7 & 8 respectively. Her children are also studying in different grades in the small village school of Maynaguri.

 Jhumur is a housewife. Her husband sells firewood in the local market. Rural people use firewood for cooking purposes in their ovens. To sell firewood, at first, Jhumur's husband needs to purchase a log and cut it into pieces and then sell them in the market. Nowadays, the cost of firewood is going up. Due to lack of sufficient capital, they are unable to purchase a large stock of logs. 

Thus Jhumur decided to take loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase good quality firewood. She wanted to invest in this business because there is a great demand for firewood in her area. Almost every family in her rural area wants good quality firewood for their daily cooking purposes. 

Jhumur is sure that she will earn more profit from this business except in the rainy season; there is a possibility of loss in the firewood business in the rainy season. She dreams she will enhance her business in the future and earn more with the profit from her business. 

Jhumur is happy and grateful to Kiva and BJS after getting this loan.

loans.use: To purchase firewood to sell in the local area.

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en: Shushanik lives in Dzoravanq village with her husband and two sons. Her elder son currently serves in the army and other one is employed in the private sector. Shushanik and her husband are running a farm. They have a big and beautiful farm with livestock (cows, sheep, chickens and pigs) and arable land where a large variety of fruit trees and vegetables are cultivated.  Shushanik has requested this loan for enlarging her farm. The loan of USD 3,000 will be a big support for her to buy 14 more calves.  She will be very grateful to lenders if they support her to develop her farming business. Although her sons bring income to the family, the income gathered from the farming business is very important for Shushanik to cover everyday expenses.

loans.use: to pay for 14 calves.

loans.name: Los Girasoles Group

texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Los Girasoles”  está conformada por 08 socios que han ido mejorando en el transcurso del tiempo a través de  sus negocios. Este es el caso de Isaquiel de 47 años soltero. El cuenta con un local para venta de bebidas hace más de  17 años. Con el fruto de su esfuerzo puede seguir apoyando a su familia. Seguir implementando su negocio es su mayor deseo. El crédito que solicitó lo invertirá para la compra de gaseosa y agua mineral. El grupo “Los Girasoles” agradecen el crédito brindado y se comprometen a seguir trabajando bien. Isaquiel se encuentra sentado es el primero del lado derecho y viste chaleco crema.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank "Los Girasoles" (The Sunflowers) is made up of 8 partners that have been continuing to improve in the course of time through their businesses. This is the case of Isaquiel, a 47 year old bachelor. He has depended on a locale for the sale of beverages for more than 17 years. With the fruits of his labor he can continue to support his family. His greatest wish is to continue to implement his business. With the loan he requested he will invest in the purchase of soft drinks and mineral water.

 "Los Girasoles" group is grateful for the loan they have been given, and they promise to continue working hard.

Isaquiel is found seated, he is first from the right and is wearing a cream-colored vest.

loans.use: with the purchase of soft drinks and mineral water.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 20 years old and single. She lives in Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past year, Christine has been working hard to manage her shoe shop, which sells second hand ladies' and children's shoes. 

Christine requested a loan from BRAC Uganda for 300,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to buy more shoes. The loan will help her to generate greater profits and expand her business. Christine hopes that in the future she will be able to open up another shop in town.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel tiene 36 años de edad, vive con su hijo el cual estudia en el colegio de la zona, en el Caserío de Chiple, una zona rural del distrito de Callayuc, una comunidad de clima frío, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella tiene un restaurant donde vende comida preparada por ella misma, cuenta con clientela considerable por el buen sabor de sus comidas que ofrece, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de insumos como sacos de arroz, azúcar, bidones de aceite y de esta manera proveerse para la preparación de sus alimentos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maribel is 36 years old and lives with her son who goes to school in the area. They live in Chiple village, a rural area of the district of Callayuc, located in the Province of Cutervo, Cajamarca Region, in the North Andes of Peru. The people in this cold climate work in agriculture, commerce and raising livestock.
Maribel has a restaurant where she sells food that she prepares. She has a good clientele because of the good taste of what she offers. She has requested a loan of 1,000 PEN to buy supplies like bags of rice, sugar and barrels of oil and in this way stock up for the preparation of the food she offers to her clients.

loans.use: to buy bags of rice, sugar and drums of oil.

loans.name: Luis Enrrique

texts.es: Luis Enrrique pertenece al banco comunal "Qory Chaska" de la UMF Arariwa y vive en la hermosa ciudad del Cusco al sur de Perú, él se dedica a la enseñanza en una academia pre universitario y ya son varios años que se dedica a este trabajo le va muy bien. En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para hacer materiales de trabajo como afiches entonces necesita papel. Agradece por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Luis Enrrique is a member of the "Qory Chaska" communal bank (part of UMF Arariwa) and lives in the beautiful city of Cusco, in southern Peru. Luis has been earning a living by teaching in a pre-university academy for several years, and the job is going very well. 

He is requesting this loan to purchase class materials such as paper for making posters. He is grateful for the loan and is committed to paying it off on time.

loans.use: to buy class materials such as paper for making posters.

loans.name: Dúo Amarilis De Buena Vista Group

texts.es: Dúo  Amarilis de Buena Vista La encargada de este grupo es la señora Amarilis Elizabeth, quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos en general como champo, cremas, lociones, lápiz labial, desodorantes, tratamientos en general de cosméticos. Tiene varios pedidos de sus clientes sobre tratamientos completos de cremas, pero el dinero que tiene no le alcanza y se ve en la necesidad de pedir un préstamo para no quedarles mal a sus clientes y tener buenas ganancias.  Su sueño es tener un local grande y vender de todo en cosméticos en la colonia de su aldea ya que no hay, y asi ser una gran distribuidora de cosméticos. Cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo y quiere darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The leader of the "Amarilis de Buena Vista Duo" is Amarilis Elizabeth, who sells a variety of cosmetics like shampoo, creams, lotions, lip colors, deodorants, and beauty treatments. She has several orders from her customers for complete beauty cream treatments, but does not have enough money to cover the purchase. 

Amarilis sees the need to ask for a loan so that she won't disappoint her clients, and she can make good earnings. Her dream is to have a large store and to sell every cosmetic product, as there is no store like this in the neighborhood of her village. In this way, she will become the largest distributor of cosmetics. Amarilis has the unconditional support of her husband and wants to give the best to her child.

loans.use: purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Jhunu

texts.en:
Jhunu is a 28-year-old housewife in Maynaguri. She has completed her education up to grade 10. 

Her husband sells bori (conical balls made of different pulses) in the local market. She, being a housewife, makes these bori at home by sun-drying them. She needs many necessary ingredients like Urad dal, red chilli powder, ginger powder, water, etc. for making good quality bori. For this reason she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy these varieties of necessary ingredients to make a huge quantity of bori, made of different types of pulses. There is a great demand for her bori in the local area.  

Jhunu has insufficient capital to buy the raw materials for supplying a huge quantity of bori in her locality. She expects that, with this loan, she can fulfill the market demand for bori. In the future she wants to increase their business and see it flourish.

She is highly obliged to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more necessary ingredients for making bori (a conical ball made of pulses).

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en:
Dickson has two children and is from Nyamira, a popular banana growing region in Kenya. He has been a mixed farmer for 11 years, growing tea and selling milk and eggs to earn a living. Dickson also engages in short-term business ventures to make extra money. 

Despite the diversity, Dickson’s real passion lies in dairy farming. He loves his dairy cow, named Nyangera, because she gives him the most profit (milk sales). His biggest challenge is the expensive cost of drugs for dairy animals.

Dickson is requesting a loan, which he will use to construct a dairy shed to make his cow more productive since it will not lose so much energy roaming looking for pasture. A feed and water trough will be installed in the shed and constantly filled by Dickson himself. The shed will also eliminate the need to hire shepherds. The extra income will take care of the high farm-related costs and improve the quality of life Dickson’s family is leading.

loans.use: to construct a dairy shed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to assist her coffee and corn crops.

loans.name: Jyotsna

texts.en:
Jyotsna is a young, energetic 21-year-old married lady. She has one small child. She lives with her husband in a small village in Maynaguri. 

Her husband is associated with a small trade, but his income is not sufficient for their family maintenance. Jyotsna is a hardworking woman; to give financial support, she prepares bamboo baskets and sells them in the local bazaar. There is great demand for these baskets in rural areas. The materials required to make the baskets are expensive, so it was not possible for her to run the business effectively. 

Jyotsna decided to join BJS (Kiva’s partner) and take out a loan so she can buy more bamboo sticks and other supplies for preparing more baskets. From childhood Jyotsna is very much expert in making handicraft items; that is why she plays the decent role of making the baskets in a good way. Her neighbors are also fond of her baskets, so Jyotsna got encouragement in making baskets. She hopes this will improve her financial status and enhance her business on a large scale. She also wants to employ a laborer in this work to assist her and to enlarge her business.  
 
Jyotsna is very much thankful to BJS and Kiva for helping her to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase bamboo sticks and other supplies for making baskets.

loans.name: Karuna

texts.en:
Karuna is a 51-year-old hardworking housewife from Maynaguri. She lives with her husband and four children in a small mud hut, facing many difficulties. Both husband and wife are illiterate, only able to sign their names. Her children are also deprived of receiving an education due to their poverty. Her children are engaged in small businesses and one of them works in shops as a laborer.

Karuna's husband is a farmer, cultivating different vegetables and selling them in the local market but his income is not sufficient to cover their family expenses. Karuna is facing too many problems in running her family so she applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing seeds and fertilizers for tomato cultivation. Tomatoes are a very profitable crop and there is no vital risk in the harvesting of this vegetable; that is why Karuna has chosen this additional crop for cultivation. She hopes she will earn much profit from this cultivation and can contribute to her family. With the profit from her business, she dreams of providing a decent lifestyle to their children and saving for their future.

Karuna thanks BJS and Kiva for helping in her crucial time.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers for tomato cultivation.

loans.name: Willan Cristobal

texts.es: Willan  es un joven de 26 años de edad, cuenta que sus padres son colombianos y que Willan tenía 10 años cuando vino junto a sus padres a Ecuador,  tuvo que cambiar su nacionalidad a Ecuatoriano para que le permitan ingresar a una escuela  a estudiar ya que a los colombianos no les recibian, él vive con  sus padres y 2 de sus 3 hermanos, mismos que asiste al colegio, Willan se dedica desde hace 4 año a sembrar papas pero ya tenía experiencia en la agricultura desde más joven  ya que su padre se dedica a la agricultura y al trabajo en el campo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para sus sembríos, la aspiración de Willan es mejorar su negocio que incremente sus cosechas para tener mejores ingresos que le permitan cubrir sus gastos y apoyar a sus padres.
texts.en:
Willan is a young man of 26. He says that his parents are Colombian and that Willan was 10 when he came to Ecuador with his parents. He had to change his nationality to Ecuadorian so that he would be allowed to apply to school to study because Colombians were not accepted. He lives with his parents and 2 of his 3 siblings who are in high school. 

As of 4 years ago, Willan dedicated himself to sowing potatoes, but he already had experience with agriculture from when he was younger as his parents are dedicated to agriculture and to work in the field. He is going to invest the loan in the purchase of fertilizer and fungicides for his sown fields.

 Willan's aspiration is to improve his business and that he increases his harvest in order to have greater income, which will allow him to cover his costs and support his parents.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fungicides.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Dúo Bellos Amanecer Group

texts.es:
DUO BELLOs AMANECER
La señorita Evelyn Aracely de 36 años, soltera,  desde hace 5 años posee una venta de ropa ambulante en Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de la señorita Evelyn es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar más ropa de hombre y mujer, para  seguir creciendo con su negocio.
texts.en:
DUO BELLOs AMANECER: Evelyn Aracely, a 36 year-old single woman, has had a business as a clothing street vendor in Chimaltenango for the last 5 years. Thanks to her efforts, she managed to set up and improve her home, and, through her business, she has supported her family and helped them get ahead. 

Evelyn’s dream is to be able to improve her and her family’s quality of life with the help of this microloan that she is asking for from FAPE. With this loan, she wants to buy more women's and men’s clothes in order to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Ramani

texts.en:
Ramani is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of two children. Her husband is 48 years old. Ramani and her husband are illiterate, able to sign their name only. Ramani lives in the small town of Maynaguri. Her children are receiving an education.

Ramani is a housewife and her husband is a farmer who sells his own cultivated products in the local village market. Now Ramani decided to grow jute for making different jute items like bags and handicraft items and sell the jute at the wholesale market. With the help of this BJS (Kiva’s partner) loan she will buy seeds, fertilizers and necessary ingredients to cultivate jute. She hopes this will enable her to develop her family’s financial status. 

Ramani also dreams of giving a good future to her children and having a Pakka house (made of bricks and cement) of her own with the profit from her business.

Ramani is obliged and grateful to Kiva and BJS as well.

loans.use: To buy seeds, fertilizers and necessary items to cultivate jute.

loans.name: Jhonatan

texts.es:
El socio Jhonatan pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL, él socio sigue brindando el servicio de taxi, él socio lleva buen tiempo con su trabajo el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su trabajo, él socio a la vez continua alquilando equipos electrónicos para compromisos que necesitan, él socio desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para el mantenimiento de su carro como en el cambio de aceite.
El socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
texts.en:
Jhonatan belongs to the communal bank, San Rafael. He continues to work providing a taxi service. He has done this job for quite some time and his business does well thanks to the effort he puts in every day at work. He also continues to rent out electronic equipment when a job requires it. He wants to keep working so that he is able to continue supporting his family. 

He is asking for the loan for his car’s maintenance and to change the oil. He is very grateful for the loan and he agrees to meet the established pay schedule.

loans.use: to do car maintenance and to change its oil.

loans.name: Aidah

texts.en:
Aidah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has two children, but neither of them are currently in school. For the past two years, Aidah has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells tomatoes, charcoal, potatoes, and onions. 

To help expand her business, Aidah has requested a loan of 800,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy charcoal, cassava, tomatoes, and onions. This will help Aidah to generate greater profits and improve on her savings. Aidah hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, cassava, tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Mwaka

texts.en:
Mwaka is a married mother of seven children; five are in school and two are underage. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwaka has operated a grinding machine business at the market for the past five years. She cited seasonality as her major challenge in this business.

With the loan, Mwaka wants to purchase spare parts for her grinding machine. She joined Yehu to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for her grinding machine

loans.name: Oscar Michel

texts.es:
Oscar Michel tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Pucará, una comunidad de clima caluroso que su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica al comercio de CDs de películas y músicas, también realiza recargas virtuales de telefonía móvil y alquila video juegos cuenta con un play station, es un padre emprendedor ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería como variedad de CDs de películas y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes, lo que le generara mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Oscar Michel is 30 and lives with his wife and children in the district of Pucará. This is a community in Jaén province, part of the Cajamarca region in the mountains of Peru. It is an area with a warm climate, whose people work in agriculture, commerce and stock-breeding. He works selling music and films in CD format. He also offers mobile phone top-ups and hires out video games and play station equipment. He is an enterprising father.

He is asking for a loan through Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 PEN to buy more goods such as a variety of film CDs and sell these on to his customers. This will generate a better income for his family.

loans.use: to buy more goods such as a variety of film CDs.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy an air cooler and a big table.

loans.name: Chandana

texts.en:
Chandana is a housewife from Petkathi village, Mayanaguri, Jaipaiguri District. She is 29 years old, married to Kamal, and has two children who are too small to go to school. She wants her children to lead a very successful life with a good education in near future. Chandana is not much educated, studied up to grade 4. 

Her husband is a local van puller by trade. Chandana has her own incense-making business. She is engaged in this business to give additional financial support to her family. She is experienced in this field, that’s why she has chosen this business. After taking the loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner), she wants to improve her business and purchase raw materials. She gives a supply of incense to the local shops and her incense has a great demand in the locality. The strike of laborers creates a great difficulty in her business, but any difficulties cannot stop her to grow in her life as well as to flourish in her business. 

As she is a very courageous lady, she gives support to her husband and family. Her self-confidence and enormous skill make her a good entrepreneur, which helps her to improve their economic and social condition. She is grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase raw materials for her incense-making business.

loans.name: Batalika Tulibamu Group

texts.en:
Anosiata, with a hand raised, is a member of Batalika Tulibamu Group. He is 44 years old and has five children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He sells clothes and textiles; he obtained capital through the group loan. In addition to selling clothes, Anosiata earns additional income from his banana plantation. He faces the challenge of price fluctuations.

Anosiata requested a loan, which he will use to buy more clothes to sell. His aspiration is to build a house and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 16 years old and single. She lives in Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. For the past three years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells local food, tea, water, and sodas. 

Winnie requested a loan from BRAC Uganda for 500,000 Ugandan Shillings, which she will use to purchase a refrigerator to cool drinks. The loan will help Winnie to generate greater profits and increase her capital base. Winnie hopes that in the future she will be able to start an outside catering school.

loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator

loans.name: Mariano

texts.es:
Mariano tiene 40 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico junto a su esposa y sus 02 hijos. en el Caserío El Limón, una zona rural del distrito de Querocotillo, es una pequeña comunidad donde los habitantes se conocen, se dedican a la agricultura especialmente, ganadería y comercio, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura especialmente a sembrar maíz amarillo duro, para posteriormente ofrecerlo a los moradores de su caserío o como es costumbre vender en su distrito los días domingos, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 4000 nuevos soles para el pago por mantenimiento de su cultivo de maíz y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Mariano is 40 and lives in his own rustic-style house with his wife and their 2 children. They live in Caserío El Limón, a rural area in the district of Querocotillo. This is a small community where everybody knows each other, located in Cutervo province within the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. He works in agriculture, specifically in the sowing of hard yellow maize (feed corn) so that he can sell it on to local inhabitants or sell it in the typical way on Sundays in his district.

He is asking for a loan of 1,4000 PEN to pay to maintain his maize crop, and in this way to achieve a timely harvest to sell to his clients.

loans.use: to pay to maintain his maize crop.

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Mujeres Emprendedoras están en el 2do. ciclo con quince integrantes, se sienten motivadas a seguir trabajando y ver el progreso de sus emprendimientos para poder ayudar a sus familias.
Una de las integrantes la señora Eduvigis, quien es comerciante, ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que está luchando en su pequeño negocio para poder dar a su familia todo lo que no pudieron tener. Eduvigis pudo montar su negocio con mucho sacrificio y esfuerzo. 
Hoy pide este préstamo, que le permitirá surtir su despensa con todo tipo de productos, como ser carne, verduras, bebidas y demás.
texts.en:
The “Mujeres Emprendedoras” [Women Entrepreneurs] committee is in its second loan cycle with 15 members. They are motivated to continue working and to see the progress of their enterprises so that they are able to help their families. 

One of the members is Eduvigis, a shopkeeper. She is a very hardworking woman who is striving in her little business in order to give her family everything they couldn't have before.  She was able to set up the business with a lot of sacrifice and effort. 

Now she is asking for this loan that will allow her to stock up on all kinds of products such as meat, vegetables, beverages, and more.

loans.use: to buy meat, vegetables, beverages, and more.

loans.name: Noemy

texts.es: Noemy de 52 años de edad se dedica desde hace 3 años a la venta de calzado su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia y también vende de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, posee mucha clientela por la calidad del producto y los buenos precios, Noemy vive en casa de un familiar con su esposo y sus hijos, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de zapatos por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y así obtener mejores ingresos para poderle dar a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Noemy, a 52 year old woman, has worked for the last 3 years selling shoes. Her business is located in her house, but she also works as a street vendor, selling shoes in the different neighborhoods close to her house.  She has many customers due to the quality of her products and their good prices. 

Noemy lives in a house of a relative with her husband and her children. She is asking for a loan to buy wholesale shoes so that she can continue  with her sales. This way, she will have more income so that she is able to give to her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wholesale shoes

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah has two children and resides in Chuka, Kenya. For the past eight years, she has made a living selling milk, eggs, and tea produced on her farm. She is also engaged in other small short-term businesses. Fridah enjoys taking care of cows and preventing them from contracting prevalent diseases. 

Fridah requested a loan from Juhudi Kilimo, which she will use to purchase  poultry. The potential of the poultry business in Chuka is very high. Fridah joined Juhudi Kilimo to access loans with affordable interest rates. With the additional income, she will comfortably repay the loan on time and meet other business related expenses.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Ganzorig

texts.en:
Ganzorig is 32 years old and lives with his wife and twin sons in an apartment in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. His wife, Bolormaa, works at the local railway company. His sons are ten and go to the local school.

For more than a decade Ganzorig has run a booth at the local market where he sells jeans. He is an experienced and friendly man who has a regular customer base. His wife works extended hours, so he takes care of his sons.

Ganzorig closed his business temporarily. He is now opening it up again and so is applying for a 6,000,000 MNT loan through XacBank, which he will use to buy a large amount of inventory from Erlian, China to sell. He is a responsible borrower with good previous loan records at XacBank.

loans.use: to buy a large inventory of jeans to sell

loans.name: Rahaf Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Rahaf Al- Hodeidah is a group that consists of four women living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.

Samira is a 42-year-old married woman with four children and lives with them in a simple house in a poor area. Her oldest child is 13 years old and the youngest one is 8 years old. Samira is the leader of the group. She is an uneducated woman, but she works very hard. Samira decided to help her husband in covering the expenses of the family. Three years ago, Samira started her door-to-door business selling women's and children's clothes to the local residents in her area. From this business, she earns good profits, but she spends most of the interest on the expenses of the family. On the other side, she wants to enlarge her business, but she doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more women's and children's clothes and resell them to her customers.

In the future, Samira plans to expand her business through selling all kinds of clothes, makeup, cosmetics, accessories, and other items that will help her improve the living standards of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more women's and children's clothes

loans.name: Tinki

texts.en:
Tinki is a 20-year-old married woman. She has studied up to grade eight. She has her husband and one daughter in her family. Her poverty has not allowed her to receive more education. Now Tinki is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer of Maynaguri. 

Her husband’s income is not sufficient to run the family. Thus, she has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) for purchasing a cow so that she can sell milk and milk products in the market. 

Both Tinki and her husband work together and divide their work. They work long hours so that they can give a bright future to their child and provide her with a better life. This loan will give them an opportunity to improve her business, as well as her family’s financial status. 

Now Tinki lives in a kaccha house (made of straw and mud), but with the profit, they hope to build a pakka house (made of bricks and cement). 

Tinki is very happy after getting the loan. She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for their financial support.

loans.use: to purchase a cow for selling milk and milk products.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 12 y 7 años de edad. Victor trabaja como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad y es así como lleva el sustento a su hogar y da a su familia lo necesario. Con el deseo de mejorar sus condiciones de vida ha tomado la decisión de solicitar   este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la instalación de la energía eléctrica y para cambiar las puertas y ventanas de su vivienda que actualmente se encuentran deterioradas.
texts.en: Victor is 37 and lives in his own house with his life partner and their two children, ages 12 and 7.  He's employed by a company near where he lives, which is how he is able to sustain the house and give his family what they need.  With the objective of improving living conditions, he has decided to seek a loan from FUSAI to invest in the installation of electrical power and to change the doors and windows, which are now worn out.

loans.use: to invest in the installation of electric power and to buy doors and windows for his house.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 18 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Lydia has been working hard to manage her shoe shop, which sells second-hand ladies' and children's shoes. 

To help expand her business, Lydia has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes, and will help Lydia to generate greater profits and increase business capital. Lydia hopes that in the future she will be able to construct a house. 




"

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Tashinga Group

texts.en:
