Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is Esinath, the leader of Tashinga Group. She is 41 years old and married, with five children, ages 30, 18, 15, 12 and 7. Three of the children are still attending school. 

Esinath has been in a business for ten years and she sells to the local market. She has no other source of income. She says that the main challenge to her business is the lack of working capital to purchase maize, in bulk, to sell. 

Esinath requested this loan of USD 400 through MicroKing Finance, over six months, to buy maize, in bulk. She says the extra income from this loan will help her to increase her sales. 

In the future, she would like to purchase a truck to transport her maize stock.

loans.use: to buy maize, in bulk, to sell.

loans.name: Dúo Genesis Group

texts.es:
DUO GENESIS
El señor Domingo de 50 años, soltero,  desde hace 3 años posee un Molino de Nixtamal ubicado en Colonia Socobal Chimaltenango, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio él  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de don Domingo es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar Repuestos para su motor de nixtamal.
texts.en:
DUO GENESIS

Domingo is 50 years old. For the past 3 years, he has had a corn mill located in Colonia Socobal Chimaltenango. With great effort, he has been able to establish it and improve his housing. Through his business, he has supported and gotten his family ahead.

Domingo's dream is to be able to improve his and his family's quality of life through the micro-loan that he is applying to FAPE for. With the loan, he wants to buy spare parts for the motor of his mill.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for a corn mill.

loans.name: Lydiah

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Lydia. Lydia is a wife, a mother and a farmer with 15 years of experience in mixed farming. She lives in Chuka, Kenya, together with her 4 children on a small piece of land. She sells milk, eggs and tea that are produced at her farm. She is also involved in other small short-term businesses.
“In my free time, I like tending to my farm and animals. My biggest challenges are diseases and poor market conditions,” said Lydia. "Mwende" is what she named her dairy cow.

Lydia chose to join Juhudi Kilimo so that she can have access to quality loans at an affordable interest. After Lydia was trained, she came to appreciate the benefits of asset-based loans over conventional loans that can be used for consumption.

Through this loan, Lydia will generate enough income to take care of the high farming costs and expand her agricultural enterprise.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Battumur

texts.en:
Battumur is 36 years old lives with his wife and a son in their small house in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife, Ariuntuul, helps him run his retail jeans business. His son is 11 and studies at the local school. 
Battumur has been running his business in a rented outdoor booth at the local market since 2004. He is a hard-working and responsible man who has built a close relationship with his suppliers and customers over the years. He is now requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to expand his business with his wife selling jeans retail at another location to increase their family income.

loans.use: to expand his business with his wife selling jeans retail in another location to increase their family income

loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Greetings from Zimbabwe! This is 41-year-old Moses from Masvingo. He is married with three children and all are attending school. He also cares for one other dependent.

Moses runs a construction business producing bricks. The business has been in operation for 4 years. He says the main challenges faced are of stiff competition and high transport costs. Moses has requested a loan of $750 to buy a brick moulding machine. He says the extra income generated as a result of this loan will allow him an increase in income hence helping in the payment of school fees.

In the future, Moses plans to venture into commercial brick moulding.

loans.use: to buy a brick moulding machine

loans.name: Shubhobala

texts.en:
Shubhobala is a 44-year-old married woman of Maynaguri and blessed with one daughter. Her husband is 51 years old. Both of them are illiterate and can sign their names only. 

Shubhobala is a housewife, and her husband is a farmer. Her husband decided to farm, as they have their own land and her husband has experience in this field. They have decided to cultivate sugarcane in their field. In the summer season, there is a great demand for sugarcane in West Bengal, and it is the suitable time to cultivate sugarcane; thus, they decided to grow sugarcane.

Shubhobala has taken a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to purchase seedlings, pesticides, and insecticides for farming of sugarcane. After the harvest, they will sell the product in the wholesale market.

She hopes she will develop her business and with the profit, she can improve her family’s condition.

She is thankful and grateful to BJS and Kiva for the funding.

loans.use: to purchase seedlings, pesticides, and insecticides for cultivation of sugarcane.

loans.name: Mujeres Empresarias Group

texts.es: Lidia tiene 54 años de edad es soltera con hijos independientes. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza a través de catálogos.  Años atrás se dedicaba al servicio domestico. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más productos de belleza que estén en oferta para luego expenderlos a un precio que le generen mejores ganancias. Ella cumple la función de presidenta en el grupo “MUJERES ENPRESARIAS”. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas por el préstamo brindado.  Lidia es la segunda persona sentada del lado derecho viste pantalón beige.
texts.en:
Lidia is 54 years old. She is single with grown children. She makes her living selling beauty products through catalogs. Years ago, she made her living in domestic work.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of more beauty products that are on sale, in order to later sell them at a price that generates better earnings for her.

She is the president of the group "Mujeres Empresarias" [Business Women]. This group is grateful to the investors for the loan provided. Lidia is the second person seated from the right in beige pants.

loans.use: to buy more beauty products.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos tiene 35 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su esposa se dedican a la crianza de animales de corral patos, pollos, pavos y crianza de cerdos, Juan también brinda servicio de jornalearía en un molino de su distrito, tiene una familia unida, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales para el arreglo de los corrales donde cría a sus animales, lo que le permitirá tener una mejor distribución para el desarrollo de los mismos.
texts.en:
Juan Carlos is 35 years old, and he lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún, a community that works in agriculture, commerce, and animal husbandry, located in the province of Chiclayo, which is a part of the Lambayeque region, along the northern coast of Peru.

Along with his wife, they make a living raising barnyard animals: ducks, chickens, turkeys, and pigs. Juan also works as a day laborer at a mill in his district. He has a close-knit family, and he has requested a loan of 1000 nuevos soles (PEN) to buy materials to fix the pens where he raises his animals, which will allow him to distribute the animals better.

loans.use: to buy materials to fix the pens where he raises animals

loans.name: Bayarchimeg

texts.en:
Mrs. Bayarchimeg is 52 years old and lives with her husband and three children in their small house in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. Her husband works as a driver at a local company. Her older daughter studies abroad to get a qualified education and her older son works at a local private company. Her youngest son is currently staying home waiting to enroll in the university.
 
Bayarchimeg started her shoe retail business in a local market outdoor booth in 2006. She raised her children to become better people, supported her children to obtain a higher education and sent her daughter abroad. Her daughter works part-time to cover her living expense and pay her tuition. Bayarchimeg is now requesting loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase shoe inventory to sell at her counter to increase her family's income. She is a hardworking and enthusiastic woman.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell at her counter

loans.name: Nabil Group

texts.en:
Nabil is a group consisting of four women who live in Hodeidah, Yemen, and Hanan is its leader. Divorced, she is 32 years old, has two children and lives with them in a simple house in a poor area. As leader of her group she has applied for a 230,000 YER loan through AMB to be apportioned among the group members.

Hanan was in school up to the secondary level, but she couldn't complete her studies because she was married when she was very young. Her husband divorced her four years ago and left her with her two children. From that time on she assumed all responsibility for them.

Hanan is a very dynamic, determined and active woman. She didn't surrender to her miserable conditions. In order to provide her children with a secure future, she decided to sell ice cream in the hot and sunny streets. She has earned a good income doing so, but unfortunately, it is not sufficient to cover all the expenses of the family.

Hanan has been working with an old refrigerator that doesn't really keep the ice cream cold enough. With her 60,000 YER portion of the loan she will buy a new refrigerator to keep her ice cream hard.

Hanan looks forward to opening a small shop for selling sambusas (small, meat-stuffed triangular pastries) near a private school. She hopes to provide her children with a secure future.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator to keep her ice cream hard.

loans.name: Narciso

texts.es:
Narciso tiene 24 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, junto a su esposa e hijos en el Caserío de Naranjitos una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica al cultivo y venta de frutas, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, tiene experiencia en este rubro, su esposa le apoya en las labores de cosecha cocinado para brindarles los alimentos a su esposo y jornaleros que se encuentran realizando esta actividad, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes, generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Narciso is 24 years old. He lives in his own house made of rustic materials with his wife and children in the small village of Naranjitos in a rural area of the Pomahuaca district. It is a community with a warm climate. Its population makes its living growing and selling fruits. It is situated in the Jaén Province, which belongs to the Cajamarca Region, in the northern mountains of Peru.

He makes his living in farming, specifically growing coffee. He has experience in this line of work. His wife supports him in the harvesting work, cooking to provide food to her husband and day laborers who are working.

He has applied for a loan of 1,500 nuevos soles to buy compost for the upkeep of his coffee crop, so that he can get good output to offer his clients, generating better earnings for his family.

loans.use: to buy compost for the upkeep of his coffee crop.

loans.name: Rose Group

texts.en:
Rose is a group that consists of four women members living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They all came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them, save money and provide financial support to their families. They chose Taghrid as the leader of their group. She is a 30-year-old married woman with three children and lives with them in a poor area.

Since four months ago, Taghrid has been working door-to-door selling many kinds of accessories to her customers in the street. Taghrid is helping her husband in improving the living standards of the family. In order to improve her business, she has requested a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to purchase more accessories and makeup. Taghrid says that by selling these accessories she can support her family and she can send her children to a good school. Through that, she can provide a better education to her children.

loans.use: to buy accessories, cosmetics, and makeup

loans.name: Faiz Group

texts.en:
The Faiz Group is a group comprised of four women who are friends and neighbors. They live in different parts of the city of Hodeidah, Yemen, a hot climate area noted for its beautiful architecture. The members are friendly, kind people who charm visitors. They are hard workers who work hard every day to improve their household economies and get their families ahead.

One of the members is Hajer. She is a 42-year-old married woman. She has three children. Hajer runs a small business through selling women's clothes, perfumes, and incense in the street. She works Sunday to Sunday without a fixed schedule. Her work is her passion.

In order to enlarge her business, she asked for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB. The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of more retail goods to expand her business. Hajer's goal is to expand her business through opening a small shop for selling women's clothes and various kinds of accessories.

loans.use: to purchase more retail goods to expand her business

loans.name: Al-Salah 4 Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Salah 4. It is composed of four women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 80,000 YER from AMB.
Fotom is a hard-working woman. She is a 44-year-old divorced woman who is raising one son. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. Fotom started her business of selling ready-made clothes, perfumes, and incense three years ago. In the beginning, her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family. After her husband divorced her, Fotom assumed the responsibility of raising her child. She deals with her own business with ease.  She wants to purchase more ready-made clothes, perfumes, and incense to resell to her customers. Unfortunately, the income from this business is very low and most of what she earns goes to the expenses of the family. She wants to improve her business so she applied for a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB to purchase more  ready-made clothes, perfumes, incense, and other items.
Fotom looks forward to expanding her business by opening a small store selling ice cream. She wants to strengthen her activity in the perfumes and incense business. She hopes to provide her son with a secure future.

loans.use: to purchase more ready-made clothes, perfumes, incense, and other items and resell them.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en: Beatrice is a farmer who works hard to provide for her family. She has been able to buy two cows through her savings. She is, however, challenged by having to tether her cows since her land is unfenced. She has requested a loan to buy barbed wire so that she can fence her farm to prevent her cows from straying away to her neighbors' gardens. It will also enable her cows to graze freely and get healthier to produce more milk.

loans.use: To buy barbed wire to fence off her farm.

loans.name: Al-Shorok 2 Group

texts.en:
Al-Shorok 2 is a group consisting of four women living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB.
Fatima is the leader of the group. She is a 39-year-old married woman who lives with her spouse in a simple house in a poor area. Fatima is an uneducated woman. She works selling ice cream door-to-door and soft drinks in the street under the sunshine. She found her husband was unable to cover all the expenses of the family. For this reason, she decided to start her own business two years ago. She earns good profits, but most of what she earns goes to cover the expenses of her family. She wants to improve her business so she requested a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB in order to buy ice cream and soft drink items to sell. 
Fatima looks forward to opening a small stall in order to strengthen her business. She hopes to provide her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To buy ice cream and soft drink items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a car for transportation.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Hawa is 22 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past two years, Hawa has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells soap, sugar, rice, posho (maize flour), and other items. 

To help expand her business, Hawa has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more items like soap, sugar, rice, posho, and other items, and will help Hawa to generate greater profits and increase her business type. 

Hawa hopes that in the future, she will be able to own a wholesale shop.

loans.use: buy more items like soap, sugar, rice, posho, and other items.

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night is twenty years old and lives in Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year she has been working hard selling secondhand shoes.

To help boost her business, Night has requested a loan of 300,000 UGS through BRAC Uganda to buy more shoes. This loan will help her to earn more in profits and put more in savings. She hopes that in the future she will be able to build her own shop.

loans.use: buy more secondhand shoes to sell

loans.name: Choisuren

texts.en:
Mr. Choisuren is 31 years old. He lives with his wife and two children in a ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Ulaanbaatar city, Mongolia. His wife Herlenchimeg is a hairdresser and works at a local salon. His two children are both under the age of 8 and go to a local school and kindergarten respectively. 

Choisuren has been running his retail shoe business in a rented location for a year. He has been trying to expand his business by selling DVDs and CDs in the spare space. He is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase a hairdressing chair and other equipment for his wife to provide hairdressing services. He and his wife are hardworking and friendly people.

loans.use: to purchase a hairdressing chair and other salon equipment

loans.name: Erling Del Carmen

texts.es:
Desde su niñez, Erling disfrutaba  jugar con los cosméticos de su madre.  Nunca imaginó que en el futuro estos productos serían un medio esencial para ganarse el pan de cada día. Gracias a un financiamiento otorgado por KIVA MiCrédito logró comprar  perfumes, shampoos, esmaltes de uña y  maquillaje.  A pesar  de la fuerte  competencia que existe, ha conseguido clientes fieles que la prefieren por los buenos  precios  que ofrece.
Su esposo es un pilar  fundamental  en su vida.  Él se encarga de distribuir los productos por su comunidad. El mayor anhelo de Erling es llegar a ser una empresaria, asimismo,  desea  que el negocio continúe creciendo, por lo que  solicitó otro préstamo en KIVA MiCrédito para contar con una amplia mercadería, tales como: perfumes, shampoos, esmaltes de uña y  maquillaje de esa manera logrará satisfacer  las necesidades de sus clientes y no sufrirá escasez alguna.  Erling se siente muy agradecida con la institución porque le ha abierto las puertas al mundo del comercio.
texts.en:
Since childhood, Erling enjoyed playing with her mother's cosmetics. She never imagined that in the future, these products would be an essential means of earning her daily bread.

Thanks to a loan granted by Kiva, she was able to buy perfumes, shampoos, nail polish and makeup. In spite of fierce competition, she has found loyal customers who prefer her for the good prices she offers.

Her husband is a fundamental pillar in her life. He is responsible for distributing the products in her community.

Erling's greatest desire is to become a businesswoman. She also wants her business to continue growing, which is why she is applying for another loan from Kiva, so that she can have a wide range of merchandise, such as: perfumes, shampoos, nail polish and makeup, so that she can satisfy her customers' needs and not have any shortages.

Erling is very grateful to the institution, because it has opened many doors for her to the business world.

loans.use: to buy:  perfumes, shampoos, nail polish and makeup.

loans.name: Itihad Al- Nisa3 Group

texts.en:
The Itihad Al- Nisa3 group is a group consisting of five hardworking women from Hodeidah, Yemen. They have requested a group loan and will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Hamoda is a very active woman from a poor family.  She is the leader of the group. Her husband was the sole breadwinner of the family, but recently he became unable to take care of the family. Hamoda decided to assume the responsibility of the family. She wants to provide her family with the necessary needs.

In 2010, Hamoda started her business as a door to door salesperson selling women's clothes to the local residents in her area. She earns good profits, but most of what she earns goes to the expenses of the family. On the other side, Hamoda wants to enlarge her business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use her loan in order to expand her business through purchasing new items such as accessories, perfumes, and incense to resell to customers in her area.

Hamoda hopes to expand her business, which will help her to take care of her family.

loans.use: To purchase new items such as accessories, perfumes, and incense and resell them to customers in her area.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed is a 32-year-old married man. He has a Secondary school education. His neighbors have good things to say about him, and they describe him as a kind and hardworking man. 

As the source of income for his family, Mohammed has sold groceries and food products since 2013. He started this business with small capital. In the beginning, Mohammed decided to begin his own business through opening a small grocery store in his area. Thanks to Mohammed's hard work, he has been able to develop and expand his merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed Mohammed to expand his sales volume. For the purpose of further developing his business, Mohammed turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. He is requesting a loan to buy wholesale food items for future retail.

Mohammed plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase his business. He also intends to save money to perform a reconstruction of his house in the future. He wants to open a saving account in AMB.

loans.use: To buy wholesale food items for future retail.

loans.name: William De Jesús

texts.es:
William inicio su labor empíricamente hace aproximadamente 9 años por las ganas de ser una persona independiente, poder ser su propio jefe y manejar sus tiempos, por su amplio recorrido y experiencia es un vendedor de churros muy reconocido en el sector, añadiéndole en el último año venta de chicharrones que el mismo cocina en su casa.
Con el pasar del tiempo las ventas iban progresando e intento expandirse montando una sucursal atendida por su esposa pero pro problemas con una entidad reguladora de espacio público en el país tuvo que cerrar el negocio de su esposa ya que necesitan más ingresos para poder brindarle un estudio universitario a su hijo y que este no pase necesidades, por esta razón solicita un crédito para la compra de insumos como; servilletas, bolsas para empacar el producto y materia prima para aumentar su producción generando más ingresos con los que pueda cubrir los gastos universitarios de su hijo ya que entregara todo su ser por que este sea una persona preparada y tengo un mejor futuro y trabajo que él, viéndolo crecer y formarse como todo un profesional
texts.en:
William started working in his job around 9 years ago because he wanted to be an independent person, be his own boss, and manage his own time.  Because of his large service area and experience he's a very well known churro vendor in his area. Last year he added chicharrones that he himself cooks at home.  

As time goes on, his sales are progressing and he had planned to expand with another locale run by his wife.  However, due to problems with a state public space regulatory agency he had to close his wife's business.  They need more income to give their son a university education without giving up necessities, so William is seeking a loan to buy supplies, like napkins, bags for packaging his products, and raw materials to increase production.  That way he can pay for university expenses so his son can be prepared, have a better future, and a job that where he can grow and become a complete professional.

loans.use: to buy supplies like napkins, packaging bags, and raw materials to increase production and generate more income to cover his son's university costs.

loans.name: Zyad

texts.en:
Zyad is a 33-year-old married man and a father of one son. His son is only one years old. Zyad lives with his family in Sana'a, Yemen. He is an educated man. Recently, he is a soldier in The Yemeni army. Over time, Zyad accumulated a good amount of money from his salary and purchased a taxi transport. He started in this business three years ago. He works as a driver of the taxi. Unfortunately, most of what he earns from this business goes to repair the taxi. He spends most of his money and time to repair the taxi. So, his taxi needs to be repaired, but Zyad doesn't have enough money to do that. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to buy spare parts for the taxi. These new spare parts will help him save a lot of money.

Zyad's vision is to purchase other taxi transports to rent. He hopes to open a saving account with AMB. He thinks he will buy a piece of land and build his own house.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi

loans.name: Jalal

texts.en:
Jalal is a 32-year-old married man and a father of three children living with them in Sana'a, Yemen. They live in a rented house. Jalal studied until secondary school, but he couldn't complete his education. Despite not completing his studies, he is a very active and dynamic man. In the beginning, his father supported him financially in order to begin his business. Over time, Jalal accumulated a good amount of money. He decided to begin his business by buying a minibus for transportation. Three years ago, Jalal started his business as a driver of his minibus. This transportation is the only source of income for his family. Recently, this minibus became very old and needs maintenance and repairs. Unfortunately, Jalal doesn't have enough money and needs financial support. For this reason, Jalal is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase new spare parts for the bus and a new machine to improve his condition.

Jalal looks forward to purchasing a new bus and renting it to a private school.

loans.use: To purchase new spare parts for the bus

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya is 39 years old, married and raising four sons. His oldest child is nine years old and the youngest is just a year. He earned a high school diploma. His neighbors have good things to say about him, describing him as a kind and hardworking man.

Yahya has sold groceries and food for many years. He started his shop with a small bit of capital. Thanks to his hard work he has been able to grow and develop his merchandise. The profits from this business have allowed him to increase his sales volume.

For the purpose of further developing his business, Yahya turned to Al-Amal Microfinance Bank. He is requesting a loan of 200,000 YER to buy groceries wholesale for future retail sale. He plans to invest the earnings from the loan to further increase his business.

Yahya also intends to save money to open another grocery shop. He is striving to provide excellent support for his family.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale for future retail sale.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. 

For the past two years, Winnie has been working hard to manage her salon business, which deals in plaiting, weaving, and the treatment of hair. 

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of UGX 950,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a refrigerator, dryers, and chemicals and will help Winnie to generate greater profits and increase her capital. 

Winnie hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open up a bigger salon.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, dryers, and chemicals for her salon.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is 20 years old and lives in the town of Seeta, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. 

For the past two years, Faith has been working hard to manage her food stall, where she sells fruit, vegetables, and charcoal. 

To help expand her business, Faith has requested a loan of UGX 400,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy charcoal, potatoes, cassava, and fruit and will help Faith to generate greater profits and increase her savings. 

Faith hopes that, in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land.

loans.use: buy charcoal, potatoes, cassava, and fruit to sell.

loans.name: Guadesia

texts.en:
Guadesia is 17 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years she has been working hard managing her food sales of chapatis, beans and samosas.

To help expand her business, Guadesia has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from BRAC Uganda. The money will be used to buy flour, beans and a charcoal stove and will help her to earn more in profits and put more in savings. Guadesia hopes that in the future she will be able to open a cafe.

loans.use: to buy flour, beans and a charcoal stove

loans.name: El Sol De Cupiche Group

texts.es: “EL SOL DE CUPICHE” está conformada por socios ansiosos por obtener una mejor calidad de vida para sus familias. Juan tiene 26 años de edad es conviviente. El se dedica a prestar servicios de taxistas hace 05 años. Años atrás se dedicaba a prestar servicios de operario. El crédito lo invertirá en el mantenimiento de su vehículo. Su mayor deseo es crear su empresa de transportes. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el préstamo brindado. Juan es la primera persona parada del lado izquierdo.
texts.en: “El Sol De Cupiche” is made up of partners anxious to obtain a better quality of life for their families. Juan is 26 and one of the members of the group. For the past 5 years he has provided taxi services. Years before, he worked as an operator. He will invest the credit in the maintenance of his vehicle. His greatest desire is to launch his own transportation company. The group thanks the KIVA investors for the loan provided. Juan is the first person standing from the left.

loans.use: With maintenance for their vehicle

loans.name: Gulsara

texts.ru: Трудолюбивый человек, который всегда старается развевать свой бизнес и получать больше дохода, нуждается финансовой поддержки. Ее зовут Гулсара. Она родилась в 1975 году. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Так как она живет в сельской местности, так и имеет хорошую возможность для развития своего бизнеса, скотоводством. Она более 18 лет занимается скотоводством и имеет большой опыт по данной отрасли бизнеса. Она хочет развевать бизнес и получать больше дохода. С полученного дохода она планирует улучшить условию проживания. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки скота. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Here is a hardworking person who is always trying to grow her business and make a higher income.  She needs financial support.  Her name is Gulsara and she was born in 1975.  She's married and raising three children.  She lives in a rural area so she has a good opportunity to cultivate her cattle business.  She's been in business for more than 18 years and has a great deal of experience her field.  She would like to grow the business and bring in more income, which she plans to use to improve her living conditions. She's seeking a loan of 7500 soms to buy cattle.  She awaits your beneficence.

loans.use: to buy cattle to increase working capital.

loans.name: Artemio Jose

texts.es:
Artemio José, tiene 29 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, junto a su esposa y dos menores hijos, en el Caserío de Chinchagual, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

EL se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, tiene experiencia en el rubro, su esposa le apoya en esta labor, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo y de esta manera tener una producción oportuna para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Artemio José is 29 years old and lives in his own house, made of rustic materials, with his wife and two young children, in the hamlet of Chinchagual, a rural area of the Pomahuaca district in the province of Jaen, which belongs to the Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru. The local people work in agriculture, commerce and livestock.

Artemio José works in agriculture, specifically in growing coffee, and has experience in this area. His wife helps him in his work. He has asked for a loan of 1,0000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa to  buy manure to feed his crop so he can have a harvest which is just right to offer to his customers.

loans.use: to buy manure to feed his coffee crop.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel tiene 24 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Buenos Aires, una comunidad de clima caluroso que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Morropon que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público, trasladando a sus pasajeros por zonas aledañas a su distrito, también se dedica a la crianza de animales menores como patos y gallinas, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 2 500 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlo a sus clientes a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Manuel is 24-years-old and lives in the Buenos Aires district, a community with a hot climate where the people work in agriculture, business, and livestock.  It's located in Morropon Province in the Piura region on the north coast of Peru.  

Manuel provides public transportation services, transporting passengers to areas neighboring his district.  He also raises young animals like ducks and hens.  He is seeking a loan of 2,500 soles from Edpyme Alternativa to buy parts for his vehicle and balanced feed to fatten up his animals so he can offer his clients a better price.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle and balanced food to fatten up his animals.

loans.name: Lorena

texts.es: La Señorita Lorena tiene 24 años y es soltera,  estudia la carrera  de Fisioterapia en una universidad muy reconocida de la ciudad de Cochabamba, la Señorita Lorena trabaja  para pagar sus estudios trabaja de ayudante de cocina, este es su primer crédito que ha tomado con la institución,  la Señorita Lorena va a usar este préstamo para  distintos gastos  que implica el estudiar como compra de una laptop para sus estudios que durara el tiempo tres años,  la Señorita Lorena enfrenta retos en su estudios que son falta de apoyo económico  por parte de sus padres y el tener que trabajar y estudiar es muy duro pero ella tiene ganas de seguir adelante superarse terminar su carrera y poder ejercer su profesión,  viven en la localidad de Sacaba, su deseo es poder hacer una maestría y así de esta manera poder tener más ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Lorena is 24 years old and she is single. She studies physiotherapy at a very well-recognized university in the city of Cochabamba. Lorena works to pay for her studies; she works as a kitchen assistant. 

This is her first loan that she has taken out with the institution. Lorena will use this loan for various expenses involved in her studies, such as the purchase of a laptop for her studies, which will last three years. Lorena faces challenges in her studies that include a lack of economic support from her parents, and having to work and study. It is very hard, but she wants to move forward and to improve herself, and she wants to finish her degree and be able to work in her profession. They live in the locality of Sacaba. Her goal is to be able to do a Masters program and that way, be able to have more income.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Esther, a mother of six. She lives in Nyamira with her family on a small piece of land where she has been growing tea and bananas for sixteen years. Besides selling her harvest from the farm, she has other small business ventures from which she makes money.

Esther takes pride in being a tea farmer even though the returns from this crop do not come in regularly. Therefore, she is seeking a 62,400 KES loan through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a dairy cow. Selling milk daily will provide a regular and predictable income to meet recurring family expenses.

Raising capital has always been her and other women’s biggest challenge. In communities such as hers, women are largely expected to play a domestic role rather than being breadwinners.

With your loan Esther will be able to increase her assets and generate enough income to send her children to good schools.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen De Moron Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Virgen Del Carmen De Morón” conformada por 06 mujeres emprendedoras y dinámicas. Janet de 37 años casada con 07 hijos independiente. Ella se dedica a la venta abarrotes. Producto de su esfuerzo es que ha mejorado su casa y apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, azúcar, leche, y bebidas. Su mayor anhelo es de seguir mejorando su tienda. El grupo “Virgen Del Carmen De Morón” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible este crédito, la cual contribuye en su progreso. Janet es la primera del lado derecho, viste polo rosado.
texts.en: This is the "Virgen del Carmen de Morón" group, made up of six hardworking and dynamic women.  Janet, 37, is married with seven independent children.  She earns her living selling groceries.  Through her efforts she has improved her house and been supportive with household expenses.  In order to continue improving she is seeking a loan to buy rice, sugar, milk, and drinks.  Her biggest dream to to continue improving her store.  The "Virgen del Carmen de Morón" is grateful to the people who have made this loan, which contributes to their progress, possible.  Janet is pictured first on the right, in a pink shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, and drinks.

loans.name: Edwin

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Edwin. The father of three has been practicing mixed farming in Nyamira, a banana-growing region of Kenya, for the last ten years! He sells milk, eggs, and bananas, all produce from his farm. To make extra money for his family, Edwin also holds a job that pays him a monthly salary.

If there is one thing Edwin is good at, it is raising farm animals! Maritati, his dairy cow, is very well taken care of. She gets the best feed and medical care Edwin can provide. However, his biggest challenge is raising capital. Edwin has a sound investment plan that will push him to the next level.

Edwin is seeking a loan through Kiva to purchase a water tank. A constant availability of water at his homestead will make work very easy for him. His farm animals and poultry will have a constant flow of drinking water, his family will have water for domestic use at the doorstep, and the crops on the farm will grow green and healthy through irrigation. 

With your contribution, Edwin will seek to increase the number of animals on his farm.

loans.use: to purchase a water tank.

loans.name: Zonia

texts.es: La señora Zonia  tiene 36 años, casada con tres hijos de las edades de 18, 12 años y un bebe de 8 meses,  ella se dedica a la actividad del tejido de chompas y mantas de Alpaca para las mujeres, tiene su taller y domicilio en la zona de  Max Paredes , solicita el crédito para la  compra de una maquina hiladora de lana  para el tejido de mantas ya que tiene mucha demanda y tiene pedidos que entregar, también entrega pedidos a los distintos mercados de la ciudad de La Paz, se siente feliz y agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva por la oportunidad que le dan para crecer en su negocio.
texts.en:
Zonia is 36 years old, married, and has 3 children, ages 18, 12, and a baby of 8 months.  She knits womens' sweaters and shawls of alpaca wool. Zonia has her shop and home in the Max Paredes zone.

She is requesting a loan to purchase a wool spinning machine for use in knitting shawls, an item much in demand. Zonia has many orders to fill. In fact, orders are arriving even from distant markets in the city of La Paz. 

Zonia feels happy and grateful for the Kiva lenders and the opportunity they provide for expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy a spinning machine.

loans.name: Dúo Ana De Vista Hermosa Group

texts.es: Dúo Ana de vista hermosa En este grupo la señora Ana Patricia es la encargada, tiene una venta de pollo,y como actividad secundaria vende calzado, chamarras y cosméticos como cremas, desodorantes, colonias para damas, adultos y niños.  Tiene una entrega  grande de pollo que hacer y le hace falta algunos pollos para no fallarle a su compradora, el dinero que tiene no le alcanza y se ve en la necesidad de hacer un préstamo para aprovechar la venta.  Al lado de sus dos hijos se siente muy contenta y con la ayuda de su esposo desea alcanzar sus sueños el cual es tener una gran tienda y llegar a ser una distribuidora en su aldea.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ana Patricia is in charge of the group "Dúo Ana de Vista Hermosa," she sells chicken and as a secondary activity sells footwear, jackets and cosmetics such as creams, deodorants and fragrances for women, adults and kids. 
She has a large order of chicken to fulfill and she is a few chickens short of meeting her buyer's request and does not want to fail her. The money she has is not enough and she is finding herself in need of a loan in order to take advantage of the sale. She is very happy beside her children and with the help of her husband she wishes to reach her dreams which are to have a big store and eventually become a distributor in her village.

loans.use: buy chicken for sale

location.town: Aldea Vista Hermosa, San Pedro Sacatepequez

loans.name: Rene Humberto

texts.es: René de 33 años de edad vive junto con su grupo familiar, es un hombre muy responsable quien siempre está en miras de mejorar su estabilidad económica. El trabaja en su propia panadería en la que elabora pan francés y pan dulce, el cual elabora él solo a primeras horas de la madrugada para poder venderlo antes del desayuno, que es cuando las personas más lo consumen al igual que en la cena. René solicita un préstamo a INTEGRAL, para contar con la ayuda necesaria para invertir en la compra de harina, levadura, manteca, latas y todo lo necesario para poder producir más. Este proyecto de mejoramiento para su panadería es muy importante para él  puesto que así mejorará su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
René is 33 years old and lives with his family. He is a responsible man who is always looking to improve his financial stability. René works in his own bakery where he produces French bread and sweet bread. He prepares his products by himself during the early hours of the dawn so that he can sell them in time for breakfast, which is when most people eat his bread. However, it is just as popular during dinner.

René is requesting a loan from Apoyo Integral, which will help him invest in necessary supplies such as flour, yeast, shortening, baking tins, and everything else he needs to produce more bread. This improvement project for his bakery is very important to him since it will allow him to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy flour, yeast, shortening, baking tins, and other necessary supplies.

loans.name: Consuelo

texts.es:
Consuelo tiene 47 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores patos, gallinas y cuyes, su negocio se encuentra ubicada en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales de construcción para su vivienda y de esta manera tener un lugar agradable donde residir.
texts.en:
Consuelo is 47, she lives with her husband and children in the Cayaltí district, a community dedicated to agriculture, commerce and cattle raising, located in the Chiclayo province which belongs to the Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.

She raises and sells small animals such as ducks, chickens and guinea pigs, her business is located behind her home. She is asking for a loan of 2,000 Nuevos Soles to purchase construction materials for her residence in order to have a pleasant place to live.

loans.use: purchase materials for the construction of a wall for her residence

loans.name: Weltaare Group

texts.fr:
Mme OUMOU est responsable du groupe WELTAARE. Mariée, elle mère de 09enfants. Le plus âgé a 27ans et le moins âgé a 04ans. Tous vont à l’école. Elle a 10personnes en charge.
Mme vend des céréales et du miel  depuis 20ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les villages voisins. 
Elle veut s’acheter 02sacs de mil et 01boite de miel.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Oumou is the leader of Weltaare Group. She is married and the mother of nine children, the eldest of whom is 27 years old and the youngest is four. All of them attend school. Mrs. Oumou has 10 people in her care.

Mrs. Oumou has been selling grains and honey for 20 years. She gets her supplies in neighboring villages. She wants to purchase two sacks of millet and one container of honey.

Mrs. Oumou wants to use her profits to expand her business. Her goal is to ensure her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase two sacks of millet and one container of honey.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase supplies for the preparation of her dishes

loans.name: Immaculate

texts.en:
Immaculate is 21 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Immaculate has been working hard to manage her retail shop selling sugar, soap, salt, posho, rice, cooking oil, tissue, and toothpaste. 

To help expand her business, Immaculate has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, soap, salt, posho, rice, cooking oil, tissue, and toothpaste and will help Immaculate to generate greater profits and increase the family earnings and savings. Immaculate hopes that in the future, she will be able to open a wholesale shop. 




"

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, salt, posho, rice, cooking oil, tissue and toothpaste

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 22 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Christine has been working hard to manage her clothing shop, selling ladies and children's clothes. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more second hand clothes and will help Christine to generate greater profits and increase her business size. Christine hopes that in the future, she will be able to open a clothing shop. 




"

loans.use: to buy more second hand clothes

loans.name: Graciela Vilma

texts.es:
Vilma tiene 60 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Pucará, una zona de calor, donde su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

Ella brinda el servicio de recepcion y envio de encomiendas de una empresa de Turismo, el lugar de la oficina es su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 500 nuevos soles para la compra de materiales para el arreglo de las paredes de su negocio y de esta manera tener un lugar apropiado para realizar su trabajo.
texts.en:
Vilma is 60 years old and lives with her daughter in the district of Pucará, a warm area where the people engage in agriculture, trade and livestock raising. It is located in Jaén province belonging to the Cajamarca Region, in the northern mountains of Perú.

She offers a parcel delivery and receiving service for a tourism business from her office, which is located in her residence. She has requested a loan of S/.1,500 from Edpyme Alternative in order to purchase materials to fix the walls of her office.  In this way, she will have an appropriate venue within which to conduct her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials to fix the walls of her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: La Grace Group

texts.fr:
Mme FATIMATA est responsable du groupe LA GRACE. Mariée, elle est mère de 04enfants. Le plus âgé a 14ans et le moins âgé a 01an. 03vont à l’école. Elle a 07personnes en charge.
Mme vend des pagnes depuis 10ans. Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé.
Elle veut s’acheter 08complets pagnes.
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices pour se réapprovisionner. Elle ambitionne ouvrir une boutique et assurer la scolarité des enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatimata is the leader of La Grace Group. She is married and the mother of four children, the eldest of whom is 14 years old and the youngest of whom is one year. Three attend school. Mrs. Fatimata has seven people in her care.

Mrs. Fatimata has been selling pagne [traditional fabric] outfits for 10 years. She gets her supplies in Lomé. She wants to purchase eight pagne outfits.

Mrs. Fatimata will use her profits to restock. Her goal is to open a shop and ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: To purchase eight outfits made from pagnes [traditional fabric].

loans.name: Disodani Group

texts.fr:
Mme ADJARRA est responsable du groupe DISODANI. Mariée, elle est mère de 05enfants. Le plus âgé a 21ans et le moins âgé a 11ans. 04vont à l’école. Elle a 04personnes en charge.
Mme vend des produits de beauté depuis 03ans. Elle s’approvisionne à dans les grandes boutiques de la place.
Elle veut s’acheter plusieurs articles (pommades, parfums, vernis à ongle etc.).
Mme veut utiliser ses bénéfices afin d’agrandir son commerce. Elle ambitionne acheter des parcelles (terrains) pour ses enfants et assurer leur  scolarité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adjarra is the leader of the Disodani Group. She is married and the mother of five children, the eldest of whom is 21 years old and the youngest of whom is 11 years old. Four [of her children] attend school. Mrs. Adjarra has four people in her care.

Mrs. Adjarra has been selling beauty products for three years. She gets her supplies from the large shops in the plaza and wants to purchase several items (creams, perfume, nail polish, etc.).

Mrs. Adjarra wants to use her profits to expand her business. Her goal is to purchase plots of land for her children and to ensure their education.

loans.use: To purchase several items (creams, perfume, nail polish, etc.).

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 20 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Christine has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells sugar, milk, soap, rice, posho, and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Christine has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items like sugar, milk, soap, rice, posho, and cooking oil, and will help Christine to generate greater profits and increase her earnings. Christine hopes that in the future, she will be able to expand her business. 




"

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, milk, soap, rice, posho, and cooking oil

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past two years, Lillian has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, milk, soap, rice, posho (maize flour), and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Lillian has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to purchase more items like sugar, milk, soap, rice, posho, and cooking oil, and will help Lillian to generate greater profits and increase her capital. 

Lillian hopes that in the future, she will be able to open up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, milk, soap, rice, posho, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past two years, Justine has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells sugar, soap, salt, posho (maize flour), and rice. 

To help expand her business, Justine has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more sugar, soap, salt, posho, and rice, and will help Justine to generate greater profits and increase her business. 

Justine hopes that in the future, she will be able to complete her house.

loans.use: to buy more sugar, soap, salt, posho, and rice.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is 22 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Joan has been working hard to manage her food stall business, where she sells raw food. 

To help expand her business, Joan has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy cassava, potatoes, and bananas, and will help Joan to generate greater profits and increase her business size. Joan hopes that in the future she will be able to buy a plot of land for her business.

loans.use: buy cassava, potatoes, and bananas

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is 18 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Sarah has been working hard to manage her restaurant, which sells cooked local food items and tea. 

To help expand her business, Sarah has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy saucepans and a fridge, and will help Sarah to generate greater profits and expand her business. Sarah hopes that in the future she will be able to open up a hotel.

loans.use: to buy saucepans and a fridge

loans.name: Hadijah

texts.en:
Hadijah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Hadijah has been working hard to manage her food vending business in which she sells chicken and bananas. 

To help expand her business, Hadijah has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more chicken for the business and will help Hadijah to generate greater profits and open another outlet for children's clothes. Hadijah hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a plot of land. 




"

loans.use: to buy more chickens for the business

loans.name: Oliver

texts.en:
Oliver is 21 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Oliver has been working hard to manage her retail shop where she sells sugar, milk, soap, rice, posho and cooking oil. 

To help expand her business, Oliver has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy sugar, milk, soap, rice, posho, and cooking oil and will help Oliver to generate greater profits and expand the business. Oliver hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy land and go back to school. 




"

loans.use: to buy sugar, milk, soap, rice, posho and cooking oil

loans.name: Annet

texts.en:
Annet is 23 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past two years, Annet has been working hard to manage her salon business, which deals in plaiting, weaving, and treating hair. 

To help expand her business, Annet has requested a loan of 900,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy weaves, chemicals, and braids and will help Annet to generate greater profits and improve her services. Annet hopes that in the future, she will be able to build a residential home.

loans.use: to buy weaves, chemicals, and braids

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 23 years old and lives in the town of Kayunga in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is married and has two children who are both currently in school. For the past three years, Margret has been working hard to manage her retail shop, where she sells posho (maize flour), soft drinks, sugar, soap, beans, and rice. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 600,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more posho, rice, soap, soda, and bottled water, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and increase her capital and savings. 

Margret hopes that in the future, she will be able to construct a business house.

loans.use: to buy more posho, rice, soap, soda, and bottled water.

loans.name: Dúo Luz Del Mundo Group

texts.es: Dúo Luz del Mundo este Grupo esta conformado por la señora Maria Maribel de 33 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa tipica desde hace 2 años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mas mercaderia en ropa tipica para la venta ya que el capital que tiene no le alcanza para cubrir los pedidos que le hacen sus clientes, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el credito solicitado.
texts.en:
The Luz del Mundo (Light of the World) Duo includes Maria Maribel, age 33.  She has worked selling traditional clothing for two years.  

At this point in time she is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise (traditional clothing) to sell because her capital doesn’t stretch to cover the orders that her customers make.  She is hoping to be helped with this requested loan.

loans.use: to buy traditional clothes to sell

loans.name: Las Conquistadoras - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento LAS CONQUISTADORAS – 32 Está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco es la Sra.  Daysi tiene 50 años y tres hijos de las edades de 23, 28 y 35 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida en su puesto de venta que se encuentra en su mismo domicilio por la zona América,  el destino del crédito es para la compra de insumos al por mayor como aceite y verduras al por mayor para elaboración de sus comidas, la señora Daysi es una persona muy trabajadora lleva años en esta actividad está muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado a ella ya que esta es la única actividad con la que mantiene a su familia y también agradecida por la ayuda a sus compañeras de grupo ya que en muchos casos mantienen solas a sus familias.
texts.en:
The business venture bank Las Conquistadores - 32 is made up of eight members: seven women and one man.  The bank president is Señora Daysi.  She is 50 years old and has three children, ages 23, 28, and 35.  She works selling meals in a stand found in her home in the América zone.  

The use of the loan is to buy ingredients in bulk, such as wholesale oil and vegetables, to make her meals.  Señora Daysi is a very hardworking person who has been in this line of work for years.  She is very thankful to the institution for the help given to her because this is the only job she can do to support her family.  She is also grateful for the help to her group mates, because in many cases they are supporting their families alone.

loans.use: to buy supplies in bulk

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco tiene 59 años de edad, vive junto a su hijo en el distrito de Oyotun, una comunidad tranquila con un clima variado, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Junto a su hijo se dedican a la compra y venta de animales de corral, su negocio se encuentra ubicado en la parte posterior a su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de alimentos balanceados para engorde de sus animales y de esta manera ofrecerlo a un mayor precio.
texts.en:
Francisco is 59, he lives with his son in the Oyotun district, a calm community with a varied climate located in the Chiclayo province of the Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.
Him and his son earn a living buying and selling barnyard animals, their business is located behind their home. He has requested a loan, from Edpyme Alternative, for 500 Nuevos soles to purchase animal feed to fatten his animals allowing him to offer them at a higher price.

loans.use: purchase feed to fatten his animals.

loans.name: Cooproriz Nyiramageni G1 Group

texts.en:
Leocadie is 36 years old. She is married with three children. She has been working as a rice farmer for the past 17 years. She will use her portion of the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production: the farmers need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming, Leocadie wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity.  

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy  more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Erminia Marizol

texts.es: La señora Erminia tiene 37  años, es casado tiene tres hijos de 3, 5 y 7 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de artículos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran ubicado en su mismo domicilio que es en la zona de Villa del Carmen de la ciudad de La Paz,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  la señora Erminia va a usar este préstamo para a la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes, dulces, galletas y variedad de refrescos, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es necesidad de surtir su tienda ya que esta época tiene mucha demanda, la señora Erminia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que en la zona hay muchas tiendas de barrio, ella va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando mercadería y así incrementar su capital y poder tener un almacén ya que este es uno deseos, se siente feliz y agradecida por esta oportunidad que le brindan.
texts.en:
Erminia is 37 years old. She is married and has 3 children aged 3, 5 and 7 years old. She sells basic food items in her neighborhood store which is located in her house in the Villa del Carmen area of the city of La Paz.

This is her second loan from this institute. Erminia will use this loan to buy merchandise to stock her store like groceries, sweets, biscuits and a variety of drinks. The reason for the loan is her need to stock her store. At this time of the year there is a lot of demand. Erminia has challenges in running her business such as competition. There are a lot of stores in the neighborhood. She will use the profits to keep on buying merchandise and increase her capital as having a bigger store is one of her wishes. She is pleased and grateful for the opportunity being offered her.

loans.use: to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret is 23 years old and lives in the town of Mukono in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Margret has been working hard to manage her food stall, which sells potatoes, cassava, tomatoes, and onions. 

To help expand her business, Margret has requested a loan of 950,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more potatoes, cassava, tomatoes, and onions, and will help Margret to generate greater profits and save capital for her child. Margret hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy land for agriculture. 




"

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, cassava, tomatoes, and onions

loans.name: Prossy

texts.en:
Prossy  is 20 years old and lives in the town of Seeta in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past three years, Prossy has been working hard to manage her salon business, which deals in plaiting, weaving and treatment of hair. 

To help expand her business, Prossy has requested a loan of 600000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda to buy two dryers. This will help her to generate greater profits and increase her number of clients. 

Prossy hopes that in the future she will be able to construct rental units.

loans.use: buy two dryers

loans.name: Cooproriz Nyiramageni G2 Group

texts.en:
Vincent is 53 years old. He is a father of six children and they all go to school. With a Kiva loan, he would like to pay labor costs and fertilizer during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizers in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future, he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity.  

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and pay labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Muchos saboreamos en nuestro paladar los deliciosos frijoles que se cultivan en el país, sin embargo, desconocemos su origen y quienes lo producen. Juan Castro es uno de ellos.  Se ha dedicado a la agricultura desde su adolescencia y gracias a los préstamos otorgados por KIVA MiCrédito ha logrado comprar los aditivos necesarios para combatir las plagas de sus cultivos, ofreciendo al mercado productos de alta calidad. Las ganancias le han servido para mejorar su vivienda, también adquirió un ternero. 
Juan no solo planea dedicarse a la producción del frijol. Sus próximos proyectos son construir un pequeño pozo artesanal  que servirá como riego en sus cultivos y también desea plantar  tomates.  Por lo tanto, necesitará capital para esta nueva inversión. El recurrió al apoyo de KIVA MiCrédito para la compra de pesticidas y abonos que utilizará en la siembra.  Aunque es un producto muy competitivo, siempre se logran obtener buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Many of us savor on our palate the delicious beans cultivated in the country, nevertheless we are unaware of their origin and those who produce them.  Juan Castro is one of those producers. He has dedicated himself to farming since he was an adolescent and, thanks to the loans provided by KIVA MiCrédito, he has been able to purchase the additives he needs in order to combat pest infestations of his crops. Consequently, he has been able to bring high quality products to market. His profits have enabled him to improve his dwelling and also to acquire a calf.

Juan does not plan to engage solely in the production of beans. His next projects are to build a small artesian well that will serve to irrigate his crops and he also wants to plant tomatoes. Therefore, he will need capital for these new investments. He turned to support from KIVA MiCrédito in order to purchase the pesticides and fertilizer he will use at planting. Although beans are a competitive product, they always yield good profits.

loans.use: to purchase pesticides and fertilizer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs for her coffee and corn crops.

loans.name: Dúo Eva Group

texts.es: Dúo Eva, integrado por doña María Armenia,es casada y tiene dos hijos, quienes ya estudian, su esposo es chofer de transporte pesado en varias rutas. Armenia  se dedica a la venta de ropa para niños de cero a diez años, trajes completos, también vende suéteres y blusas para dama, lencería,  desde hace cuatro años en el mercado municipal de Santiago, doña Armenia tuvo problemas de salud pues estuvo enferma pero ahora está feliz ya que esta bien de salud, y ya trabajando en su negocio y así recuperarse, está feliz pues ayuda económicamente a su esposo.
texts.en:
The Eva Duo includes María Armenia.  She is married and has two children who are already in school.  Her husband is a heavy freight driver on various routes.  

Armenia works selling complete outfits for children ages 0 through 10, as well as sweaters and tops for women and eyewear.  She has done this for four years in the Santiago town market.  

Doña Armenia had health problems and was sick, but now she is happy because she is in good health and already working in her business.  In this way, she is recuperating.  She is happy because she is helping her husband financially.

loans.use: to buy clothing to sell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 22 years old and lives in the town of Seeta, in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has no children. For the past year, Esther has been working hard to manage her restaurant, where she sells cooked food, sodas, and water. 

To help expand her business, Esther has requested a loan of UGX 500,000 (Ugandan shillings) from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy a refrigerator and will help Esther to generate greater profits and increase her personal savings. 

Esther hopes that, in the future, she will be able to open a hotel and provide outside catering services.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her restaurant.

loans.name: Dúo Cristo Rey De Sumpango Group

texts.es:
Dúo Cristo Rey de sumpango
Este dúo esta conformado por doña Ingrid de 44 años de edad es madre de familiam,ella  se dedica a la elaboración de tejidos típicos de Sumpango, todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para poder empezar a realizar  los que áceres de su hogar para después  dedicarle tiempo a su negocio ella necesita un crédito en kiva ya que sueña con un negocio mas grande además promete pagar puntualmente, esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion y venta de tejidos tipicos para la venta.
texts.en:
Cristo Rey de Sumpango Duo

This duo includes Doña Ingrid, age 44.  She is the mother of a family.  She works making traditional Sampango textiles.  Every day she gets up very early to be able to begin to do the household chores so that afterwards she can give time to her business.  

She needs a Kiva loan because she dreams of a bigger business. She is asking for this loan to buy raw materials to make and sell traditional textiles.  Also, she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy raw materials to make and sell traditional textiles

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more red oil, onion, pepper, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan es una persona de 55 años de edad, vive con su familia en el municipio de Sololá, departamento de Sololá, tiene 7 hijos, 5 mujeres y 2 hombres, Juan se dedica al cultivo de zanahoria y papas, él eligió esta actividad por que le permite estar cerca de su familia y sin salir del lugar de donde vive para obtener sus ingresos y así mantener a su familia, Juan solicita un crédito por un monto de Q. 8,000.00 para comprar insumos para el cultivo de zanahoria y papas, él en el futuro quiere tener capital propio para realizar esta actividad
texts.en:
Juan is a 55 year-old.  He lives with his family in the town of Sololá, Sololá department.  He has seven children—five girls and two boys.  

Juan works growing carrots and potatoes.  He chose this line of work because it allows him to be close to his family.  He can earn an income without leaving the place where he lives, and in this way support his family.  

Juan is asking for a loan in the amount of 8,000 quetzales to buy supplies to grow carrots and potatoes.  In the future he wants to have his own capital to do this work.

loans.use: to buy carrot seed and organic fertilizer

loans.name: Faridah

texts.en:
Faridah is 20 years old and lives in the town of Nakifuma in the Mukono region of Uganda. She is single and has one child who is currently in school. For the past three years, Faridah has been working hard to manage her shoe shop, which sells second-hand shoes. 

To help expand her business, Faridah has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda. The loan will be used to buy more shoes, and will help Faridah to generate greater profits and increase her capital. Faridah hopes that in the future she will be able to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more shoes

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet Fatmata, 45 years old, from Waterloo Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is married with two children.  For the past 20 years, Fatmata has had her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to educate her children. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and proper business location.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Kadiatu

texts.en:
Meet Kadiatu, a 45-year-old from Jui Western rural in Freetown in Sierra Leone. She is widowed with three children.  For the past 20 years, Kadiatu has been running her retail business. She began her business because she wanted to educate her children. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 5:30 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation and proper business location.

Kadiatu requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, sardines and soap to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her standard of living and increase her business. In the future, Kadiatu plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, sardines and soap to expand her business.

loans.name: Zainab

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Zainab from Jui, a western, rural area in Freetown. She is married, with two children. 

More than five years ago, Zainab established her charcoal business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her life and have a daily income. She works at the business eight hours per day, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is transportation problems within her area of operation.

Zainab requires a loan in order to purchase more charcoal to sell. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to repay her loan and increase her business. 

In the future, Zainab plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more peppers, tomato paste, and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Rukamani Mahila Sangh - Kabbur Group

texts.en:
Sittavva, 41, is a former devadasi from Kabbur village, Belgaum. She has studied until seventh grade. She is living with her parents, her son and two daughters. Her elder son is studying ITI, one daughter is married and the other is studying in fifth grade. 

The Devadasi system is an ancient tradition in which a young girl is married or ‘dedicated’ to a deity and performs religious rituals. The realities of a devadasi are extremely challenging since the young women are not able to complete their education, learn employable skills, or otherwise provide for themselves. The young women do not have a choice in this life long decision, which often leads to exploitation, poverty, and social exclusion.

Sittavva has struggled all her life to be out of the undesirable Devadasi system. Hence, she formed a group of ex-devadasis and took benefits from the Devadasi rehabilitation project. In 1996, her team participated in the Devadasi eradication movement. The group grew to have around 3,600 members.  They finally decided to form their own NGO called “MASS” in 1997. 

Sittavva is the founding member of this organization. She is now an Executive Officer. She is earning INR 12,000 per month, which is paid by MASS under CRY program as she plays the role of child protection officer. Her income is the only source for her family. The government has provided a house for her family, which is in a bad condition. The roof is broken due because it leaks in the rainy season.
