Sittavva needs to renovate her house, for which she is seeking a loan of INR 20,000. 

Sittavva is also a featured member of “Rukamani Mahila Sangh” Self-Help Group (SHG). This group consists of (including Sittavva) nine members.  They all need a loan for different purpose like goat rearing, house renovation, animal breeding, and buffalo rearing. All except Sittavva are daily wage workers in the agriculture fields. They all are very hardworking women and they hope to save enough for their children’s education.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Ambedkar Mahila Swasahay Sangh Group

texts.en:
Renuka is 44 years old (she is the woman who is standing with her hand raised in the picture) and lives in Kagawad village, Athani, Belgaum. She is a former Devadasi. The devadasi system is an ancient tradition in which a young girl is married or ‘dedicated’ to a deity and would perform religious rituals. The realities of a devadasi are extremely challenging since the young women are not able to complete their education, learn employable skills, or otherwise provide for themselves. The young women do not have a choice in this life-long decision which often leads to exploitation, poverty, and social exclusion. 

Renuka lives with her younger sister who is handicapped and her elder brother’s son's family which consists of his wife and children. Renuka has two children. Her elder son is studying in the 8th grade while the other one studies in 6th grade. Her main sources of income are animal husbandry and agriculture. Renuka has a few goats and buffalo in her farm. She sells milk at the KMF federation situated in her village and uses some milk for their household purposes. She also does labor in agricultural fields. She earns around INR 4,000 per month which is not sufficient to run the family.

She now wants to improve her farm for which she is seeking a loan of INR 20,000 to buy one more buffalo. Renuka will use the additional income for her children’s education and she hopes to save enough to secure her future.

The other 18 members of “Ambedkar Mahila Swasahay Sangh” Self Help Group (SHG) are requesting a loan for different purposes: twelve of them for goat rearing, five of them for buffalo rearing and one of them for a pan (an edible prepared by wrapping herbs and spices in betel leaves) shop. All the members are former devadasis and are fighting rigorously to eradicate this system. They all are trying hard to convince people in their village not to push their daughters into this unacceptable system.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo

loans.name: Durga Devi Mahila Swasahay Sangh Group

texts.en:
The Self Help Group (SHG) “Durga Devi Mahila Swasahay Sangh” consists of seven diligent women who are starting their first loan cycle with Kiva. All the women are former devadasis. Kashavva (the lady with her hand raised in the picture) is the featured borrower of this group. They all are daily wage workers in agriculture fields.

The Devadasi system is an ancient tradition in which a young girl is married or ‘dedicated’ to a deity and performs religious rituals. The realities of a devadasi are extremely challenging since the young women are not able to complete their education, learn employable skills, or otherwise provide for themselves. The young women do not have a choice in this life long decision, which often leads to exploitation, poverty, and social exclusion. 

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Kashavva, a 54-year-old woman living in Palbhai village, Raibag, Belgaum. She is illiterate but that did not stop Kashavva from staring her own petty shop in the locality. She has been in this business for the last five years. She is living with her partner and a son who is married and has four children. Kashavva is earning around INR 8,000 per month.                  

She is requesting a loan to buy more commodities like food grains, oil and essential food items for her petty shop so that her consumers needs are fulfilled. Kashavva dreams of setting up a tailoring shop for her son. She hopes to save enough for her old age.  

The other members are also seeking loans for different purpose like goat and buffalo rearing and a petty shop. They all are against the Devadasi system as being ex-devadasi, they have experienced the horrific effects of it in their life. They want to eradicate this unwanted system.

loans.use: to buy commodities like food grains, oil and essential food items

loans.name: Laxmi Mahila Swasahaya Sangh - Sounsudhi Group

texts.en:
The self-help group (SHG) “Laxmi Mahila Swasahaya Sangh” is starting its first loan cycle with “MASS”. This group consists of 11 members. 

Rukmavva (the lady with her hand raised in the picture) is the featured borrower of this group. The members of this group need loans for animal husbandry as well as for a flour mill repair. They all are daily-wage workers in agriculture fields. Such a group of hardworking and experienced ladies needs to be appreciated, to make them the forerunners in the much-needed reforms.

This loan will benefit small entrepreneurs such as Rukmavva, a 38-year-old woman hailing from Sounsudhi village, Raibag, Belgaum. She remained illiterate, due to her family’s circumstances. Rukmavva is a very hardworking woman; she was able to start her own farm, which consists of goat kids, with a small amount of capital. She has 28 years of experience in this venture. 

Rukmavva is married and has two children. Her son and husband work in agriculture fields as laborers, and her daughter is studying in tenth grade. Their family’s monthly income is around INR 9,000. They all stay in their own house sanctioned by the government.

Rukmavva is requesting a loan to buy young goats from her community, and then raise and sell them. She hopes to save enough to send her daughter to school and wants to set up a business for her son.

Though there are 12 members in the photo, only 11 are taking the loan.

loans.use: to buy young goats.

loans.name: Yellamma Devi Mahila Swasahay Sangh - Gounal Group

texts.en:
“Yellamma Devi Mahila Swasahay Sangh” is a Self-Help Group (SHG) that is located in Gounal village, Belgaum, Karnataka. The group consists of seven members: Shallavva, Mahadevi, Yellavva, Rukmavva, Pavitra, Ratnavva and Rekha. All the members are former Devadasi women. 

“Devadasi” literally means "servant of God". The practice was prevalent in India, wherein women were married to a deity/temple at a very young age. The situation of these Devadasis is challenging, and illiteracy, unemployment, and poverty are common attributes associated with them. Although the system was abolished in 1988, the condition remains appalling.

Shalavva (the lady standing with her hand raised in the picture) is 38 years old and has studied until eigth grade, after which her parents dedicated her as a Devadasi to the goddess Yellamma. She stays with her mother and her two sons, who are studying in sixth and seventh grade. She is a daily-wage worker and also runs a farm, which consists of goats and buffalo. She sells milk every day to the KMF Federation located in her village. She earns around INR 4,000 per month.

Shalavva is finding it hard to maintain her family with her current income. Hence, she plans to buy one more buffalo, which will help her increase her monthly income, for which she is requesting a loan of INR 10,000. 

She has twenty years of experience in dairy farming. She sells goats when she is in need of money, especially during festivals and ceremonies, or if there are any other problems. Shalavva is well aware of the animal diseases and gets veterinary help when needed. She dreams to have a bigger farm. She hopes to save enough for her children’s education.

The other members want the loan for goat rearing, buffalo rearing, and vegetable vending.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo

loans.name: Dalai

texts.en: Dalai, 54 years old, lives with his wife in an old house in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. He has been working as a welder at a steel factory for 29 years. His wife is unemployed and stays at home. He is requesting a loan of $2,250 (USD) to buy building materials such as bricks, planks, cement, and fiberglass for house renovation. After renovation, he and his wife will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating and so fewer pollutants will be released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his old house

loans.name: Uranzaya

texts.en: Uranzaya, 35 years old, lives with her husband and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as an accountant at an environmental organization for eight months. Her husband is a driller and works for a mining company. Due to heavy snowball and strong storms during the winter, the house her family lives in has been deteriorating over the years and needs some renovation. For this project, she is requesting a loan of  $1,675 (USD) to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, planks, and shingles. After renovation, her family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and so fewer pollutants are released into air. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to buy building materials

loans.name: Enkhbayar

texts.en: Enkhbayar is a widow who lives with her mother and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been providing taxi service to local people since 2008. Her mother has retired from work and gets a state pension. Her daughters both go to high school. She is requesting a loan of $1,700 (USD) to buy automobile tires which are durable enough for inadequate roads. She usually picks up her customers from the slum district so durable tires are necessary for her taxi business.

loans.use: to buy durable tires

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy livestock in order to raise and resell them

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es:
María tiene 50 años de edad,  está acompañada es comerciante, estudio hasta tercer grado , su compañero de vida es albañil y agricultor, sus dos hijos trabajan y los otros dos están estudiando.
Ella es comerciante, se dedica a vender frutas y verduras y granos básicos tienen 10 años de dedicarse al negocio, ella vende ambulante en el cantón.  El crédito lo va utilizar para comprar verduras y frutas y para arrendar las tierras para cultivar, sueña que su negocio crezca y que tenga más ingresos para ella y su familia.
texts.en:
María is 50 years old. She is in a common-law relationship and works as a merchant. She studied through the third grade. Her life partner is a construction worker and farmer. Two of her children are working and the other two are studying.

She is a shopkeeper, and has been selling fruits, vegetables, and bulk grains for 10 years. She works as a street vendor in a canton. The loan will be used to purchase fruits and vegetables and to lease the land to cultivate. She dreams of growing her business and having more income for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables and to lease the land to cultivate.

loans.name: Al- Afaf** Group

texts.en:
This group, called Al- Afaf**, is made up of four women. They have applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. 

Afaf is a 34-year-old mother of two children living in Sana'a, Yemen. She is the group's leader and is responsible for them. 
In 2010, Afaf started her own business making sweets in her home. Now, she has become an expert in this business. Afaf's sweets are famous for their delicious taste. You can always buy hot, fresh sweets from her which is why she always has a lot of customers. Afaf wants to expand her business. Unfortunately, she suffers from a lack of business capital. As a result, Afaf is applying for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB. She will use her loan to purchase more flour, milk, sugar, and other ingredients to make sweets and sell them to her customers. 

Afaf's vision is  to expand her business and increase its capital. Also, she hopes to sell her products to the trading stores around the city.

loans.use: To purchase flour, milk, sugar, and other ingredients to make sweets and sell them to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy goats to raise and resell

loans.name: Sylvestre

texts.en:
Sylvestre is 48 years old and lives in the beautiful village of San Jose, Toledo. He is a farmer and the father of three children. He and his wife Alphosa work together to maintain the farm. Sylvestre is a new member of Maya Mountain Cacao and has eight acres of productive cacao trees. He intends to acquire a loan so that he can properly clean and prune his entire cacao farm.

His favorite part of farming cacao is harvesting, and the most challenging part is cleaning, therefore he requests extra labor. In the future, he intends to have a properly maintained farm and have his children working on it.

loans.use: to clean his eight acres of producing cacao trees

loans.name: Claudia

texts.en: Claudia is a Kubo client, and this is her story: Claudia is 39 years old, is married, and has a child. She has a bachelor’s degree in business administration and is an administrative manager for an advertising agency where she has worked for eight years. She asks for this loan to invest it in the company where she is working. She will buy design software. Her personal goal is to have work and family stability, and her main challenge is growth and becoming a partner at the company.

loans.use: to buy design software.

loans.name: Santos  Antonio

texts.es: Santos de 64 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto con su grupo familiar, él es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora su principal siembra es el café.  Don Santos desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos monetarios, y así el seguirá llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Santos, 64, is a very responsible man with his household obligations.  He has always been known for given his family the best.  Currently he lives with his family.  He's very hardworking and has always done so happily and enthusiastically.  He earns a living as a farmer; his main crop is coffee.

Santos wants to increase his sales, so he visited the offices of Integral to request a loan to buy fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, and other things.

He wants to have the help he has requested because he has no other income.  This way he'll continue to support his family without any limitations whatsoever.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments, fertilizer, pesticide, herbicide, and other things

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase better equipment to provide qualified service to her clients

loans.name: Urantsetseg

texts.en:
Urantsetseg is 26 years old lives with her husband and two daughters in their apartment in the Baganuur district of Ulaanbaatar City, Mongolia. Her husband works at a local company. Her two daughters are toddlers and go to the local kindergarten. 

Urantsetseg started her business of clothing sales in a rented stall of the local market in 2009. She has gained a lot of experience and regular customers over the years. She is now starting a new business cycle of selling men's clothes in another small rental booth of the local market. She is now requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of men's clothing to sell at her new counter. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of men's clothing to sell at her new counter

loans.name: Sainbayar

texts.en:
Sainbayar is 25 years old and lives with his wife and son in their ger, a traditional nomadic yurt in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. His wife gave birth to their son a year ago and is now taking care of their new born baby at home.

Sainbayar graduated college in 2007 and started his own business with his friend soon after the graduation. He is now running a retail business in the local outdoor market in a rental booth selling animal pelts and other material. He has gathered a lot of experience in the business over the years and is now requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to purchase a large number of animal pelts and other products from herders to sell to domestic manufacturers in bulk. He is a hardworking and diligent man.

loans.use: to purchase a large number of animal pelts and other products from herders to sell to domestic manufacturers in bulk.

loans.name: Maysara

texts.ru: Майсара одна их жительниц города Душанбе. Ей 46 лет. Майсара разведена с мужем. Она живет вместе с дочкой и двумя внуками. Ее дочери 25 лет. Она занимается шитьем, как и мама. Майсара более трех лет предоставляет услугу портнихи. Услуга портнихи стал основным источником дохода в семью Майсары. К сожалению, швейная машинка, на которой Майсара трудится совсем старая и не пригодна для дальнейшего использования. Майсара решилась обратиться за кредитом, чтобы купить новую модернизированную швейную машинку, чтобы сохранить источник дохода.
texts.en: Maysara is one of the residents of Dushanbe.  She is 46 years old.  Maysara is divorced from her husband and lives together with her daughter and two grandsons.  Her daughter is 25 years old.  She is involved in sewing just like her mother.  Maysara has been providing seamstress services for over three years.  These services have become the primary source of income for Maysara's family.  Unfortunately, the sewing machine that Maysara uses for work is very old and not at all suitable for continued use.  Maysara decided to request this loan to purchase a new, modernized sewing machine in order to preserve her source of income.

loans.use: to purchase a new, modernized sewing machine

loans.name: Anabel

texts.en:
Anabel is a hardworking 18-year-old lady. She is studying in a university taking a BS in Business Administration.

Anabel has two siblings and she is someone who is very dedicated to her studies. She had her previous loan which she used to cover the costs for school projects and graduation fees, but she still had her school tuition fees balance for the second semester. To pay it, she took a new loan from the GDMPC student loan program.

Her goal is to find a better career to earn a better income. In the future, she wants to become successful.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees balance for the second semester

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is studying for a Bachelor of Science in Information Technology at the university in Oroquieta City. Her father earns from employment as a welder while her mother has a buying and selling business. She had her previous loans that she used for her school expenses.

Recently, she borrowed from GDMPC to pay her school tuition fees for the second semester. In the future, she wants to be successful in her career and be able to help her family.

loans.use: to pay her school tuition fees for the second semester

loans.name: Odgerel

texts.en: Odgerel, 25 years old, lives with her husband in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She holds the position of manager at a trading company. Her husband works at a mining company as a plumber. She is requesting a loan of 2500 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for house renovation. After the renovation, she and her husband will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating. Reduced coal usage means less air pollution.

loans.use: to renovate her house

loans.name: Elgen

texts.en: Elgen is married with eleven children and operates a general store to make a living. In addition to this, she also sells fish while her husband does fishing to earn extra income. For five years while running the business, she has earned well to support the needs of her children and was able to sustain it.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for the family in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Sally

texts.en: Sally is a single entrepreneur who operates a general store to make a living. For three years while running the business, she earned well to support her parents and was able to sustain it.  She borrowed a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She hopes to improve the business to ensure a better source of income for her future family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en: Evelyn has been operating her own retail store for many years and she earns well from this. With her generated revenue, she was able to repay her previous loan successfully. Having a big family needs more efforts to provide for their needs, especially for her six children. The couple had to work hard with determination to have a better income to provide their children a better education they didn't have. To improve sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Evelyn hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Mae

texts.en: Mae has been operating her own retail store for more than three years and she earns well from this. The couple had to work hard with determination to have a better income to provide their children with a better education in the future. Her husband earns from his salary as a private employee. To improve sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. In the future, Mae hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es: Miguel tiene 61 años, es agricultor, está casado, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos con él vive un nieto, de él dependen dos personas.  Miguel se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, lo aprendió por su padre ya que desde pequeño le inculco a esto, el negocio le queda a 15 minutos de distancia y viaja a pie.  El préstamo lo necesita para terminar de construir la casa de su hija,  comprara ladrillo y teja y pagara la mano de obra. Sueña con terminar su casa y que su hija y sus nietos vivan en mejores condiciones.
texts.en:
Miguel, age 61, is a farmer.  He is married, and his wife devotes herself to the domestic chores.  A grandson lives with him.  Two people are dependent upon him.  Miguel devotes himself to agriculture and livestock.  He learned this from his father, who taught him this when he was little.  His business is 15 minutes away, and he walks there.

He needs the loan to finish building his daughter’s house.  He will buy bricks and tile, and he will pay for the labor.  He dreams of finishing her house and of his daughter and his grandchildren living in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy bricks and tile, and to pay for the labor to finish building his daughter's house.

loans.name: Evelio De Jesús

texts.es: Evelio tiene 28 años, está soltero,  estudio hasta 1 año de bachillerato, con él viven dos hermanos y sus abuelos. Es agricultor y ganadero se encarga de comprar y vender ganado y granos básicos tiene 7 años de dedicarse a este negocio,  él viaja a los tiangues a negociar los productos y el ganado. El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para  comprar ganado para engordarlo y venderlo cuando los haya engordado, desea que su ganado se desarrolle en buen estado para que aun futuro tenga más ingresos para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Evelio is single, 28 years old, and has finished the equivalent of grade 11. He lives with his two siblings and his grandparents. He is a farmer and a rancher. He buys and sells cattle and basic grains, and has been doing this for seven years. He travels to street markets to sell his cattle and products. 

The loan that Evelio is requesting will be used to buy cattle to fatten and sell when they are ready. He hopes that his cattle will develop healthily so that he can enjoy greater income in the future.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and sell once they are ready.

loans.name: Paz Isabel

texts.es:
Paz tiene 49 años de edad,  está acompañado, es empleado tiene dos hijos estudio hasta segundo año de bachillerato, su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos, sus hijos viven en casa y están estudiando.

Paz tiene 8 años de trabajar en una empresa, a parte de ser agricultor, con él se involucran sus dos hijos a ayudarle en la agricultura, utilizara el dinero para ponerle el piso a su casa.  Mejorará su condición de vida ya que sueña que su casa este en buen estado.
texts.en:
Paz, age 49, is in a relationship.  He is employed, and he has two children.  He went to school through the second year of high school.  His wife devotes herself to the domestic chores.  His children live at home, and they go to school. 

Paz has worked for a company for eight years.  He is also a farmer.  His two children help him with the agriculture.  

He will use the loan to lay down the floor in his house.  It will improve his living condition.  He dreams of his house being in good condition.

loans.use: to lay down the floor in his house.

loans.name: Valeriano

texts.es:
Valeriano tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, en el Caserío de Mangaypa, una zona rural del distrito de Pomahuaca, una comunidad de clima cálido, su población se dedica a la agricultura, especialmente al cultivo de frutales, arroz y café, comercio de los mismos, ubicada en la Provincia de Jaén que pertenece a la Región, Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la agricultura, específicamente al cultivo de café, dedicándose a esta actividad desde hace 4 años, es un padre trabajador que se esfuerza en la labor que realiza, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de abonos para el mantenimiento de su cultivo de café y de esta manera tener una cosecha buena para ofrecerlo a un buen precio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Valeriano, age 41, lives in his own house made of rustic materials.  He lives in the Mangaypa settlement, a rural area in the Pomahuaca district.  The community has a hot climate, and the populations devotes itself to agriculture; especially fruit, rice, and coffee crops; and selling them.  It is in the Jaén province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He is a farmer.  Specifically, he grows coffee.  He has been doing this for four years.  He is a hard-working father who puts great effort into the work that he does.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 soles.  He will use the loan to buy fertilizers for the maintenance of his coffee crops.  This way he will have a good harvest to offer his customers at a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for the maintenance of his coffee crops.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 66 años, es madre de tres hijos,  está casada, estudio hasta tercer grado su pareja es agricultor, sus hijos viven aparte con ella vive solo  su esposo y un hijo. Ella se dedica a criar cerdos y ganado  tiene 30 años de dedicarse a este negocio, se decidió por medio de su abuela, se involucra su hijo en el negocio.

 Necesita el dinero para comprar ganado y cerdos.  Mejorará su vida ya que comprara ganado y cerdos para engordar y en un futuro tener más ingresos.
 
Sueña que su ganado y cerdos se desarrollen y al final tener mayores ingresos, las ganancias las utilizara par mejorar su casa.
texts.en: Rosa is 66 years old. She is the mother of three children and is married. She studied up to third grade. Her partner is a farmer; her children live elsewhere. She lives only with her husband and one son. She works raising pigs and cattle. She has worked in this business for 30 years. She decided to do this through her grandmother. Her son is involved in the business. She needs the money to buy cattle and pigs. It will improve her life because she will buy cattle and pigs to fatten, and in the future she will have more income. She dreams that her cattle and pigs grow and that at the end she will have more income. She will use her earnings to improve her house.

loans.use: to buy cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Doña Juana de 47 años de edad tiene más de cinco años recibiendo el apoyo de Fape y  kiva, y gracias a ello ha estado cumpliendo su sueño de tener una gran plantación de café lo cual le ha permitido con sus ganancias cuidar pollos y pavos para la crianza y engorde. Es responsable en sus pagos. Y solicita el crédito para la compra de abono químico y orgánico, concentrado y vitaminas para sus pollos y pavos.
texts.en:
Juana, age 47, has been receiving help from FAPE and Kiva for over five years.  Thanks to this, she has been fulfilling her dream of having a great coffee farm.  This has allowed her to use the profits to care for the chickens and turkeys that she raises and fattens.  

She is responsible with her payments.  She is requesting the loan to buy chemical and organic fertilizer, concentrated feed, and vitamins for her chickens and turkeys.

loans.use: to buy chemical and organic fertilizer, concentrated feed, and vitamins for chickens.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Maria Ines, soltera con siete hijos todos independientes, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega zona  que se caracteriza por el comercio, y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del país. Maria es una microempresaria que se dedica a la comercialización de cerdos en pie y destace del mismo, con un promedio de dos a tres cerdos a la semana sus compras las realiza al contado en sectores aledaños a su vivienda, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito tiene clientes fijos y eventuales de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación donde ofrece subproductos derivados del cerdo como: pepena, frito, moronga, nacatamales, chorizos, entre otros mas, Maria Ines se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, responsable, emprendedora y con muchos deseos de supercion personal, uno de sus sueños es poder realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda. el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para capital de trabajo en la compra de un lote de cerdos en pie, y de esa forma ofrecerle buenos productos a sus clientes, Maria Ines agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Maria Ines is single with seven independent children. She is from one of the municipalities of Chinandega, area characterized by trade and where one of the biggest sugar mills of the country is located. Maria is a small business owner who works purchasing and butchering pigs with an average of two to three pigs a week. She purchases with cash in areas close to her house. She sells in cash and provides credit to her regular customers and to the new customers she makes by traveling and in her house as a place of work, from where she offers products derived from the pig such as: meat, fried items, blood sausages, tamales, sausages, among others. Maria Ines is a hardworking, responsible and enterprising woman with many desires of personal improvement. One of her dreams is to do some improvements in her house. The objective of this new loan is to get work capital in order to buy a batch of live pigs and in this way to offer good products to her customers. Maria Ines is very grateful for the support of the Kiva lenders, who offer them to people of low financial resources.

loans.use: to buy a batch of live pigs and basic staples to produce their delicious derived products

loans.name: Batmunh

texts.en:
Mr. Batmunh is 39 years old and lives with his wife and 2 children in their Ger, a traditional nomadic yurt, in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. His wife Enhtsetseg works at a local company. His 2 daughters are local school students.
 
Batmunh moved to the province center in 2008 with his family and started helping his brother to run an animal pelt and other materials retail business in a rental stall of a local market. He has gained a lot of experience and lately he has been almost running the business himself. He is now requesting a loan of 1,000,000MNT to start his own business by purchasing a large amount of inventory to resell to manufacturers. He is a hardworking, helpful and diligent man.

loans.use: to start his own business by purchasing a large amount of inventory to resell to manufacturers

loans.name: Purevsuren

texts.en: Mrs. Purevsuren is a 55-year-old borrower from Arkhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband has retired, and her younger son is enrolled in the university. She is running her business regularly in her rental booth of a local market. Her older daughter and husband are helping her to grow their family business and now she is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to resell at her counter. She and her family are hardworking and decent people.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of organic dairy products to resell at her counter

loans.name: Else

texts.en: Else, a mother of one child, helps her husband operate their own food vending business to make a living. For five years, the couple has earned enough to provide for the family. She had planned to improve their business to send her child to school. Recently, she took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food for sale to improve sales. In the future, she wants to provide a good education for her children and wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to buy additional raw ingredients to prepare food for sale

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia is married, and she has five grown children who have helped her in taking care of their corn farm. They been raising corn for many years and aside from this, they also grow bananas to gain more income. She had successfully repaid her previous loan used for their farm. Recently, Cecelia took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer to improve the farm. It is their main source of income, so she wants to ensure a better source of income for their future needs. She hopes for a bountiful harvest and an expanded cultivation area.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer

loans.name: Jessie

texts.en: Jessie is married with two children. He owns a rice farm to earn a living. His wife earns from other employment. He has been doing this for many years, earning enough for the family. He has successfully repaid his previous loan used for his farm. Recently, he borrowed a new  loan from GDMPC microcredit to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides. He is hoping to gain more profit and to be able to use it for the future education of his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Gloria Isabel

texts.es:
Querer es poder, son tres palabras cortas que caracterizan a Gloria. Al terminar su bachillerato, varias causas fueron las que impidieron su entrada a la universidad, una de ellas, la falta de recursos económicos. Sin embargo, no se dio por vencida y busco la manera de progresar. A sus 26 años es dueña de una pulpería, la que ha ido creciendo poco a poco durante cuatro años. Trabaja con esmero y dedicación, puesto que es su principal fuente de ingresos.
Gloria solicita un segundo financiamiento, con el que planea aumentar el capital de su producción, necesita invertir en la compra de arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar y productos varios para su negocio. Ella está muy agradecida con el primer financiamiento, puesto que aumentaron los clientes y al mismo tiempo sus ingresos. Ella lucha por su madre, a quien desea brindarle mejores condiciones de vida. Una de sus metas es ampliar el negocio y al mismo tiempo establecer una venta de gas butano.
texts.en:
‘Querer es poder’ [where there is a will there is a way].  They are three short words that characterize Gloria.  Upon completing high school, various causes stopped her from entering the university.  One of these was the lack of financial resources.  Nevertheless, she did not give up.  She looked for a way to progress.  

At 26 years of age, she owns a grocery store.  It has been growing little by little for four years.  She works with care and dedication given that this is her main source of income. 

Gloria is requesting a second loan.  She plans on using the loan to increase her production capital.  She needs to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, and various other products for her business.  She is very grateful for the first loan.  She increased her number of customers and her income.  

She struggles for her mother, who she wishes to provide with better living conditions.  One of her goals is to expand the business and at the same time set up butane gas sales.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, cooking oil, sugar, and various other products for her business.

loans.name: Sadig

texts.en:
Sadig, a 26-year-old single man, is an IDP (Internally Displaced Person) living in the Abseron region with his lovely family: his parents, brother, sister-in-law and nephew. For two years now, Sadig has had a business selling construction materials such as fixtures, wood, iron, etc. 

Sadig has applied to Komak for a 1200 AZN-Azerbaijan New Manat loan to purchase more materials to sell. He hopes that this loan will help increase his business. He thanks Kiva for its support.

In the future, Sadig wants to get married and have children.

loans.use: to buy more materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wooden and other materials to build a greenhouse and add inventory to her husband's business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cosmetics and accessory products to sell at her counter from Urumqi, China

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay his daughter's education fee and to purchase a large amount of inventory to sell at his rental stall

loans.name: Maa Risipiten Group

texts.en:
Risigaon is a small village in the Nuapada district of Odisha, India. Most of the residents of this village are poor and belong to Schedule Tribe, Schedule Caste and Other Backward Class. This village is surrounded by hills and natural rock plates, which is a blessing for the villagers to earn a livelihood. They prepare stone chips from the black granite stones of the hills, sell it to the builders and earn their livelihood.

Himadri is an inhabitant of this village. The lady sitting in the middle with her hand raised in the photo is Himadri. She is 33 and resides with her husband, two sons and one daughter. The main source of income for Himadri is preparing and selling stone chips. She and her husband prepare stone chips. The stone chips prepared from the stone boulders are used inter-alia in the manufacture of concrete sleepers, construction of roads, bridges, buildings and other construction work. Himadri has been doing this business for the last 10 years and the earnings are just hand to mouth for her family. The reality is that, due to poor conditions, she brings an advance from the builders, prepares stone chips and sells them in distress to refund the advance. In spite of regular earnings, she is not able to improve her living conditions. So, to overcome this situation, in the year 2014 she formed a Self Help Group comprised of 10 members and each member took a loan of 12,000 INR from Mahashakti Foundation. With this loan, she will purchase a big hammer, a small hammer and other materials for the preparation of stone chips. Now she will not have to go for an advance and bargain with the builder for her products, which will definitely fetch more income for her. Himadri hopes to construct a house and give a better life to her children.

loans.use: To purchase hammers and other materials to prepare stone chips.

loans.name: Numeriano

texts.en: Numeriano is a 51-year-old married man. He settled to earn his living in Clarin, Misamis Occidental, Philippines together with his five children. Over the past ten years, Numeriano was able to manage his farm that absolutely met their needs. Currently, the farm is still doing well and is providing enough cash inflow to cover the family's day-to-day expenditures. Recently, he took a new loan to buy fertilizer. With the acquisition of in-demand basic commodities, Numeriano expects an increase in his harvest so as to expand his farm and improve the general living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Aljun

texts.en: Aljun provides transportation services in his village to make a living. He also earns an income from other employment. For more than a year, he earns well to sustain his living. He needs to pay for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle to improve the service to his costumers. With the microfinance loan from GDMPC, his plan was realized. In the future, he wants to acquire an additional new motorcycle to expand his services.

loans.use: to pay for repairs and maintenance of his motorcycle

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es: Jose Alberto mayor de edad casado con tres hijos mayores de edad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país,Jose Alberto se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable, y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es una microempresario el cual tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitación donde ofrece productos de consumo diario y en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, fósforo, café, pan, huevos, aceite, golosinas, productos congelados, gaseosas, leña entre otros mas. también tiene un negocio de comida rápida que ofrece a trabajadores de cortadores de caña como: enchiladas tacos, tajadas, carne asada, pollo asado, frescos entre otros mas tiene clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales sus ventas son al contado y al crédito sus compras las realiza en mercados de mayoreos y distribuidoras de esta localidad. inicia su jornada diaria desde muy temprano abriendo las puertas de su negocio cerrando hasta algo tarde. El objetivo del préstamo es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su pulpería para y cubrir la demanda de sus clientes en la compra de productos de consumo diario y para su comideria rápida.-
texts.en: José Alberto is an older man who is married and has three adult children. He is originally from one of the towns of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. José Alberto is characterized as being a hard-working, responsible man with a great desire for personal achievement. He is a micro-entrepreneur who has a grocery store in his home, where he offers everyday products in small quantities, such as rice, beans, sugar, milk, matches, coffee, bread, eggs, oil, candies, frozen products, soft drinks, and firewood, among other items. He also has a fast food business that offers food such as enchiladas, tacos, fried plantain slices, roasted meat and chicken, and soft drinks to sugar cane cutters. He has regular and occasional customers. His sales are for cash and on credit. He makes his purchases in the wholesale markets and from distributors in this area. He begins his workday very early, opening the doors of his business, and closes somewhat late. The purpose of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock his business to meet the demands of his customers for products for daily use and for his fast food.

loans.use: to buy household products such as frozen products, basic grains, meat, charcoal, firewood, and bananas, among other items

loans.name: Oyun-Erdene

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyun-Erdene is 41 years old and lives with her husband and four children in their small house in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband Hurel-Ochir is a herdsman, farming their livestock in the countryside. Her oldest child is 22 and helps his parents at home and the younger three children study at a local secondary school.
 
Oyun-Erdene moved to the province center in 2007 with her family and started her business selling livestock intestines and other edible parts in the local market. She is a hardworking and helpful woman who is now requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT to purchase inventory in a large quantity to sell at her counter. 

Mongolians cook intestines and other edible parts of the livestock because it is affordable.

loans.use: to purchase inventory in large quantity to sell at her counter

loans.name: Oyun

texts.en:
Mrs.Oyun is 68 years old and lives with her husband in their small house in Arkhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband Gaadan is 73 and stays home enjoying his pension. Their children all are grown and live apart with their families.
 
Oyun and her husband started growing and selling organic vegetables on their plot of land. They have expanded their volume and started renting a small booth in the local market. Her husband is now taking all the responsibility for the organic vegetable sales business. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to start a new business producing building blocks with her son. She is a hardworking and diligent woman.

loans.use: to start a new business producing building blocks with her son

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of food products to sell at her rental counter

loans.name: Tungalagtamir

texts.en:
Tungalagtamir is a 34-year-old woman borrower from Arkhangai province, Mongolia. Her husband is running his taxi service business and her children are studying at local schools.  

Tungalagtamir has been providing well-designed and affordable clothing to local residents for years and has lot of experience as well as regular customers. She is now requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase clothing inventory to sell at her rental counter. She is a hardworking, welcoming, and friendly woman.

loans.use: to purchase clothing inventory to sell at her rental counter

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of cosmetic products to sell at her counter

loans.name: Dolores

texts.en: Dolores owns and operates a farm, planting and harvesting rice for sale to earn a living. She has been running her farm for more than eight years with her husband and she earns well for their daily living. Aside from this, she has a plot of various plants for sale. She has been a member of GDMPC since the year 2009 and her previous loan for farm improvements was successfully repaid.  Now she took a new loan to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and organic pesticides

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more books, pens, pencils, and textbooks to expand her business.

loans.name: Tomas Ragalado

texts.es:
Tomas de 44 años de edad, desde que  era un niño le gustaba trabajar, él iba a la escuela  por la mañana y por la tarde le ayudaba a su padre a trabajar en la agricultura, pero las cosas cambiaron su padre falleció cuando Tomas apenas tenía 14 años;  fue en ese momento cuando dejo de estudiar por mantener a su familia dado que era el hermano mayor así que solo logro estudiar hasta 3º grado, ahora él está acompañado y tiene dos hijos los cuales ya están acompañados y no viven con él su pareja falleció hace 8 años y desde entonces esta solo.


Tomas se a dedicado toda la vida al cultivo del maíz, lo cual le ha proporcionado su sustento diario, cultiva tres hectáreas de maíz y también frijol las cuales fueron heredadas por su padre cuando falleció, donde cultiva queda de distancia un promedio de 8 kilómetros  de su casa y tiene que caminar todos los días.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes que necesita para ir todos los días a su terrenos donde cultiva el maíz y frijol.  Además, esto mejorara su calidad de vida y también hará viajes acarreando agua en una carreta que la halaran dichos bueyes esto hará que tenga otro ingreso adicional y también podrá acarrear desde el terreno donde cultiva hasta su casa los costales de granos y se ahorrara esos dolores que pagaba.
texts.en:
Tomas, aged 44, liked to work since he was a boy. He would go to school in the morning and in the afternoon he helped his father with farming, but things changed when his father passed away when Tomas was only 14 years old. It was at that time that he dropped out of school to help support his family, given that he was the oldest of the brothers, and so he was only able to study up until the third grade. He was in a common-law relationship and he has two children who are already in common-law relationships and do not live with him now. His partner passed away eight years ago and since then he has been alone.

His whole life, Tomas has made a living farming corn, which has supported him daily. He farms three hectares of corn and beans as well, which were handed down to him by his father when he died. His farm is located an average of 8 kilometers from his house and he has to walk daily.

The loan he is requesting from CrediCampo is to buy a pair of ox which he needs to go each day to his fields where he farms the corn and beans. In addition, this will improve his quality of life and he will also make trips hauling water in a wagon which the ox will pull. This will make him have an additional income and will also allow him to transport the sacks of grains from the land where he farms to his home, while saving him grief.

loans.use: to buy a pair of ox.

loans.name: Norma Eli

texts.en:
Norma Eli is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is her story:

Norma is 36 years old, is married, and has four children; three of them are in school and that makes her proud. She and her family have been living for ten years now in Huitzilzingo, a Mexico City suburb 40 minutes away from downtown.

She is a school counselor and teaches Spanish, Math, Social Sciences and Natural Sciences in an adult school from Monday to Friday. To have more income she also sells catalog shoes to friends and family.

She asks for this loan to continue with the improvements she is making to her house, specifically to buy construction material. Norma is motivated with her work because she was able to get her high school diploma and now she studies to be a pre-school teacher; she looks forward to being able to do some graduate studies and finish her house improvements.

loans.use: to buy construction material for some improvements she is making in her house

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a new over sewing machine.

loans.name: Ivania Del Socorro

texts.es:
Trabajar es sinónimo de armonía y equilibrio en la vida de Ivania, quién día a día ofrece atención de calidad a los clientes que visitan su tienda de ropa usada. Ella tiene 53 años de edad, está soltera y tiene tres hijos, todos  independientes. Hace diez años inició su negocio con el objetivo de lograr estabilidad económica que le asegure un futuro tranquilo y grato. Toma ventaja de su dinamismo para seguir laborando y cuenta con el apoyo de sus hijos.
Ella solicita otro financiamiento para aumentar su capital de producción, necesita comprar ropa usada, tanto para mujeres como para hombres y así satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes. Ivania está agradecida con los préstamos brindados por Kiva y MiCrédito, puesto que logró invertir en ropa y al mismo tiempo aumentar su clientela. Es una mujer emprendedora y carismática. Una de sus metas es remodelar su tienda y expandir su negocio.
texts.en:
Working is a synonym for harmony and balance in the life of Ivania, who every day offers quality service to the customers who visit her used clothing store. She is 53 years old. She is single and has three children, all of them independent. Ten years ago she began her business with the goal of achieving economic stability that would assure her a peaceful and pleasant future. She takes advantage of her drive to continue working, and she has the support of her children. 

She is applying for another loan to increase her productive capital. She needs to buy used clothing, for women as well as for men, and thus satisfy the needs of her customers. Ivania is grateful for the loans offered by Kiva and MiCredito, since she succeeded in investing in clothing and at the same time increasing her clientele. She is an entrepreneurial and charismatic woman. One of her goals is to remodel her shop and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy used clothing for women as well as for men and thus satisfy the needs of her customers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more Vita soft drinks, rice, palm oil, washing soap, and pepper for the business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and cold water for her business.

loans.name: Mariatu

texts.en:
Meet Mariatu. She is a late twenties-year-old from Waterloo western rural area in Freetown. She is married with one child. In 2006, Mariatu established her clothing material business. She began her business because she wants to generate a permanent source of income to empower herself. She works at the business from 8:00 AM until 5:30 PM, seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Mariatu requires a loan in order to purchase more shoes and clothing material for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. In the future, Mariatu plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and clothing material for resale.

loans.name: Juana

texts.en:
Juana is 43 years old and married with 8 children, four of whom are in school. Juana works very hard to provide for them.

Juana's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Juana has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Juana has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Juana is committed to rebuild her devastated life, and in the future, would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase a chair and renovate his workplace.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Antonio tiene27 años es soltero y se encuentra trabajando. El señor realizo un curso sobre reparación de celulares con lo cual abrió para su negocio propio y también recibió un camión el cual también se encuentra trabajando haciendo fletes por la ciudad.
En el futuro le gustaría ampliar su negocio y comprar otro camión para poder seguir ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de accesorios para teléfonos, como también de repuestos para celulares para la venta.
texts.en:
Señor Antonio is 27 years old. He is single and is working. He took a course on repairing cellular telephones, with which he opened his own business, and he also got a truck with which he also works, carrying freight through the city.

In the future he would like to expand his business and buy another truck in order to be able to continue helping his family through his work.

He is requesting this loan to purchase accessories for telephones as well as replacement parts for cellular telephones to sell.

loans.use: to buy accessories and replacement parts for telephones

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy thermoses, string, and glue to continue lining thermoses

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.es:
Rodrigo tiene 26 años de edad, es dueño de un local comercial en la zona céntrica de la ciudad desde hace 3 años, él vive con su esposa y su mama.
Rodrigo cuenta que aunque es muy joven se está esforzando por crecer y llegar a ser un gran microempresario, y en su trabajo lo ayudan su esposa y mama, es una familia muy trabajadora y es lo que les destaca.
Él pide este préstamo para realizar mejoras en su despensa ya que le quiere colocar puerta y ventana de vidrio, lo que le dará un mejor aspecto a su negocio, e irá mejorando de esta forma poco a poco su local. Agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de crecer.
texts.en:
Rodrigo is 26 years old. He is the owner of a small shop in the central zone of the city. He has owned this shop for the past 3 years. He lives with his wife and mother. Rodrigo relates that, although he is very young, he is working hard to grow and to become a great entrepreneur. His wife and mother help him with his business, they really stand out as a hard-working family.

Rodrigo requests a loan to make improvements to his stall - he would like to install a glass door and glass window, which will make his business look better. He will continue making improvements this way, bit-by-bit. He is grateful for the opportunity he is receiving to grow.

loans.use: to purchase glass doors and windows for his shop.

loans.name: Ratna

texts.en:
Ratna is a 21-year-old married woman. She stays with her husband and her one daughter in the small town of Maynaguri.  Both Ratna and her husband are literate up to grades 8 and 10, respectively. Due to a lack of money, they are having great trouble raising their only child. 

Ratna is a housewife and her husband now is a van puller hired from a local owner. Thus, his income is not sufficient. Like a rickshaw, a cycle van is one kind of transport, carrying people and goods from one place to another, especially in remote areas. 

They decided to buy a cycle van of their own and applied for a loan. Ratna’s husband's income has increased after buying the cycle van. 

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva for giving this loan.

loans.use: To purchase a cycle van for their business

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en:
Sakina is a 42-year-old married woman with two children. Sakina is a housewife and her husband is a farmer. The land where she is standing will be used for growing eggplant. Eggplant cultivation is a very profitable business and eggplant is used in many Indian dishes. 

Sakina has taken a loan from Kiva’s partner BJS to buy agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and insecticides for cultivation of eggplant. After the harvest, they will sell the harvested eggplant to the market.

They hope they will gain more profit from this business. She is highly grateful to BJS and Kiva for this loan.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, and insecticides

loans.name: Fidelina

texts.es:
Fidelina tiene 47 años, vive en la ciudad de Itá. Su actividad se basa en la confección de prendas de vestir, tales como: pantalones, camisas, buzos, entre otros.
Ella comenta que hace un tiempo se dedica a este trabajo y que ya tiene muy buena clientela formada, con la cual está ayudando a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Fidelina es una persona muy luchadora, que con esfuerzo y sacrificio está saliendo adelante, ayudando a su familia y seres queridos.
Ella pide este préstamo para comprar insumos para su taller de costura, como ser telas, hilos, botones, cierres y demás, y de esa forma seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo y que le permitirá seguir creciendo como microempresaria.
texts.en:
Fidelina is 47 years old and lives in the city of Itá. Her business is based in the creation of clothing items, such as pants, blouses and sweatshirts, among other things. She says that she has been doing this work for a while now, and that she has a good client base through which she is helping her family and loved ones. Fidelina is a tough person, who is getting ahead and helping her family and loved ones through effort and sacrifice. 

She requests this loan to purchase supplies for her sewing workshop such as fabric, thread, buttons and zippers. In this way she will continue with her work as she has done. Fidelina is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving which will enable her to continue growing as an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, thread, buttons and zippers.

loans.name: Santoshi

texts.en:
Santoshi is a 35-year-old married woman living with her two children and husband. Her husband is a tailor, engaged in sewing work in a tailoring shop but his income is not enough. Providing an education for two children and running a household is very difficult for them, so Santoshi decided to do something so that she can also earn money and contribute to her family. In her childhood, she learned stitching and knitting so she thought to do this as her own business for now. She thought of buying a sewing machine so that she can improve her skill and earn money. For this reason, she has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) and she has already started to take orders for preparing dresses. She hopes she will succeed in her business. She hopes she can increase her financial status and admit her children in a renowned school for a better education with the help of the profit she will gain from her tailoring business.

Santoshi, being a dedicated woman, thanks BJS and Kiva for making her self-employed.

loans.use: To purchase a sewing machine for her tailoring business.

loans.name: Dinobala

texts.en:
Dinobala is a 45-year-old housewife. She lives with her husband Monomohan, 57, and her 2 sons in the small town of Dhupguri in the district of Jalpaiguri, in their own kachha house (a house made of bamboo, straw and mud).  Both Dinobala and her husband are illiterate and can only sign their names.  Their children were also deprived of an education due to their poor economic resources. They are engaged in some small businesses.

Dinobala's husband has been involved in agricultural activities for the last 10 years.  This is the only source of income for the family, but his business does not provide him with sufficient financial sustenance. Thus, Dinobala started her own decorator business to generate additional income.  She rents  sound boxes, microphones, speakers, etc. for special occasions such as marriage ceremonies, birthday parties, different meetings, etc.  

She is well known in her region for her good behavior, honesty and simplicity.  So, she expects these qualities will help to develop her decorator business.  Now she wants to grow her business to satisfy more customers. But she lacks the capital to do so. Thus, Dinobala has come forward and applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) to buy more decorative items like sound boxes, music systems, wires etc. to grow her business.

She hopes to keep on expanding and developing this business by moving to a larger shop in her locality.  She is very hopeful this business will be a lucrative one and will change their present financial situation.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva for funding the loan.

loans.use: To purchase more sound boxes, music systems, and wires to rent

loans.name: Purnima

texts.en:
Purnima is a rural woman of only 23 years, energetic, enterprising and hardworking.  She is married and lives in their own kachha house (a house made of bamboo, mud and straw), with her husband and two children (one son and one daughter).  Both Purnima and her husband Manik have a primary education and their children are in grades five and two.  They live in Sarkarpara in the district of Jalpaiguri.

Purnima's husband works as a daily laborer under a building contractor on daily wages.  His income is hardly sufficient for their family's wellbeing.  So, Purnima grows vegetables on their own plot of land.  She grows green vegetables like bitter gourd, beans and chilies in her spare time after managing her household work. Her husband helps her to carry the produce to the local market to sell. In order to earn more profits to giving better financial sustenance to her family, she wants to grow more chilies, which are in great demand in their region.  She thinks it will be worthy enough to cultivate this in larger quantities to get more profit.

So Purnima has taken a loan from BJS to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other necessary things to grow more chilies.  She hopes it will generate additional income to fulfill her dreams to educate and establish their children properly, to give financial stability to her family and to build a concrete-made house.

She thanks her lenders (BJS and Kiva).

loans.use: To purchase chili seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Estanislaa

texts.es:
La señora Estanislaa tiene 62 años, es casada vive con su esposo y tiene 2 hijos todos mayores de edad, ambos  casados y que viven en forma independiente.
Comenta que recibió como herencia de sus padres un campo con animales vacunos.  Se casó siendo muy Joven   y junto con su esposo se dedican desde entonces a la venta de leche y queso que empezaron gracias a la herencia que recibió. Esta es una pareja muy trabajadora, ya que con sacrificio han podido criar a sus familias.
Hoy pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de un congelador para poder seguir con su trabajo y el cual le será de mucha utilidad para poder conservar de manera fresca sus productos para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Estanislaa is 62 years old, married and living with her husband. They have 2 grown children, both of whom are married and live independently. 

She tells us that she inherited a cattle ranch from her parents. She married very young, and ever since she and her husband have sold milk and cheese which their cows produce. They are a hardworking couple and have sacrificed to raise their family. 

Estanislaa requests this loan to invest in the purchase of a freezer, which will enable them to continue their work. The freezer will be very useful, keeping products fresh for them to offer to customers.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve help his housing and for his personal expenses.

loans.name: Evangely

texts.en:
Evangely is 39 years old and has six children. She is married and has five children who are in school.

She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out.

Evangely is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Evangely has been an NWTF borrower since 2012. She plans to recover through her sari-sari store business.

With your help, Evangely can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.

With your help she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Flordeliza would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college and save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

Marilyn is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future would like to save enough money to build a new house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

Hernanita is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 9,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013, and she plans to repay through her agriculture business.

In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home, and save some money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

Elsa has been an NWTF borrower since 2012, and she plans to repay through her agriculture business.

With your help, Elsa can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college and to provide a secure future for her family.

Gina is committed to rebuilding her devastated life. In the future she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family, and to be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and oversewing machine .

loans.name: Lucil

texts.en: Lucil owns and operates a business venture in the food sector making and selling food. While not her only means for generating revenue, her main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling grocery goods in their village. Lucil has been engaged in her business for seven years now, and earns well to sustain their living. Lucil joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lucil has successfully repaid a previous loan used for her business. Recently, Lucil took a new loan to purchase a new unit of net machine. She has had her business for more than a year now as a way to improve her business. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from this net machine to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase a new unit of net machine

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en: Ailyn is 24 years old and has two children in school. Ailyn works very hard to provide for them. Ailyn's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Ailyn has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Ailyn has taken a PHP 10000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Ailyn is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Nonita

texts.en: Nonita is 58 years old and married with 7 children. She works very hard to provide for them. Nonita's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Nonita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. Nonita has taken a PHP 9500 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Nonita is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn is 28 years old and has 3 children who are in school. She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out. Jenelyn is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 8500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. Jenelyn has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her buying and selling fish business. With your help, Jenelyn can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In future, she  would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Florifes

texts.en: Florifes works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan. She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 7000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family. With your help, she will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner. In the future, Florifes would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Delia

texts.es:
La señorita Delia es comerciante, se dedica a la venta de prendas variadas desde hace más de 8  años, con la venta de ropa en la zona de Villarrica, tiene dos locales de venta,  ubicados en lugares estratégicos.
Ella es una mujer muy trabajadora, que lucha y está trabajando arduamente para poder ir mejorando sus condiciones de vida, por medio de un trabajo digno y honesto. Agradece por la oportunidad que está recibiendo, y que le permitirá seguir con su trabajo.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar pantalones, remeras, blusas, y otras prendas para poder vender.
texts.en:
Delia is a merchant who has been selling a variety of clothing items for 8 years. She sells clothing in the area of Villarrica, where she has two sales properties in strategic locations.

She is a very hardworking woman who fights and works hard to improve her living conditions through honest and decent work. She is grateful for the opportunity she is receiving, which will help her to continue with her work.

She has applied for a loan to buy pants, T-shirts, blouses, and other clothing items to sell.

loans.use: to buy pants, T-shirts, blouses, and other clothing items to sell.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco es soltero, tiene 36  años y actualmente está viviendo con sus padres, es macatero, es decir, se dedica a la venta ambulante de artículos varios, como prendas, calzados y artículos de bazar.
Hace aproximadamente 4 años que está trabajando, y poco a poco está creciendo gracias a su sacrificio y a su esfuerzo, también ayudado por sus familias. Él es una persona muy emprendedora y por sobre todo muy luchadora.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar prendas, calzados, artículos varios de mercería para la venta.
texts.en:
Francisco, 36, is single and lives with his parents. He is a street vendor who travels around to sell a variety of items, such as clothing, footwear, and bazaar items.

He has been working for approximately 4 years, and little by little he is growing his business thanks to his hard work and effort. He also has the help of his family. He is a very enterprising and hardworking person.

He has applied for a loan to buy clothing, footwear, and a variety of merchandise to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothing, footwear, and a variety of merchandise to sell.

loans.name: San Miguel Group

texts.es:
San Miguel se llama este grupo, está en su tercer ciclo del programa de comité de mujeres, además ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, por medio de la cual podrán conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar e ir superando su situación de pobreza.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Dora,  quien se dedica a la venta de productos agrícolas que ella misma cosecha y siembra. Es una mujer que lucha y no teme a los desafíos, ya que por medio de su trabajo ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Su sueño es poder tener una gran huerta en la que pueda seguir con su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar semillas y abonos para continuar con la siembra de las mismas y continuar con su trabajo. Todas están muy contentas por la oportunidad que están recibiendo. en la foto aparecen 21 personas ya que el grupo tiene 21 miembros pero en este ciclo solo 17 retiran un préstamo.
texts.en:
The San Miguel group is in its third cycle of the Women's Committee Program. The members are participating in the poverty elimination survey so that they can get to know the situation of the other members and work to overcome their poverty.

One of the members of this group is Dora, who makes a living selling farm products which she personally plants and harvests. She is a fighter who is not afraid of challenges. Through her work, she helps her family and her loved ones. Her dream is to have a big garden to continue with her work.

She has applied for a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer to continue working and planting her products. All of the members are very happy to have this opportunity. There are 21 people in the photo because the group has 21 members, but in this cycle only 17 of them are applying for a loan.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer for her harvest.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables, chairs, silverway, and more to rent.

loans.name: Marcelino

texts.es:
Marcelino es un joven con muchas ganas de salir adelante, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza en su trabajo como preventista en un supermercado de su ciudad, con lo cual puede tener ingresos para poder salir adelante y poder solventar sus gastos.

Marcelino esta muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ua que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado  el podrá solventar algunos gastos personales y poder realizar mejoras en la vivienda donde habita, de esta manera podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y seguir eforzandose para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Marcelino is a young man with a great desire to succeed. He works hard every day in his job as a salesman at a supermarket in his city, which allows him to earn an income so that he can move forward and cover his expenses.

Marcelino is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help, he will be able to cover some of his personal expenses and make improvements to his home. In this way, he will be able to improve his quality of life and continue working hard to make his greatest dream come true: to have his own house.

loans.use: to cover personal expenses and make improvements to his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Artesanas De Potrero Poli Group

texts.es:
17 son las integrantes que forman este grupo llamado Artesanas de Potrero Poli, todas ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que decidieron ayudarse para dar a sus familias todo lo que ellas no pudieron tener. Cada una está poniendo todo de sí para aprender y poder crecer para ayudar a su familia.
La señora Rocio es la Presidenta del comité,  ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de arreglos de flores. Es una persona muy trabajadora, y comenta que a su familia le da todo y trata de ayudarles siempre, aparte de ello también siempre trata de motivar a sus compañeras a que sigan luchando por poder ayudar e ir creciendo en el emprendimiento que cada una hace.
Rocio pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas, alambres, canastas, para la elaboración de flores artesanales, la misma realza ventas al por mayor.
texts.en:
The "Artesanas de Potrero Poli" group has 17 members, all of whom are women and heads of their households. They decided to help each other to give their families everything that they never had. Each one of them is putting in all of her effort to learn and grow in order to help her family.
