loans.use: to buy ingredients such as rice, oil and dried vegetables.

loans.name: Rimas Group

texts.en:
Samira is the featured representative of the Rimas group.  She joined with her best friends who trust each other to acquire a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua,

They all intend to improve their lives and this loan is their only hope. 

Samira is the lady standing in the center of the picture, with the green veil covering her hair.  She is a 42 year-old divorced mother of one child.  She has worked as a supervisor, providing cleaning services for the past four years.  Her years of experience make her more energetic and that makes her work go by faster.

Samira has been working hard to provide her only child with all of the necessary life demands including an education.  Although he lives with his father, she never stops working hard to make sure he has a better future.

Samira wants to start a new clothes selling business with her sister Beykeh, a 45-year-old single lady, standing at the far right side of the picture wearning the dark blue top.  She has also worked in the cleaning business for four years.

Fatima, the 39year-old single lady on the far left side of the photo, has worked in the clothes selling business for the past two years.

loans.use: to start a clothes selling business.

loans.name: New Africa Group

texts.en:
Ndika, who is in her late twenties, is married and has two kids, one of whom is in school. For six years now, Ndika has been managing a store of charcoal. She opens her business from 8 a.m. to 8 p.m. each working day and is able to make a very good monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her 13th loan request which she will use to replenish her store with sacks of charcoal. With her previous loans, all of which were paid back successfully, Ndika used to buy more sacks of charcoal. She usually restocks her business to avoid upward price movement and shortage, especially during this rain season. She manages to receive an extra income which she used to buy a plot of land, personal car and business motor vehicle with three wheels. Ndika dreams of building a house. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "New Africa" which totals seven members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish her store with sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
This is Lilia, 45, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Feliciano, a driver, and is a mother to her children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.
  
Lilia operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is basically a small convenience store, which sells groceries, toiletries and beverages piecemeal to the local neighborhood. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a 5 PHP amount of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns profits by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by the piece. Her store is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Lilia dreams for her business to grow bigger and hopes to give her children a good life and education. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Irene

texts.en:
This is Irene, 33, resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite in the Philippines. She is married to Samy, a tricycle driver. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.  

Irene operates a food stall. In the Philippines, the whole working community and most families only eat home-cooked meals during evenings when all of the family members are at home to take part of the meal. This is not only a usual family tradition but a matter of convenience and frugal living. It is considered a waste of money and time to spend on cooking gas and food for one or two persons when buying cooked rice and dishes cost less than raw food. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 500 PHP in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a 15, 000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantities of products like meats, rice, vegetables, condiments and seasonings, and frozen food products. 

Irene dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship*  members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for raw ingredients like rice, pork, chicken, vegetables and products needed for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase 24 bicycles to start up his bicycle rental service business

loans.name: Bladimir

texts.es:
Bladimir es un joven de 21 años el cual trabaja como obrero y ayudante perforista en una pequeña empresa de su ciudad desde hace año y medio, ya que copn este empleo es su única fuente de ingresos para poder salir adelante, sobre todo porque es padre de un pequeño de 1 año al cual quiere mucho y por quien se sacrifica día a día.

Bladimir esta agradecido con el apoyo que le brindan los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a ello podrá comprar un juego de comedor para su vivienda, y de esta manera poder ir mejorando su calidad de vida y seguir esforzándose para poder hacer realidad su gran sueño:” Tener su casa propia”.
texts.en:
Bladimir, 21, is a young man who works as a construction worker and as assistant to the person in charge of drilling for a small company in his city. He has been doing this for a year and a half. This is the only income he receives to get ahead. He is the father of a one-year-old boy. He loves him very much and he is the reason why he works hard every day.

Bladimir appreciates the help that Kiva lenders give him, because thanks to this he will be able to buy a dining room set for his house. He will improve his living conditions and will continue to work hard to achieve his biggest dream: “to buy his own house”.

loans.use: to buy a dining room set.

loans.name: Eden

texts.en:
This is Eden, 53, resident of Taguig, Philippines. She is single, and she works hard to provide income for her everyday expenses. 
Eden operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them with a little profit. Her products are men and women’s clothes, perfumes, lotion, and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offered. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of 300 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.
To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 30,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional stocks of supplies like perfumes, lotion, ready-to-wear clothing, and other products needed in her business.
Eden dreams that her business will continue to expand and hopes to open more stores. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for additional stocks of supplies like perfumes, lotion, ready-to-wear clothing, and other products needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to process her application for the Colombian regulatory and health authorities (INVIMA).

loans.name: Dúo Las Victorias De San Martin Group

texts.es: Dúo las Victorias de San Martin La encargada de este grupo es la señora Victoria quien es dueña de dos zapaterías en diferentes puntos de venta de su aldea.  Vende zapatos de piel para damas, caballeros y niños, tenis para damas, caballeros y niños, mochilas, yinas para damas y caballeros, pelotas de foot-ball  en diferente numeración, ropa interior para caballeros y cosméticos en general como champo, cremas, desodorantes, talcos, lociones en diferentes tamaños y calidad. El verano se aproxima y ella necesita comprar varias cosas para el negocio, las yinas le hacen falta en numeración y color, y tiene varios pedidos de zapatos y tenis. El dinero que tiene ahorrado no le alcanza por eso se ve en la necesidad  de pedir un cuarto crédito, cuenta con el apoyo incondicional de su esposo e hijos quienes atienden los otros locales y le da gracias a Dios por las oportunidades.  Su sueño es seguir creciendo y tener más locales ya que tiene tres hijos y desea dejarles un negocio acreditado a cada uno.
texts.en:
This is the Dúo Las Victorias de San Martin. The leader of the group is Victoria. She has two shoe shops in different locations in her village. She sells leather shoes for women, men and children, sports shoes for women, men and children, backpacks, flip flops for women and men, soccer shoes in various sizes, underwear for men and cosmetics like shampoo, creams, deodorants, powders, and lotions in different sizes and qualities.

Summer is approaching and she needs to buy various goods for her business. She needs flip flops in different sizes and colors and has various orders for leather and sports shoes. The money she has saved is not enough for these purchases, therefore she needs a fourth credit. She has the unconditional help of her husband and her children, who help in the shops, and she thanks God for the opportunities she has. 

Her dream is to grow her business and to have more shops, because she has three children and wants to leave each of them a stable business.

loans.use: to buy shoes for selling.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma offers balut, snacks, vegetables and smoked fish within her locality. She is 42 years old, and married with two children. One of her children is working while her youngest child is studying. Alma would like to take out for a loan of 10,000 PHP to be used in buying 500 pieces of balut. She knows that her requested loan amount has something to do with the increase of her income.

Alma is looking for continuous growth of her food-vending business so she can educate her youngest child and improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase 500 pieces of balut to sell.

loans.name: Narangarav

texts.en: Narangarav, 28 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Darkhan, the second largest city of Mongolia. They reside in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. She began rendering taxi service to local people after her husband became sick. She is requesting a loan of 1,150 USD to hire people to dig a well on her land. The well will help her to grow vegetables on her own as well as raise livestock.

loans.use: to dig a well.

loans.name: Cherilyn

texts.en:
This is Cherilyn, 32, resident of Puerto Princesa, Palawan, Philippines. Her partner is Raymund, a businessman. They have a child. They manage their household as they operate their business.  At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Cherilyn operates a salon business. She offers hair styling, hair grooming and services of the like. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Her salon is located adjacent to her house. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 400 in sales every day.

To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 8,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy supplies for her salon like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for her business. 

Cherilyn dreams of having another branch and hopes that her family is always in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and to also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for supplies for her salon like shampoo, hair treatment creams and oils, and other things needed for her business.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en: Romana is 38 years old and blessed with four children. They are currently residing in a rural community and make their living through farming. They work together in cultivating their farmland by planting various vegetables for sale. They aim to expand their vegetable production, but they don't have enough capital. For this reason, Romana wants to avail a loan of PHP 16,000.00 to buy certified seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides needed in growing vegetables. Through this financial assistance, they believe that they will increase their production and income.

loans.use: to buy certified seeds, fertilizers, and herbicides needed in growing vegetables

loans.name: Rezel

texts.en: Rezel has been operating her own service-based business for more than five years, and she earns well from this. With her generated revenue, she was able to sustain their living with the help of her husband. The couple had to work hard with determination of having better income to provide their children with a better education. To improve the services she offers, she took a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to cover her motorcycle maintenance costs. In the future, Rezel hopes to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to cover her motorcycle maintenance costs

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Meet Purity, 32, a mother of 2. She has more than 5 years of experience in mixed farming. She lives together with her children in Nkubu, an area of Kenya known for coffee plantations. Her primary source of income is from the sale of milk, eggs, and tea from her farm. She also offers transportation services to other farmers on her motorcycle. 

Generating income selling her produce is the part of farming she enjoys most. The high cost of farm inputs is a major challenge for Purity. Before joining Juhudi Kilimo, Purity could not access loans from banks since they considered her a high-risk client. She mobilized neighboring farmers and created a group called "Mathiamene Bodaboda." Through the group, she joined Juhudi Kilimo and learned about loan management and agribusiness. She also learned about Kiva.
 
Purity is seeking a loan for constructing a zero-grazing cow shed. With your loan, Purity will introduce zero grazing into her farm and construct a cow shed. Minimizing the movement of the cow by bringing the pasture to it will boost milk production. Zero grazing will also help Purity better manage her dairy farm. Increased income will help Purity comfortably meet the school related expenses that she is finding strenuous today.

loans.use: to construct a shed for zero grazing.

loans.name: Poen's Group

texts.en:
Poen is 55 years old. She is  living with her husband and two daughters in a rural village of the Sithor Kandal district. Rice farming is the only source for her family’s income. Having been in this business for 35 years, she is able to earn about 42,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
This is the first loan for Poen with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Poen is going to use her portion to renovate her old house. She hopes to have a decent house for living in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house.

location.town: Prey Veng Province, Sithor Kandal district

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad is a 46-year-old married and responsible person. He is living in a populated area of Sahiwal, Pakistan. His children are growing and their needs are as well. He wants to educate them in higher colleges after school period. To meet the educational expenses in the future, he wants to increase his daily sales and savings as well. 

He is a goods distributor by profession. He purchases goods of various brands related to laundry and various kinds of soaps and sells to the retailers. He wants to increase his distribution on a daily basis and excess goods are required for this purpose. The major problem is the lack of availability of funds. He hopes that with the help of the loan amount, he can fill his shop with fresh stock. In this way, he can easily cope with the increasing demand of retailers and can generate additional income to meet educational expenses in the future through savings. 
  
Therefore, Irshad has requested a Kiva loan through Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. He wishes to move his shop to a nearby market to enhance his daily sales.  

Irshad is very thankful to Kiva and field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy laundry stuff, beauty soaps and dish washing stuff.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to protect her coffee crops.

loans.name: Anselma Patricia

texts.es:
Anselma de 29 años de edad, es una persona muy educada muy conocida en su comunidad por la actividad que junto a su esposo realizan, se dedican al servicio de transporte de la ciudad hacia los cantones y caseríos, se creció con sus padres que se dedicaban a la agricultura y a la prestación de servicios de transporte con un pick up, y fueron sus padres los que le enseñaron a trabajar en el trasporte y de esta manera ha logrado salir adelante y a ser una persona honesta y servicial.

 Ella ayudaba a su madre en los quehaceres del hogar por las mañanas y por las tardes asistía a la escuela donde logro alcanzar su nivel educativo hasta el 8° grado. Con el paso del tiempo adquirió mucha experiencia y conocimientos sobre los oficios domésticos y prestación de servicio de transporte, y comenzó a trabajar a tiempo completo con su padre, ya que ella era la mayor de sus hermanos, los días que más se dedica a la prestación de servicio son los días sábados y domingos días en los que transporta personas a los diferentes cantones y caseríos personas que salen de compras al mercado. Fue así como se fue independizando y conoció a su esposo con quien decidió casarse y ahora son padres de 3 hijos,  los cuales se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad.

El dinero será utilizado en reparación de la dirección y compra de llantas del pick up, ya que ultimadamente ha tenido una buena demanda por parte de los usuarios de servicios y con las reparaciones y ajustes que le haga al pick up podrá prestar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, lo que le generara más ganancias que posteriormente serán invertidas en solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar y en mejoramiento de su casa. 


Las proyecciones que tienen para el futuro son las de haber cancelado el préstamo y adquirir uno de mayor monto para la compra de una nueva unidad de transporte, ya que con la que cuenta actualmente se está presentando algunas dificultades debido a que ya está viejo, y apoyara a sus hijos en la educación hasta que sean unos profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Anselma is 29 years old. She is a very polite person well known in her community for the activity she does with her husband. She operates a transport service to the villages. She grew up with her parents farming and offering transport services with a pick-up truck and her parents taught her how to do this. In this way she managed to become a honest and helpful person. She helped her mother with the housework in the mornings and in the afternoon attended school where she completed her Grade 8. With the passing of time she gained a lot of experience and knowledge about housework and the transport business and began to work full time with her father as she was the oldest of her siblings.

Saturdays and Sundays are the busiest days for the business as they transport the people from the different areas and villages who come out to buy at the market. In this way she became independent and met her husband. They decided to marry and now they have 3 children who are studying in the local school.

The money from the loan will be used to repair the steering and buy tires for the truck. Lately there has been a lot of demand for their service and with the repairs and adjustments to their truck they can offer a better service to their customers. This will make them more profits which will be used for the basic necessities of their household and in improving their home.

The plans Anselma has for the future are to pay off the loan and save a larger amount of money to purchase a new vehicle as the one they have is old and has some problems. She wants to support her children in their education so they can become successful professionals.

loans.use: to re[air the steering and buy tires for her truck.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm supplies to maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: María Hilaria

texts.es:
María de 43 años de Edad, es una mujer con un profundo deseo de superación siempre a luchado por su familia, su esposo le apoya con todo el amor y el esfuerzo que él puede. Siempre cada día al levantarse le dan gracias a Dios por las bendiciones recibidas,  su hijo les colabora en los trabajos del campo pero ella siempre se ha preocupado por el bienestar de su familia nos manifiesta que su esposo siempre laborando en el campo, pero ella luchando en su hogar educando a su hijo y inculcándole valores morales y espirituales esto lo ha llevado, hoy a servir en la iglesia de la localidad, pero siempre ha deseado mejorar su humilde vivienda y eso la motiva cada día a trabajar con mas ganas; porque manifestó que ese ha sido siempre su deseo que su casita sea un hogar mas acogedor para mi y mi familia. 

Ella ha trabajado siempre por el bienestar de su familia y como menciona en su vida siempre le ha gustado vender y hacer sus ventas desde tamales hasta frutas de temporada, pan dulce, ella misma hornea y así a logrado traer el sustento a su familia, cuando su esposo no trabaja de jornalero o en su parcela ella se encarga de ver como le hace para traer la comida a la casita.


El préstamo sera utilizado para instalar unas puertas en la cocina y el piso, ya que siempre su deseo ha sido tener una vivienda digna para vivir junto a su familia poco a poco manifiesta que lo realizara.          


 Su gran deseo y propósito para el futuro es ver su casita mejorada y renovada.
texts.en:
María, 43, is a woman who has a great desire to succeed. She has always fought for her family. Her husband supports her with all of his love and effort. Every day when they wake up, they give thanks to God for the blessings they have received. Their son collaborates with them in the farm labor. She has always worried about her family's well-being. Her husband has always worked in the fields, but she works in the household, educating their son and instilling moral and spiritual values in him. This brought him to serve in the local church. She has always wanted to improve her humble home, which motivates her to work harder every day. Her wish has always been for her house to be more comfortable for her and her family.

She has always worked towards her family's well-being, and she has enjoyed selling tamales and seasonal fruits as well as sweet bread which she bakes herself. In this way, she has managed to bring home her family's sustenance. When her husband is not working as a day laborer or on their plot of land, she is in charge of bringing home their daily food.

She will use this loan to install doors in the kitchen and a floor. Her wish has always been to have a decent home in which she can live with her family. Little by little, she will achieve this.

Her greatest wish and goal for the future is to improve and renovate her house.

loans.use: to install doors in her kitchen and a floor.

loans.name: Serjmaa

texts.en: Mrs. Serjmaa, 41 years old, lives with her husband and three children in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling), on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She and her husband have been making and selling wooden products such as frames, doors and chairs to local people since 2010. She also supplies homemade cookies to vendors at wholesale price. She is requesting a loan of 825 USD to buy a computer. The computer will be used for designing wooden products, which will increase work efficiency. The borrower is innovative and wants to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a computer for product design.

loans.name: Caridad

texts.en:
Caridad has owned and operated a tailoring business for many years. She provides women's tailoring services to local community members. For many years has Caridad earns well and was able to sustain the business. Caridad repaid her previous loan used for the business with the revenue she generated.

In 2008, Caridad joined GDMPC and gained access to financial services and the ability to engage in business activities. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase sewing materials and textiles. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase sewing materials and textiles

loans.name: Blanca Etelvina

texts.es:
Blanca es una persona de 32  años de edad,  es una madre de 3 hijos  de los  cuales son dos varones  y una niña todos sus hijos se encuentran estudiando educación básica en la escuela de su comunidad, la señora posee un negocio propio que se trata de una tienda donde vende productos de primera necesidad, que está ubicada en el centro de su comunidad.  Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable que cuenta con valores y principios tanto morales como espirituales es muy reconocida por las personas de su comunidad por la actividad que ella realiza, como lo es la crianza de cerdos y por su forma de vivir con los vecinos.

 Ella se dedicó a trabajar en una tienda cando era joven y fue allí donde comenzó y adquirió experiencia, luego adquirió un crédito para poner su propia tienda y así comenzó con su negocio y hasta el día de hoy  se mantiene trabajando y con ayuda de su esposo le dan el sustento diario a su familia y garantizan los derechos fundamentales a sus hijos e hija. 


La señora tiene una experiencia de 15 años en trabajar con tienda y crianza de cerdos, ya que lo aprendió porque ella se desempeñó trabajando en una tienda y fue allí donde adquirió conocimiento y experiencia en la actividad que actualmente realiza. Y la crianza de cerdos la aprendió de sus padres y a esta actividad se suman su esposo y sus dos hijos mayores.


El dinero será invertido para comprar arroz, frijoles, azúcar, detergentes, productos para el cuidado personal, aceites, condimentos, etc y cerdos para crianza y posteriormente venderlos;  ya que se ha convertido en su principal fuente de ingresos y de esta forma dará un mejor servicio a sus clientes y tendrá una evidente mejora en las ganancias económicas de su tienda. Lo cual invertirá en mejoramiento de su vivienda.


Los sueños de Blanca son los de ver a sus hijos graduados de la universidad que sean unos profesionales de éxito, personas de bien, que le sirvan a su familia y a su comunidad, también quiere ampliar su negocio y montar otra tienda en otro caserío de su comunidad y esto lo va lograr con ayuda de otro financiamiento, según expreso y también se proyecta a comprar un vehículo el cual le facilitara el traslado de los cerdos.
texts.en:
Blanca, 32, is a mother of three. She has two sons and one daughter. All of her children are studying at the local primary school. She has her own business, a store where she sells basic products. Her store is located in the center of her community. She is a very hardworking, responsible person who has both moral and spiritual values and principles. She is very well-known in her community for her business activity, for raising pigs, and for her manner with her neighbors.

She started to work in a store when she was young, which is where she started to gain experience. She later took out a loan to open her own store and started with her own business. She is still working, and with the help of her husband she brings home the daily sustenance to her family and guarantees that her sons and daughter have their basic rights.

She has fifteen years of experience working in the store and raising pigs. Her experience working in a store gave her knowledge and experience for this business. She learned about raising pigs from her parents, and her husband and two oldest children help with this activity.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, detergent, personal products, oil, condiments, etc. She will also buy pigs to raise and later sell. This has become her main source of income, and she will be able to offer her clients a better service and noticeably increase her store's financial profit. She will invest these earnings in improving her home.

One of Blanca's dreams is to see her children graduate from university and become successful professionals as well as good people who serve their family and community. She also wants to expand her business and open another store in another part of her community. She will accomplish this with the help of another loan. She also plans to buy a vehicle which will help her to transport her pigs.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, detergent, personal products, oil, condiments, etc. as well as to buy pigs.

loans.name: Sam Art

texts.en:
Aged 43 years old, Sam Art is a married mother of five children, living in a rural village of the Kampong Siem district, Cambodia. Two of her children are dependents and still in school. To support her family, Sam Art and her husband have been working as construction workers and sometimes they work for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 34,500 KHR per day. 
Sam Art has been with VisionFund for this cycle only, and now she is applying for a loan to buy school materials for supporting her children’s studying. She hopes her children will have enough school materials for studying.

loans.use: to buy school materials for supporting her children’s studying

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Chanthorn's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in Banteay Meanchey province’s Mongkul Borey district, Chanthorn, 42, is single. Chanthorn has been farming rice for 22 years. He can earn about 33,000KHR per day to meet his family’s need. 

Chanthorn just joined VisionFund for this loan cycle. Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan. As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland. He hopes this loan will enable him to earn more income from his current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for his farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Naimat Ali

texts.en:
Naimat Ali is 33 years old. He is a young and energetic person living in the area of Sahiwal, Pakistan. He is the father of two children and lives near his clothing shop. This clothing shop is only source of income for his family, and this is the reason he devotes all his time to the garment shop. 
His shop situated under the clothing market, and there are lot of competitors there. Due to the competition, it is very difficult to convince customers to buy at higher prices. This competition causes low sales and more efforts as well. He has to maintain the latest designs, rates and delightful colors of clothing in the shop so that he can maintain the rate of sales.
Now the major problem is that the summer season has started and he does not have sufficient cash in hand to buy clothing related to the summer season. If he can't replace the winter season clothing with the summer season’s clothing, it might highly affect his sales. He does not want to reduce his sales and monthly income.
Therefore, Naimat Ali has requested a loan from Kiva’s field partner BRAC Pakistan, so he can be empowered to buy the clothing of the summer season. 
Naimat Ali hopes that he will purchase clothing according to his desire and at the right time so he can cope with the market competition and grow his income as well. He thanks Kiva and the field partner for this support.

loans.use: To buy a seasonal new collection of clothing for reselling.

loans.name: Elba Eneida

texts.es:
Elba de 21 años de Edad, es una joven de lucha y muy emprendedora con deseos de superación con ganas de salir adelante apenas salio del colegio comenzó a trabajar a sus 21 años para ayudar a su familia, comenta que le gusta practicar deportes y salir de paseo con su familia es de espíritu libre. Le encanta pasear en motocicleta, pero le da un poco de miedo, pero cuando hay una firme convicción de alcanzar un objetivo se logra, en su trabajo es muy responsable y ordenada como en su casa ya que  es la tercera de sus 5 hermanos pero ha sabido llevar las vicisitudes de la vida con gran empeño desea llegar muy alto pero con esfuerzo y coraje y con proyección de futuro.


Ella es empleada de una institución bancaria donde se desempeña como secretaria de gerencia, pero su lugar de trabajo le queda un poco lejos de su casa  y se le dificulta mucho el transporte, nos manifestó que aveces a llegado un poco tarde a su trabajo motivo por el cual le han llamado la atención, pero esto, no la ha perturbado de sus objetivos, ya que es una joven luchadora con firmes deseos de superación, buscando siempre el bienestar de su familia y el suyo propio.    


El préstamo sera utilizado para la compra de una motocicleta, en la cual se transportara desde su casa de habitación hasta su lugar de trabajo, ya que este esta bastante lejos de su casa, ella a tenido este deseo desde que por motivos ajenos a ella llego tarde a su trabajo y no desea que esto siga pasando, el transporte publico es muy lento nos comentaba así que al poder comprar esta motocicleta  le servirá como su medio de transporte evitando así este inconveniente.           


 Planea en un futuro terminar sus estudios superiores y  comprar un vehículo a medida las posibilidades se lo permitan con un firme deseo de compromiso buscando siempre el bienestar de su familia y el suyo personal.
texts.en:
Elba is a 21 year old fighter and entrepreneur with the desire to improve and to get ahead. Once she graduated from school she started to work to help her family. She comments that she likes to play sports and go out with her family. She is a free spirit. She loves to ride motorcycles but is a bit afraid of them. When she decides to do something, she does it. She is responsible and organized in her work and at home. She is the 3rd of 5 children. She knows how to rise above the mishaps of life.

She is an employee at a bank where she works as an administrative secretary. Her workplace is a bit far from her house and she has a lot of trouble getting to work. She says that she has arrives late at times and she has been called out for it. This has not gotten her away from her objectives as she is a young fighter with pretensions of improving, always looking for the well-being of her family and herself.

The loan will be used to buy a motorcycle which she will use to get to work, which is quite a distance. She has this desire as she has been late for work through no fault of her own. She doesn't want this to continue. The public transport is very slow so having a motorcycle will avoid this inconvenience.

She plans to finish her studies in the future and buy a car when she can afford it. She has the solid desire to look out for the well-being of her family and her own.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle.

loans.name: Eronides

texts.es:
Eronides de 65 años de edad, es un hombre que a su edad nos comenta sobre los muchos ratos que de su experiencia en lo agrícola ha pasado junto a su esposa. La cual le a echado el hombro para trabajar incansablemente  por mejorar sus condiciones y trascendentalmente su calidad de vida cultivando junto a sus dos hijos, hoy comenta ya están aparte sus hijos;  pero no se olvidan de sus viejos que les enseñamos a respetar a los demás y sobre todo el amor a Dios; manifiesta que la lucha es uno quien la debe hacer, para salir adelante con los compromisos de la vida se necesita seriedad, por tanto la lucha es dura pero si se tiene la firme convicción de alcanzar el objetivo se hará. 

Él  trabaja la tierra de sol a sol nunca rendirse ante los obstáculos que la vida pone; cultiva maíz, frijol, maicillo y sorgo para sus animales ya que los vende y compra, recuerda que desde que tenia 10 años esta trabajando en el campo, pero siempre con la fe puesta en mi Dios, así pues con todo eso se  siente muy feliz de haber llegado a la edad que tiene trabajando duro la tierra junta a su esposa.     


El préstamo sera utilizado para comprar una Picadora de Sacate, ya que la necesita para preparar el forraje para la alimentación de su ganado, ya que así le sale mas barato la producción del alimento y no tiene que andar buscando quien se lo prepare como antes, esto vendrá a mejorar los tiempos de preparación del concentrado y su calidad, ya que no hay como lo hecho en casa.           


Él comenta que ya teniendo esta herramienta en su manos, podrá también preparar concentrado para otros ganaderos de la zona y así tendrá un ingreso extra, porque hay muchos aquí que tambien preparan concentrado para ellos.
texts.en:
Eronides is a 65-year old man who talks about the many experiences he has had in agriculture with his wife. She has helped him a lot to improve their life conditions and quality of life by cultivating together with their two children. Their children are already independent, but they do not forget about their parents, who taught them to respect everyone and specially the love for God. He says that one must fight to get ahead in life and needs to be serious. This fight is difficult, but if one has the firm conviction to reach his goals, he will meet them. 

He works in the land from sunrise to sunset and never gives up. He cultivates corn, beans and sorghum for the animals that he buys and sells. He remembers that he has worked in the land since he was 10 years old, always with his faith in God. He feels very happy after his long life of hard work with his wife. 

He will use the loan to buy a forage mincer, so that he can prepare the forage for his cattle. This will lower the cost of food production and will not need to search for someone to prepare it. Preparing the concentrate will be faster and quality will be better, as there is nothing like what is done at home. He will also be able to prepare concentrate for other stockbreeders in the area, which will give him additional income.

loans.use: to buy a forage mincer.

loans.name: Jana Group

texts.en:
Rafika is the featured borrower of Jana group. She got together with the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends. They are seeking to develop their living.

Rafika is a 45-year-old married mother of two children. She is the first lady sitting on the right side of the picture with the green top. Rafika works at her house in a handcraft business with 10 years of experience. Her wide experience in this domain provided her with her customers’ trust and support. 

This is her fifth consecutive loan cycle from Al Majmoua. Her previous loans helped her a lot in developing her family’s living through supporting her husband in covering their increasing living needs. Today, her acquired loan will be invested in making necessary maintenance at her house to keep it a healthy living place.

As for the other group members, Entisar is the lady sitting in the center of the picture, and Elham is the first lady on the far left side of the picture.

loans.use: to do necessary maintenance at her house

loans.name: Karibu View Group

texts.en:
Naomi is in her late 30s and is single with one son who is at school. She has been running a general store selling soft drinks, sweets, sugar, maize, baking flour and other stuff since 2007. She also has a small project selling fabrics and women's bags on credit since 2013. Naomi works from 8 am to 9 pm each working day and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her sixth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans (all of which she paid back successfully) to buy diet drinks, dry food items and other popular products for her general store. She dreams of expanding her portfolio with a successful business. Naomi received extra income, which she used to buy a TV and cover school fees and household expenses. With her new loan request, she will buy take-away soft drinks and other popular products demanded in her shop.

Naomi will share this loan with her loan group "Karibu View", which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy take away soft drinks and other popular products demanded in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to open another butcher business and to buy meat for both butcher businesses.

loans.name: Martina

texts.es:
Martina se dedica a la  agricultura, a la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes y gallinas y le va excelente, ella agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior pues le ayudo con el capital del negocio entonces en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas. 

Martina nació en la comunidad de Cuyo Grande (Pisaq, Cusco, Perú) pero vive en la comunidad de Jajahuana. (La comunidad de Jajahuana está ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 36 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos.
texts.en:
Martina makes a living in farming, cattle raising and raising small animals such as guinea pigs and hens. This work is going really well. Martina is infinitely grateful to all the investors who supported her with her previous loan. This helped her with capital for the business; this loan will be used to buy young animals such as guinea pigs and hens.

Martina was born in the Cuyo Grande community in Pisaq, Cusco (Peru) but now lives in the Jajahuana community. (Jajahuana is in the Challabamba district of the Paucartambo province of Cusco department). Martina is 36 years old and has a partner and six children.

loans.use: to buy young animals, such as guinea pigs and hens.

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en: Being a responsible father, Ramon aims to improve his farming business to provide the necessities of his family. He is 44 years old and has seven children in school. He wants to educate all of his children so that they will be the ones to support him when he gets old. To improve his farming business, he is asking for a loan of PHP 24,000 to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay the expenses incurred in planting vegetables. He is hoping that he will receive his loan request to be able to improve his farming business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides and pay the expenses incurred in planting vegetables

loans.name: Albert

texts.en: Albert supports his family by raising pigs for sale. With his generated income, his previous loan used for buying piglets was successfully repaid. He also works on the family's farm to make extra income. He joined GDMPC and he gains access to microfinance services. Recently, Albert took a new loan to purchase feed in order to improve the business and earn an income for his own future. He plans to build a shelter for his pigs to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase feed.

loans.name: Liezel

texts.en: Liezel is 29 years old, single, and has one infant child. She is from Mitimos, Rizal. She sells firewood. She earns a meager income of 5,000 PHP doing this work. Liezel is a new member of PMPC and previously took a loan for the start up of her firewood retail business. Recently, she approached PMPC for another loan to buy more firewood to resell. The profit she earns from the business will be saved for the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy firewood for resale

loans.name: Christopher

texts.en:
Christopher is 66 years old, married, with five adult-age children.  He lives in Mitimos, Rizal, and has been a carpenter for 30 years.  He earns a monthly income of PHP 7,500 doing this type of work.  

He has belonged to  Paglaum since 2012 and took loans for his carpentry work. In need of finances to purchase wood and nails for roof repair, he reached out to PMPC for a loan of PHP 5,000. In the future, Christopher wants to save more for emergency purposes.

loans.use: to purchase wood and nails for roof repair

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Meet Catherine, a mother of five from Chuka, Kenya. She has been doing mixed farming for the last 15 years.  Her primary income sources are eggs, tea and vegetables. She also earns extra money engaging in other small personal business.

She derives a great deal of personal gratification attending to her animals (which she has named). However, marketing of her produce and occasional drought periods are her biggest challenges. 

Catherine was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Helps farmers acquire farming assets.'  During Juhudi's required micro-finance training session, Catherine learnt that Kiva, in her words, 'helps the poor access finances'.

Catherine is seeking a loan to start pig farming. She has been saving over the years to purchase pigs but she needs help to construct a piggery. Once the house is in place, she will buy the pigs. There is a big market for pig products in Central Kenya. Catherine will have no trouble repaying the loan.
Today, her highest monthly expense is school fees. This loan will help her to raise the living conditions of her family and pay school fees with ease.

loans.use: To construct a piggery

loans.name: Santos Maria

texts.es:
María tiene 53 años de edad, vive junto a su hija en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de fruta en el exterior del mercado de su distrito, es conocida en por la labor que realiza, su hija le apoya en esta labor , ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de frutas para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
María is 53 years old and lives with her daughter in the Cayaltí district of Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. Here the people make a living in farming, business and cattle raising.

María makes a living selling fruit outside the district market. She is well-known for her work and receives support from her daughter. María has applied for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy a variety of fruits to sell to customers. This way she can earn a higher living for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of fruits to sell to customers.

loans.name: Ren's Group

texts.en:
Ren is aged 36 years old and married with one kid who is still in school. She and her family live in a village of the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province. To make a living, she has been growing cassava and farming rice for 14 years, earning about 26,000 KHR per day.

Ren has been with VisionFund for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Ren is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her crops better and produce higher yields in order to increase her family’s income.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Vidal Geovanny

texts.es:
Vidal de 35 años de edad es una persona que dedica su tiempo a los trabajos agrícolas (diferentes tipos de trabajos), para sacar adelante a su familia, a él  lo que mas le interesa es el bien de sus hijos y de su esposa, por esta razón lo hace una persona luchadora y laboriosa  que haga un trabajo muy bien hecho en las áreas que él trabaja durante estos años de vida.  Aprendió dicho  trabajo  a la edad de 15 años cuando aún era un adolescente, sus padres lo instruyeron por el buen camino, le enseñaron a hacer una persona luchadora ante las adversidades de la vida.

 Actualmente, vive con su querida esposa,  ella se dedica a los trabajos domésticos del hogar a mantener la alimentación para sus hijos y el de su esposo, ademas se dedica al crianza de animales de traspatios y a la costura 

El  dinero sera empleado para la compra de porcinos, para la crianza de los mismos , para  trabajar y obtener muy buenos ingresos,  mantener el bienestar de su familia. 

Los  planes a futuro son  montar una granja de porcinos y poder comercializar la carne a su vecindario, ya que no hay muchas competencias, poder generar trabajo para otras personas.
texts.en:
Vidal is 35 years old and works in agriculture (he does different types of work in this area) in order to help his family to prosper. What matters most to Vidal is his wife and children's well-being. For that reason, he is plucky and hard-working, and does his work very well. Vidal learned his trade at the age of 15 years old. His parents taught him well, and made him a feisty person for when facing adversities in life.

Vidal currently lives with his wife, whom he loves. She does the household chores and prepares the meals for Vidal and the children. She also raises animals and does sewing work.

This loan will be used to buy pigs to raise. With the pigs Vidal can work and earn a good income and look after his family's well-being.

Vidal's future plans include starting a pig farm and selling the meat in his neighbourhood. There is not much local competition and VIdal could generate employment for other people.

loans.use: to buy and raise pigs.

loans.name: Cooproriz Nyiramageni G4 Group

texts.en:
Marie Rose is 48 years old. She is married to a farmer and they both have four children.  She has spent fifteen years in the rice farming. She will use the Kiva loan to support labor costs and fertilizer during rice production: they need to buy fertilizers in order to increase their production. With profits from her farming she wishes to invest in her business so that in the future she can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance her farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Leap's Group

texts.en:
Leap, 46, lives with her husband and four children in a village in Banteay Meanchey province’s Moungkul Borey district, Cambodia. To make a living, she and her husband have been farming rice for almost 26 years. The current business earns her about 14,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Leap has been with Kiva’s partner VisionFund for six loan cycles and completely paid back the loans. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Usalama Group

texts.en:
Msichoke is a mother of two kids, one of whom is at school while the other is still a baby. Msichokee is married and for three years now, she has had a business selling fresh juice. She makes her own juices, and opens the business from 7 a.m. to 11 p.m. each working day, and is able to make a very small profit. 

Msichoke is requesting a third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy a juicer which is now defective, but she will replace it with a new one. After the previous loans, Msichoke started making other types of juices which she hadn't made before. She managed to pay back all of her loans. Msichoke used the profit to cover school fees and home food expenses. With her new loan, Msichoke will buy a new brander (juicer) to replace the defect. She dreams of renting a good business place. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "USALAMA" which totals three members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy a new brander (juicer) to replace the defect.

loans.name: Banco Comunal El Milagro Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal el Milagro está conformado por ocho mujeres, madres solteras con quince hijos bajos su responsabilidad. Son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región, se caracterizan por ser trabajadoras, responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron estudiar, y se vieron en la necesidad de trabajar a temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Alba Lidia y tienen por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica  a su negocio unas doce horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. El Milagro agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países  pobre como es Nicaragua para tener  un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The communal bank "El Milagro" ("The Miracle") is made up of eight women, single mothers with a total of fifteen children in their care. They are from Sauce, a place in the north of the region, and they are hardworking, responsible, and driven to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to lack of economic resources they were unable to study, and they had to work from an early age, to help with the household expenses. 

Thanks to her efforts and her will to succeed, the coordinator is Alba Lidia, who has a small grocery store that sells edible products, such as rice, beans, milk, bread, eggs, juices, and soft drinks, in small quantities. She works in her business some twelve hours a day, selling her products, so that in the near future she can make more money. "El Milagro" is grateful for the help offered by the Kiva investors to people of few resources and from poor countries such as Nicaragua, so that they can have decent jobs.

loans.use: to invest in working capital and to stock her business of selling and buying edible products such as: rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, juices, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Fransisco

texts.es:
Fransisco se dedica a la venta de yeso y le va excelente, él agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior pues le ayudo con el capital del negocio y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar herramientas y leña.

Francisco tiene 43 años, está casado y tiene cinco hijos, él nació en la comunidad de Viscochoni pero vive en la comunidad de Jajahuana con su familia.
texts.en:
Francisco makes a living selling gypsum, and this work is going really well. He is infinitely grateful to all the investors who supported his first loan as this gave him capital for the business; Francisco needs this loan in order to buy tools and firewood.

Francisco is 43 years old, married and has five children. He was born in the Viscochoni community but now lives with his family in Jajahuana.

loans.use: to buy tools and firewood.

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas se dedica a la ganadería, la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo, gallinas y chanchos y en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar un toro. 

Felicitas nació en el distrito de Challabamba y vive en el mismo distrito donde nació. (El distrito de Challabamba se encuentra dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo del departamento del Cusco, Perú). Ella tiene 49 años de edad y tiene una relación unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos de la cual tres de sus hijos están a su lado pero los demás ya son independientes, ella agradece infinitamente a todos los inversionistas que le apoyaron con el préstamo anterior pues le ayudo con el capital del negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas makes a living through cattle ranching, agriculture, and raising small animals, such as chickens and pigs. She needs a loan to purchase a bull. Felicitas was born in the district of Challabamba and she lives in the same district where she was born. (The district of Challabamba is in the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru.) She is 49 years old and she lives in a common law marriage, from which she has seven children, three of whom are with her while the others are independent.

She is infinitely grateful to all of the investors that supported her with the previous loan because it helped her with capital for her business.

loans.use: to purchase a bull

loans.name: Grace

texts.en: Grace is operating an internet cafe in town and provides refreshment services for her customers. She earns a better income to sustain her living. From her generated income, she had successfully repaid her previous loan used for the business. Recently, she took a new loan to cover the costs for computer maintenance. She is looking forward to be able to have another branch of her business in the future.

loans.use: to cover the costs for computer maintenance.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is 45 years old and married with one school age child.  She is presently residing in Poblacion, Sibutad. She busies herself doing a piggery business. This has been going on for six years now. PMPC has been a constant help since the start of her business.

In need of capital to purchase more bags of feeds for her piggery, she applied for a loan from PMPC. 

Analiza deeply wishes to build a good septic tank and build more concrete pig cages for proper sanitation.

loans.use: to purchase bags of feed for her piggery

loans.name: Georgina

texts.es:
Georgina tiene 48 años de edad, vive junto a su esposo e hijos en el distrito de Morropon una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de variedad de productos en una pequeña bodega ubicada en su domicilio, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de productos como sacos de arroz, bidones de aceite entre otros y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Georgina is 48 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Morropon district, a community with a warm climate. Morropon district belongs to the province of the same name, in the Piura region on Peru's northern coast. Here the people make a living in farming, business and cattle-raising.

Georgina makes a living selling a variety of products from the small store that she runs out of her home. She has applied for a loan of 500 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy a larger quantity of products, such as a bags of rice, cans of oil and more. With these items Georgina will be able to earn a higher income for her family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of products to stock up her business.

loans.name: Wilder

texts.es:
Wilder tiene 41 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de transporte público en su propia mototaxi, trasladando a sus pasajeros a zonas aledañas a su distrito, ha solicitado un préstamo de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de repuestos para su vehículo y de esta manera seguir brindando un buen servicio a sus clientes generando mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Wilder is 41 years old and lives in the Oyotún district of Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region of Peru's northern coast. Here the people make a living in farming, cattle raising and business.

Wilder has his own rickshaw that he uses to provide public transport, taking passengers around the district. He has applied for a loan of 1000 Nuevo Soles in order to buy spare parts for his vehicle. This will allow him to continue offering good service to customers and to generate a higher income for his family.

loans.use: to buy parts for his vehicle.

loans.name: Saem's Group

texts.en:
Saem, 22, is married with one kid residing in a rural village located in the Kampong Cham province’s Memot district, Cambodia. For the last three years, she has been growing cassava as the primary source of her family’s income and she can earn about 20,000 KHR per day to meet the family's needs. 

Saem has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loan from VisionFund has helped her better support her family. Now, leading her group to apply for a loan, Saem will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to grow her cassava to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Cheab

texts.en:
Cheab is 37 years old and married with four children. She lives in a rural village of the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district earning a living through farming rice and growing cassava. She can earn about 67,000 KHR per day from the current business and can save about KHR 40,000 each day for her future needs.

This is the first microloan for Cheab with VisionFund. Now she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of the loan to pay for plowing the field. She hopes to grow rice and sell it for a good price to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Margarita

texts.es:
Margarita tiene 30 años de edad, vive junto a sus padres en el distrito de Morropon, una comunidad de clima caluroso, su población se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, que pertenece a la Provincia del mismo nombre, que pertenece a la Región Piura, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de gaseosas, bodoques que ella misma prepara a base de fruta, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 500 nuevos soles para la compra de variedad de frutas de estación para ofrecer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Margarita is 30 years old and lives with her husband and children in the Morropon district, a community with a warm climate. Morropon district belongs to the province of the same name, in the Piura region on Peru's northern coast. Here the people make a living in farming, business and cattle-raising.

Margarita makes a living selling fizzy drinks and popsicles, which she herself prepares with fruit. Margarita has applied for a loan of 500 Nuevo Soles from "Edpyme Alternativa" in order to buy a variety of seasonal fruits to sell to her customers.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seasonal fruits to sell to customers.

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es:
La socia es la Sra. Dolores; La socia pertenece al banco comunal SAN RAFAEL la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de servicios de llamadas telefonicas, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia continua realizando llamadas telefónicas nacionales y locales a todos sus cl9ientes que le solictan, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar un equipo para su negocio.
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Dolores is a member of the San Rafael village bank. She continues making a living with her telephone call service business. She has worked in this business for a good amount of time and it is going well, thanks to the effort that she puts in every day. She continues to make national and local telephone calls for all of her clients. She wants to continue working in this business to continue supporting her family.

She is requesting this loan to buy equipment for her business. She is happy with the loan and promises to make her payments.

loans.use: to purchase equipment for her business.

loans.name: Asunta

texts.es:
Asunta se dedica a la agricultura entonces ella tiene varios terrenos de cultivos donde siembra  maíz, papas, cebada, trigo y otros productos secos, ella continua con la venta de productos secos y con llevar sus productos a las ciudades de Challabamba y Cusco. Asunta también se esta dedicándose a la venta de comida de forma ambulatoria. 

En esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como carne de pollo y verduras. Ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a pagar sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en: Asunta earns her living in agriculture. She has multiple plots of farmland where she grows corn, potatoes, barley, wheat, and other grains. She continues to sell grains. She takes her products to the cities of Cusco and Challabamba. Asunta has also been selling food as an ambulant vendor. This time she needs a loan to buy supplies like chicken and vegetables. She is happy about the loan and agrees to repay on time.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like chicken and vegetables

loans.name: Yeri

texts.en: Yeri is a 36-year-old single woman. She is a tailor and she initiated the business in 2011. Although she has a disability, she does her best to fulfill her needs and, as much as possible, to help her sister's family needs too. Yeri usually receives orders to sew clothes, skirts, blouses, etc. Last year she got a new hemming machine and it has been useful to increase her income. Currently she receives many orders for school uniforms from her neighborhood. Due to the lack of money to purchase fabric for uniforms and school accessories, she then applied for a loan amounting to 4,000,000 IDR from TLM. The loan will be used to purchase materials such as fabrics, school accessories and threads.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as fabrics, school accessories and threads.

loans.name: Eradio

texts.es:
Eradio tiene 38 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa e hijos en el distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la compra y venta de animales menores (cuyes, patos y pavo) en la parte posterior de su domicilio, los alimenta con granos naturales de la zona, ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1 000 nuevos soles para la compra de mayor cantidad de animales para engordarlos y ofrecerlos a un mejor precio y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Eradio is 38 years old and lives with his wife and children in the district of Oyotún, a community dedicated to agriculture, animal husbandry, and trade that is located in the province of Chiclayo, belonging to the Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

He earns his living purchasing and selling small animals such as guinea pigs, ducks, and turkeys in the back of his home. He feeds them with natural grains from the area. He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 1,000 Peruvian soles to purchase more animals to fatten. He will be able to get a better price and thus generate more income for his family.

loans.use: to purchase high quality animals

loans.name: Patzulin Group

texts.es:
Francisco (es el primero del lado derecho que se encuentra en la fotografía) el es un hombre soltero de 56 años de edad, quien vive con sus cuatro hijos en el Departamento de Suchitepequez.
Francisco comenta que se dedica a la venta de banano, eligió esta actividad porque cuando era pequeño sus padres se dedicaban a lo mismo y es por ello que sigo con este negocio desde hace 50 años, hasta el momento le ha traído buenos beneficios en cuanto a la generación de ingresos y ganancias que le ayudan a contribuir a la economía de su familia.
El ha tomado la decisión de formar un grupo con el objetivo de mejorar la economía de las familias de los integrantes del grupo. El préstamo lo utilizaran para el mantenimiento de la venta de banano, ya que desean incrementar sus ganancias a través del servicio que les ofrecen a sus clientes.
El sueño de don Francisco es comprar un terreno, para que sus hijos puedan tener una vivienda en un futuro y así vivir en condiciones optimas.
texts.en:
Francisco (first on the right in the photo) is 56 years old and single. He lives with his four children in the Suchitepequez department.

Francisco tells us that he makes a living selling bananas. He chose to work in this area because, when he was a boy, his parents did this work. Francisco has now been working in this business for 50 years. He has earned good profits and a good income so far, and these have helped him to support the family economy.

Francisco has taken the decision to start a loan group in order to improve the members' financial situations. This loan will be used to maintain banana sales as Francisco wants to increase his profits at his work.

Francisco's dream is to buy a plot of land so that, in the future, his children can have their own home and live in good conditions.

loans.use: to maintain banana sales.

loans.name: Ustawi Group

texts.en:
Agnessy, who is in her early thirties, is married. She has been managing a drinks business selling soft drinks, beers and spirits for five years. She works from 4 pm to midnight and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is Agnessy's sixth loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy high-demand stock of drinks for her pub. She used the previous loans to pay for her new business place, bought chairs, tables and more drinks. She has paid back all previous loans successfully. Agnessy received a profit which she used to cover household expenses and plow back into her business. She dreams of introducing a big bar. 

She will share this loan with her loan group "Ustawi" which totals two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy high-demand stock of drinks for her shop.

loans.name: Marcosa

texts.es:
Marcosa se dedica a la agricultura y la crianza de animales menores como cuyes, pollos y gallinas. 
tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene seis hijos, ella vive en la comunidad de Jajahuana, ubicado en el distrito de Challabamba en la provincia de Paucartambo y el departamento de Cusco, Perú.

Marcosa está solicitando un préstamo de dinero que será invertido en la compra de pequeños animales como cuyes y gallinas.
texts.en:
Marcosa earns her living in farming and raising small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens. She is 42 years old, is married, and has six children. She lives in the community of Jajahuana located in the district of Challabamba, Paucartambo province, in the department of Cusco, Peru.
Marcosa is requesting a loan for money to invest in the purchase of small animals such as guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs

loans.name: Segundo Pedro

texts.es:
Segundo Pedro tiene 48 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Cayaltì, una comunidad de que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Se dedica al comercio de animales menores (patos, cuyes, pavos), los cría desde pequeños alimentándolos con granos naturales de la zona, luego de engordarlo los comercializa en el mercado de su distrito.

Ha solicitado un préstamo de 2 000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa para la compra de aves para crianza y de esta manera tener mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Segundo Pedro, age 48, lives in the Cayaltí district, a community that is devoted to agriculture, commerce, and livestock.  It is in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru.

He sells small animals (ducks, guinea pigs, turkeys).  He raises them, starting when they are little.  He feeds them natural grains from the area.  After fattening them, he sells them at the market in his district.

He has requested a loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 2,000 soles.  He will use the loan to buy birds to raise.  This way he will have greater income in order to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy birds to raise.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Meet Mary, a 33-year-old farmer who has been practising agriculture for three years. She lives together with her three children in the Kerugoya area of Kenya, where she has a small piece of land she works on. She is a proactive entrepreneur who is engaged in  farming business. Availability of labour, however, is her biggest challenge. 

Mary is seeking a loan to purchase goats for milk and meat. There is an increasing demand for goat meat in Kerugoya. Mary has successfully serviced previous loans she got from Juhudi Kilimo on time. 

The loan will help Mary increase her income to pay school fees for her children. Your loan will go a long way toward improving the living conditions of Mary’s family.

loans.use: To purchase goats

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase inputs to protect her coffee crops

loans.name: Berta Alicia

texts.es: Berta tiene 26 años de edad y habita ne casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 8 años de edad. Berta es pequeña comerciante de comida y pupusas desde hace 5 años. La venta la realiza en las diferentes zonas de su localidad y de esta forma se gana la vida y lleva el sustento a su hogar. Berta habita en condicione muy humildes y desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda por lo ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de las paredes de la vivienda para lo cual necesita comprar materiales como: ladrillo, arena, cemento, hierro, etc. Dado que su deseo y el de su compañero de vida es dar mejores condiciones de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Berta, age 26, lives in her own house with her life partner and her eight year old son.  Berta is a small merchant who has been selling food and ‘pupusas’ [stuffed tortillas] for five years.  She sells in different areas where she lives.  This way she earns a living and brings home the daily bread.  

Berta lives in very humble conditions.  She wishes to improve the condition of her house.  Therefore, she has made the decision to request this loan from FUSAI.  She will use the loan to build the walls of her house.  In order to do so, she needs to buy materials like bricks, sand, cement, and iron, etc.  This is because she and her life partner wish to give their family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build the walls of her house.

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is a 34-year-old mother who engages in raising hogs to help her husband in earning income. They aim to uplift their standard of living in order to educate their four children and give them a better living. 

Clarita wants to make her business profitable in order to earn sufficient income. Due to inadequate capital, she would like to access a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise. Despite hardships in life, she believes that she will improve her business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy hog feed, vitamins and additional pigs to raise

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Clara, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 52 years old with one adult child. She is presently residing in Libertad, Sapang Dalaga. She has been in coco land and fruit farming for 20 years now. Farming has covered the needs of her family. She joined Paglaum in 2012 and took out a short-term loan already. Recently, she applied for another loan to buy sacks of fertilizers for her farming activities. She has ventured into vegetable farming for added income. Myrna deeply wishes to expand her farm with another area to till.

loans.use: to buy sacks of fertilizers

loans.name: Valdomero

texts.es:
Valdomero tiene 30 años de edad, es soltero no tiene hijos a su cargo, vive en casa de su madre, en el Caserío de Vista Alegre, una zona rural del distrito de Santo Tomás, una comunidad que cuenta con los servicios de agua, ubicada en la Provincia de Cutervo que pertenece a la Región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú.

El se dedica a la cría y comercialización de ganado vacuno, posee tres cabezas de ganado vacuno, tiene experiencia en este rubro, como es costumbre en su distrito los días domingos se reúnen en la plaza de ganado para el comercio del mismo, ha solicitado un préstamo de 3 000 nuevos soles para la compra de dos toretes para engorde y de esta manera ofertarlo lo que le generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Valdomero, age 30, is single and has no children under his care.  He lives in his mother’s house in the Vista Alegre settlement.  It is a rural area in the Santo Tomás district, and the community does have water service.  It is located in the Cutervo province in the Cajamarca region in the northern highlands of Peru.

He raises and sells cattle.  He has three head of cattle, and he has experience in this line of work.  As is the custom in his district, on Sundays they get together at the livestock plaza in order to sell the livestock.
