He has requested a loan for 3,000 soles to buy two young bulls to fatten.  This way he will offer them for sale, which will generate greater income.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls to fatten.

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en: Nelson has been providing transportation services in his community for more than three years. He earns well from this and was able to sustain his family's living. Recently, he took a new loan new to cover the costs for motorcycle maintenance. In the future, he wants to sustain his transportation business and save his profit to use to provide a better education for his children.

loans.use: to cover the costs of motorcycle maintenance

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 30-year-old single man who has owned an internet café and an entertainment shop for four years. He also sells computer accessories, which increases his income. Mahmoud hasn’t faced any obstacles to be mentioned, and he is working hard to keep on developing his business properly. Mahmoud is acquiring a youth loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua to buy new computers for his shop so he can reply to the increasing number of customers requesting such services. He also provides them with PlayStation services, and in this way, he fills their time in an entertaining, healthy way. He hopes to keep on expanding and developing his business in a well-managed way to increase his income and improve his living.

loans.use: To buy new computers for his shop so he can reply to the increasing number of customers requesting such services

loans.name: Seat

texts.en:
A villager from a rural area located in the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district, Seat is 43 years old and married with one child. She and her husband have earned a living by farming rice and cassava for 25 years. Together, they can earn about KHR50,000 per day and can save about KHR30,000 daily for  future needs. 

This will be Seat's first loan with VisionFund, which she will use to buy fertilizers for her farmland and gasoline for water pumping in her field. She hopes to   sell her rice and cassava for a good price.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Yeang's Group

texts.en: Yeang is 61 years old and a villager from the Koh Sotin district of Kampong Cham province. She is married and blessed with nine children. The main source of her income is from rice farming, which she has had for ages. Yeang has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. Now, she is seeking a loan, and she is the leader of a group consisting of three members. She and her joint borrowers are requesting a loan of 1,400,000 riels each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland. She hopes to improve her business progressively.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pesticide for her farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Grisel Del Carmen

texts.es: La Joven Grisel, habita en Masaya junto a sus padres, Soltera, labora como docente para un colegio privado desde hace cinco años, ella está empezando a construir su casa con la ayuda de su papa, el crédito lo está solicitando para la compra de Materiales como: cemento, arena, hierro, bloques, piedrín, ella está bastante entusiasmada ya que muy pronto tendrá su propia vivienda.
texts.en: Young Grisel lives in Masaya with her parents. She is single and has been working as a teacher at a private school for five years. She is starting to build her house with her father's help. She is requesting a loan to buy materials such as cement, sand, iron, blocks and gravel. She is very excited, as she will soon have her own home.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is a diligent mother, who is blessed with three adult children. She owns and manages a retail store within the local community.

She aims to make her business profitable in order to satisfy their daily needs and to save for future emergencies. She plans to acquire more stocks of grocery items to sell, but she has limited capital. For this reason, Rosalinda is asking for a loan of PHP 20,000.00 to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, beverages, snack foods, laundry soaps, noodles, seasonings and frozen foods to resell. 

Through her patience and hard work, she believes that she will further improve the business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of soft drinks, beverages, snack foods, laundry soaps, noodles, seasonings and frozen foods to resell.

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
This is Liza, 26, a  resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. Her husband is Nicanor, a rolling coordinator, and a father to her child. She and her husband manage their household, while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Liza operates a retail business. What she basically does is buy jewelry from wholesalers and sell it per piece/pack for a profit. Products can range from beaded jewelry like necklaces to other like products. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low selling prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are students and mall patrons.  She earns a minimum of 500 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 12,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy more quantity and variety of jewelry to expand her product inventory.

Liza hopes to expand her business, and dreams of having a better living. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more quantity and variety of jewelry to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her coffee plantations.

loans.name: Sarat

texts.en:
Sarat is a resident from Kampong Cham province, and she is 35 years old. She is blessed with two children, one of whom is in school, and the one remaining is too young for schooling. 

To struggle for a living, she grows cassava and rice as the main source of income. It is the business that she has had for 15 years. 

This is the third loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). The past loans, which she has fully paid back, have enabled her to buy a paddy of farmland to expand her cash-crop farming. 

For this cycle, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more paddies of farmland to grow cassava and rice. She hopes to gain better income than before.

loans.use: to buy more paddies of farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Phall

texts.en:
Phalla is a local villager located in Kampong Cham Province, and she is a mother of seven children, three of whom are in school. 

To earn a living, she is running a small grocery business as the main source of income, and she also earns extra income via a pig raising business. The business that she has had for ages has generated a decent income to feed her family. She has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two past loans, which she has completely repaid. Now, her living conditions are getting better than before. 

For this cycle, she is applying for a loan of 2,000,000 KHR, and she will spend her entire loan to buy feed for her pig. She strong hopes that her business will go smoothly so as she can keep her kids in school.

loans.use: to buy feed for her pig.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies again to help with her coffee crop.

loans.name: Josafat Daniel

texts.es:
Dany tiene 25 años, es soltero y desde hace 4 años tiene un puesto donde vende pescados y mariscos.
Dany comenta que le gustan las motos, le gusta mucho cocinar mariscos en todas sus formas y también bailar y leer un poco. En su negocio prepara cocteles de todo tipo, pescados fritos,empanadas,ceviche,tostadas y camarones al gusto. Fue un negocio que inicio su abuela, pero hace 4 años, el decidió hacerse cargo y hacerlo crecer.
texts.en: Dany [short for Daniel] is 25 years old and single. He has had a fish and seafood business for four years. Dany says he likes motorcycles. He loves to cook all kinds of seafood, dance and read. He prepares all kinds of cocktails, fried fish, empanadas [stuffed bread or dough], ceviche, tostadas [deep fried tortilla with toppings], and à la carte shrimp dishes. His grandmother started this business, but four years ago, he decided to take charge and expand it.

loans.use: to buy fish, seafood and other supplies for his business.

loans.name: Liliana Patricia

texts.es: Liliana se dedica desde hace 2 años al negocio de ropa, también trabaja de empleada domestica y a vender un poca de la leche que le regalan a su esposo ya que él es chofer de un tanquero que reparte leche, ella se caracteriza por ser una mujer muy creativa y trabajadora, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de mercadería en ropa para incrementar su negocio, su aspiración es que dios le de vida y salud para seguir en sus diferentes actividades y tener el suficiente dinero para educar y alimentar a sus 3 hijos y de ser posible comprarse un tanquero de leche propio.
texts.en:
Liliana has worked selling clothing for two years.  She also works as a domestic employee and sells a small amount of milk that she gets from her husband, since he drives a milk truck.  She is known for being a hardworking and creative woman.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of clothing to expand her business.  Her aspiration is that God gave her life and health to continue with her work and have enough money to educate and feed her three children.  She hopes to be able to buy their own milk tanker.

loans.use: to purchase clothing.

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es: Alberto  es un joven casado que vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos que asisten a la escuela, el colegio y la universidad,  el arrienda una casa para vivir y para hacer funcionar su negocio, comenta que compra la leche y luego la hace queso pasteurizado esto hace que su producto sea muy competitivo y muy consumido por su clientela, su esposa le ayuda en este negocio,  aspira a futuro comprar una casa y que sus hijos saquen un título profesional.
texts.en: Alberto is a young married man who lives with his wife and three children who attend primary school, high school and University.  He rents a home for living space and that space also functions as his business.  He comments that he buys milk and then makes it into pasteurized cheese, which makes his product very competitive and highly demanded by his customers.  His wife helps him with the business.  He hopes in the future to buy a home and that his children will be able to get a professional degree.

loans.use: To purchase milk.

loans.name: Yan's Group

texts.en:
Yan, 28, lives in a rural village of the Siem Reap Province’s Srey Snom district. She is a married mother of three children, all of whom are dependent on her and are still in school. 

Her family’s income is from leasing rice paddy and planting cassava. She has been in this business for 10 years to make a living. From the current business, she can earn about KHR 27,000 per day, and manage to save about KHR 10,000 per day for future needs. 

Yan has never been with VisionFund before. Now, she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and plow the field. With this loan, she hopes to extend her farmland and to increase her business so as to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers plow the field.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: M. Afzaal

texts.en:
M. Afzaal is a 29-year-old married man and the father of two children. He owns a flour mill, and he sells the sacks of flour to the retailers and to common people. His practice is to purchase wheat, grind it with a blending machine, and pack the flour in sacks to sell. 

A few days ago, his blending machine has become out of order due to continuous work. He wants to replace this machine with a new one, but he does not have enough cash in hand to buy a new machine. 

This is the reason M. Afzaal has requested a Kiva loan from Kiva’s field partner, BRAC Pakistan. With the loan amount, he will buy a blending machine and sacks of wheat for grinding and then selling. 

M. Afzaal hopes that this loan will prove productive, not only for the business, but as well for his family. He thanks Kiva, the lenders, and BRAC Pakistan for this honorable support.

loans.use: to buy a blending machine and some additional sacks of wheat.

loans.name: Khuoch's Group

texts.en:
Khuoch is a farmer, who grows cassava in one area of Kampong Cham province. She is a 33 year-old mother blessed with three kids. Nowadays, two of them are in school and one is under school age. 

Cassava is the main source of her income, and she works as a paid worker for supplemental income. She has engaged in the current business for ten years, and it has generated 31,200 KHR per day. 

This is the first cycle for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she is a leader of two borrowers to get a loan. She is requesting loan of 1,000,000 KHR, and her co-borrower is applying loan of 400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava. 

She highly believes that she will produce a better yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Huk's Group

texts.en:
A local citizen from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap Province, Huk is 52 years old and a mother of seven children. Nowadays, six of them are her responsibility; three are in school and three are helping her at home. 

To overcome her financial burdens, she has done rice and cassava farming as the main source of income for ages. This is not the original loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has completely repaid her past loans, which had a positive impact in her family. 

Now, she is a leader of three members to get a loan. The entire requested loan amount of her group is 3,500,000 KHR, with 1,300,000 KHR as her loan portion. As a leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to buy cassava seedlings for her farmland. 

She hopes to increase her family’s income more than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to buy cassava seedlings.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Eart's Group

texts.en:
Eart is a 46-year-old married woman with four children. She is a villager from the Siem Reap province’s Srey Snom district.

The main source of her family’s income is growing cassava and rice. This business has been in operation for 28 years and she earns a daily income of 50,000 KHR to support her family. She saves about 30,000 KHR per day for future needs. 

This is the first loan for Eart’s group with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm. She hopes to increase her yield and make a living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds for her farm.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en:
Abegail's only source of income is her business of cooking and selling meals and snacks within her community. She is a 22-year old married woman with no children. 

She and her husband aspire to become successful, financially stable, and have a bright future. To achieve their goals, Abegail wants to make her business more profitable and generate a higher income. Having limited capital, she would like to request a loan of 20,000.00 PHP to buy fresh meat, vegetables, fish, flour, sugar, seasonings and other ingredients needed to cooked and sell food items in the local community. 

Being patience and industrious, she is hoping that someday, she will make her business more profitable.

loans.use: to buy fresh meat, vegetables, fish, flour, sugar, seasonings and other ingredients.

loans.name: Koeurn's Group

texts.en:
Koeurn, a villager from Kampong Cham province, is a 60-year-old widowed father with eight children. He supports the family by growing rice and works as a teacher. 

He earns 38,900 KHR per day. He seeks a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he is a leader of a group of two. He has successfully repaid  his previous loan and it has enabled him to improve his lifestyle. 

This is the second cycle loan for Koeurn and his co-borrower. As a leader, he will use his entire loan portion to pay for plowing, harvesting, labor fees,  fertilizer, and insecticide for his business. He hopes to gain better yield than in previous years.

loans.use: To pay for plowing, harvesting, labor fees, fertilizer, and  insecticide.

loans.name: Green Tomalin Group

texts.en:
Sophia is a member of the Green Tomalin group and is known for being an entrepreneurial mother and hard worker.  She is a  married woman in her late thirties and has two children who attend school.  

Sophia has made her living for five years by running two businesses (poultry and mamalishe). She works from 6:00 am to 4:00 pm daily and is able to make a very good monthly profit.

This will be her 3rd loan request from Kiva partner, Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to restock her inventory with maize, baking flour, rice, cooking oil, beans, fruits and vegetables. 

Sophia bought chicks and chicken feed to make her chickens fat and healthier. She used the profit to cover school fees and home food expenses. She believes that, in the future, she will be able to own a big business. Sophia will use this loan to buy items for her mamalishe and chicks. 

She will share this loan with her loan group ”Green Tomalin” which has two members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy items for her mamalishe and chicks.

loans.name: Ra'no

texts.ru: Раъно фермер из города Трусунзаде. Недавно ей исполнилось 41 год. Она вдова, живет с двумя детьми и матерью. Раъно имеет приусадебный участок земли, на котором выращивает огородные культуры. Она трудится на грядке уже 8 лет. Ей нравится ее деятельность, так как она обеспечивает семью не только доходом, но и свежими и экологически чистыми овощами. Раъно уже провела посевные работы. Теперь ей необходимо обработать будущий урожай. С этим намерением Раъно обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить минеральные и химические удобрения. Она надеется к лету собрать качественный урожай.
texts.en: Ra' no is a farmer from the town of Tursun-zoda.  She recently turned 41 years old.  She is a widow and she lives with her two children and her mother.  She works on an allotted piece of land and grows garden crops.  She has been working on this land for eight years already.  She enjoys her activity, as it not only provides her family with an income but also with fresh and environmentally-friendly vegetables.  Ra'no has already sowed her land.  She now needs to prepare for the coming harvest.  With this goal in mind, she has requested a loan to buy mineral and chemical fertilizers.  She is hoping for a good harvest in the summer.

loans.use: to buy mineral and chemical fertilizers to be used on her crops.

loans.name: Kariakoo Group

texts.en:
Mwanabaraka is in her late twenties and is married with three children who are at school. For five years now, Mwanabaraka has been managing a mamalishe business. She runs her business from 7 a.m. to noon time and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This is her third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania, which she will use to buy food cooking ingredients (maize and baking flour, rice, beans, meat and other foodstuff). With the previous loans (all of which paid back successfully), she restocked her store with food cooking ingredients. Mwanabaraka managed to make a profit, which she used to pay school fees and home food expenses. She dreams of building a house. 

Mwanabaraka will share this loan with her loan group, Kariakoo, which consists of five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy food cooking ingredients (maize and baking flour, rice, beans, meat and other foodstuff) for her mamalishe business.

loans.name: Alicia

texts.en:
This is Alicia, 55, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Juanito and they have children. She and her husband manage their household and operate a business. They work hand in hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Alicia owns and oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has a one-unit (14-16 person capacity) jeepney, which earns *boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community members. She earns a minimum of 1,000 PHP every day.
				
To help her to continue her business, she requests 8,000 PHP to buy spare parts and maintain her jeepney unit. She expects to increase her business income as she expands her business.

Alicia dreams to have another  jeepney unit and hopes that her family will always be in good health. She meets with her co-fellowship** members to weekly share stories of her life and business and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God that she studies.

Curiously, Jeepneys have purely American origins. They were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for every day travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly Philippines.

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

** All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney.

loans.name: Khen's Group

texts.en:
Khen, 43, is a mother of four children and a local villager  from Dam Bae district of Kampong Cham province.

Two children rely on her and they attend school. To feed the family, she grows cassava and rubber trees. This is the main source of income.  In addition, she  works other jobs to supplement her income. It is the business she has done for 25 years and she earns a decent income that covers her daily expenses. 

She is a seventh-cycled borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and has successfully repaid past loans. The loans  have improved her lifestyle. For this cycle, she is a group leader of two and requests a loan of 2,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing, labor fees, and  fertilizer. 

She hopes to sell her crop at a good price and increase her income.

loans.use: to pay for plowing, labor fees, and fertilizer.

loans.name: Beng's Group

texts.en:
Beng, a resident from Kampong Cham province, is a 50-year-old mother of six children. For the sake of her household, rice and cassava farming are the main sources of income.  The crops have enabled her to earn about 26,300 KHR per day. She earns additional income from working other jobs. 

She has been involved with her current business for eight years. This is the second-cycle loan for her with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader of two. She and her co-borrower request a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for plowing and labor fees. 

She hopes to gain a better crop yield than in previous years.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing and labor fees.

loans.name: Thae's Group

texts.en:
Thae is a young mother of three children and a villager from Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. Two children attend school and one is too young for school. 

To tackle the financial demands of her household, she grows cassava and rice. She has farmed for ten years and earns 37,300 KHR per day. This is the second cycle loan for Thae and her joint-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She and her joint-borrower seek 1,500,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees. She hopes to produce a better yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Al Ahibaa Group

texts.en:
Saydeh is the featured borrower of A Ahibaa group. She joined the other group members to acquire a loan from Kiva’s partner Al Majmoua because they have always been neighbors and friends. They want to develop their careers and  work hard to invest their  loan in a well managed way.

Saydeh is a 60-year-old divorced mother of five children.  She works hard to provide them with a good standard of living. She has been  a tutor at her house for two years, and she puts a lot of effort into developing her business. 

Her  loan will purchase a new blackboard, chalk, markers and flip charts which will make teaching more exciting and interactive for her students.

She hopes that one day she can establish a tutoring center outside her house and accept more students.  Saydeh is the lady sitting in the middle wearing eyeglasses. As for the other members, Nelly is the first from the right with red robe, and Rania is the first from the left with black jacket.

loans.use: to buy a new blackboard, chalk, markers and flip charts, to make teaching more exciting and interactive to her students.

loans.name: Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es: El grupo “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” está conformada por 05 socios responsables y emprendedores. Eleonora de 48 años es casada y  tiene 02 hijos dependientes. Ella se dedica a la producción y venta de frutas, así como la  chirimoya y palta. Gracias a su esfuerzo puede brindarles  educación a sus hijos. El deseo de Eleonora es de seguir aumentado  su producción  de chirimoya. Es por ello que solicitó el crédito para la compra de abono urea y potasio. El grupo “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor” agradece  por hacer posible este crédito. Eleonora es la  primera del lado derecho y viste polo rojo. En la parte superior a lado derecho se encuentra Elsa la cual no pudo llegar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en:
The group “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor,” is made up of 5 hardworking and responsible members. Eleonora is 48 years old, married and has two dependent children. She makes a living producing and selling fruit, such as custard apples and avocados. Thanks to her efforts she is able to provide education to her children. Eleonora wishes to continue increasing her production of custard apples. Therefore, she requests the loan to purchase organic nitrogen and potassium fertilizers. 

The group, “Mujeres Para Un Futuro Mejor,” expresses thanks for making this loan possible. In the Photo, Eleonora is the first from the right side in the red and grey striped polo. In the top right corner you can see Elsa, who could not arrive in time for the photo because of work conflicts.

loans.use: To purchase organic nitrogen and potassium fertilizers.

loans.name: Kissanga Group

texts.en:
Salma, who is in her mid thirties, is a divorcee with two kids who are still in school. She has been a food vendor for two years now. She works from 6 am to 10 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Salma's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep increasing the food stock in the store and has been able to pay back all her loans successfully. She is happy with the results of her previous loan; she used the profits to pay school fees, bought home utensils, bought a cupboard, a TV, a bed, and paid for household expenses. She will use this loan to restock the items lacking in the food store. She dreams of building a house.

Salma will share this loan with her loan group "KISSANGA" which has eight members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the missing items in the food store.

loans.name: Toen's Group

texts.en:
Toen, 53, is married and living with her family in a village of Choeng Prey district, Kampomg Cham province, Cambodia. She has five children. To make a living, she has been farming rice for 35 years while her husband makes palm juice. Together, they can earn about 43,000 KHR per day from their current business. 

Toen is just with VisionFund for this cycle. She is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more jewelry to expand her business.

loans.name: Savorn's Group

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village of Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district, Savorn is aged 41 years and married. To make a living, she grows rice and cassava. Having been in this business for 21 years, she can earn about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Savorn’s group consists of two members who are both female. She has been with VisionFund for one cycle. The past loan has helped her gradually improve her living. Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to make healthy rice to increase her family’s income so as to make living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Noern's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area located in the Prey Chhor district of Kampong Cham province, Noern is 58 years old and married with three children. To support her family, she has been farming rice for 40 years and working for others for a fee. From the current business, she can earn about 50,000 KHR per day and can save about 20,000 KHR each day for her future needs. 

This is the group loan for Noern’s group of two with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund and she is the first cycled client. As the leader, she is now leading her group to ask for a loan. She wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make living better.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Chelsea Group

texts.en:
Jaibi is a father one daughter and one son, one of whom is in school. He owns a business selling fruits and vegetables for two years. Jaibi is also a welding man and has a genge business (grocery stall) run by his wife. The genge is open from 8 am to 6 pm each working day and allows then to make a fair monthly profit. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is Jaibi's second loan request which he will use to buy charcoal for her store to resell. He wants to buy more sacks of charcoal to keep in the store to avoid scarcity and the increase of purchase prices during the rainy season. His previous loan, which he repaid successfully, was used to allow him to start selling charcoal at the genge. He used the profits to pay school fees and household expenses. Jaibi dreams of building a house.

He will share this loan with his loan group "CHELSEA" which totals five members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for his store to resell.

loans.name: Mayerlin Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Mayerlin es la propietaria de un restaurante ubicado en su hogar, oficio que aprendió cuando fue madre comunitaria, Mayerlin le ha tocado sobrevivir con sus precios bajos ya que el sector es muy pobre y esta es la única manera de lograr una venta solicita un crédito para la ampliación de su cocina y comprar materia prima en cantidades por que sale más barato y tiene un mejor margen de ganancia. Mayerlin tiene la fe y seguridad que todo el dinero invertido en este negocio le puede dar frutos ya que cualquier erro puede causar el cierre pues no tendría como asumir perdidas económicamente hablando. Mayerlin es una madre separa la cual solo tiene el restaurante como fuente de ingreso. Con esta inversión espera generar utilidad para cumplir su sueño de tener un restaurante fuera de su hogar y bien organizado ya que este crédito mejorara enormemente el ambiente del restaurante.
texts.en:
Mayerlin is the owner of a restaurant located in her house. She learned how to cook while she was a foster mother. Mayerlin has learned how to survive with low prices as her area is very poor and this is the only way to make a sale.

She is requesting a loan to make her kitchen larger and buy high volumes of raw materials as they are cheaper and she can have a higher profit margin. Mayerlin has the faith and serenity that all the money invested in this business can give fruit as any error could close her down. She does not have the resources to absorb a loss.

She is a single mother whose only source of income is the restaurant. With this investment she hopes to make the capital she needs to fulfill her dream of having a well organized restaurant apart from her home. This loan will help a lot with the atmosphere of her restaurant.

loans.use: to make her kitchen larger and buy raw materials wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, cooking vegetables, rice and cooking seasonings to expand her business.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
This is Rosemarie. She is 52, single and a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. She works hard to provide for her everyday needs. She is also helping her family and relatives when it comes to financial matters.

Rosemarie operates a buy and sell business. What she basically does is buy general merchandise from wholesalers and sell them for a little profit. Her products are men's and women’s clothes, and other products of the like. Customers are attracted to buy due to the low prices and the many options she offers. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of 400 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, she is requesting an 8,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy ready-to-wear products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, socks, and shirts to expand her product inventory.

Rosemarie hopes to have more customers, and she dreams that her family will always be in good health. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for ready-to-wear products and merchandise items like polo shirts for men and women, socks, and shirts to expand her product inventory.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, pure water, and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Laura Isabel

texts.es: Laura es una señorita muy positiva y responsable ella se dedica un año a criar chanchos, en una chanchera de una amiga, Laura vive con sus padres y 4 hermanos que se encuentran estudiando, Laura comenta que sus padres se dedican a la agricultura y tienen que cubrir los gastos de los hijos que están estudiando, por esta razón ya no le apoyan económicamente a Laura, esta joven también trabaja en una empresa florícola dice que se dedica a las dos actividades para mejorar sus ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y seguir apoyando a sus hermanos en la educación. El crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos.
texts.en:
Laura is a very positive and responsible young woman. She has been raising pigs for a year, using her friend's pigpen. 

Laura lives with her parents and four siblings who go to school. Laura says that her parents are farmers and have to cover the expenses for the children who are going to school. For this reason they no longer provide financial support to Laura. 

This young woman also works at a flower-growing company. She says she does the two activities in order to improve her income; so that so that she can cover her expenses and continue helping her siblings with their education. She is going to use the loan to buy pigs.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Muheza Group

texts.en:
Leina who is in her early forties is married with six kids, five of whom are at school. She has been running two projects: selling cooked food and selling clothes. She has been in her business for six years now. She works from 6 am to 3 pm daily and is able to make a fare monthly profit.

This will be Leina's third loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to start selling clothes and shoes, and rented a new business place.  She has repaid all her loans successfully. She is happy with the past loan; she used the profits to pay school fees and household expenses. She will use this loan to buy rice, beans, maize flour, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of an improved life.

Leina will share this loan with her loan group "Muheza" with three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, maize flour, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Susana Maribel

texts.es: Susana tiene 20 años de edad, ella es una joven muy alegre, comenta que se dedica 2 años a criar chanchos y a trabajar al jornal, ella asiste al colegio los fines de semana osea semipresencial, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para con estos ingresos cubrir sus gastos de educación, a Susana le gustaría trabajar en una empresa florícola pero no le permiten hacerlo ya que ella tiene un problema de salud en sus ojos, su aspiración es tener el dinero suficiente para tratar su problema visual.
texts.en:
Susana is 20, and a very cheerful young woman. She says that for two years she has been raising pigs and working as a day laborer. She attends high school on weekends; that is, on a blended learning basis (part distance learning, part classroom).

She is going to use the loan to buy pigs, so that with this income she can cover her educational expenses. Susanna would like to work for a flower- growing company, but they will not allow her to do so, as she has a health problem with her eyes. Her ambition is to have enough money to treat her vision problem.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Sokhom's Group

texts.en: A villager located in Kampong Cham province, Sokhom is 53 years old and a father of four children. For his family, cassava farming is the main source of income supporting the family and a paid-working job is the supplementary source of income. He has been in the the business for ages and it returns him 32,700 KHR per day. Sokhom has been with VisionFund (Kiva Field Partner) for one past loan which has been fully repaid and which made his living conditions better than before. Now, he is seeking a loan with VisionFund and he is a leader. He and his fellow group member are requesting loan of 1,400,000 KHR and 600,000 KHR respectively. As a leader, he is planning to buy fertilizer for his farmland. He hopes to have a better yield than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his farmland

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Lon

texts.en:
Lon, aged 59, lives with her husband and two children in a house in Kampong Cham province. Lon has made a living by farming rice seasonally. She has been in this field for more than 30 years and earns a daily income of $10 per day. Lon’s husband helps her manage their farm to ensure a high production rate.
 
Lon will use this loan to dig a pond, from which her family can get enough water for daily consumption and for farming. She will also utilize the remaining funds to buy a motorcycle to support her family’s transportation needs. Lon expresses her thanks to all lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: to dig a pond, from which her family can get enough water for daily consumption and for farming.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new netter sewing machine to continue her business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en: Ang is 39 years old. She is a mother of two kids and a villager of Tbaung Khmum district of the province of Kampong Cham. She is a grocer and a paid-worker in order to earn income to support her household. The business in which she has been involved for ages has enabled her to earn an income of 29,700 KHR per day. Ang is a former borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s field partner). She has completely repaid her past loan which enabled her to buy home appliances for her family. Now, she leads a group of two to get a loan of 1,200,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy more grocery items to sell. She hopes to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to sell

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase bread, drinks, cigarettes and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Purevdalai

texts.en:
Purevdalai is 57 years old lives with her husband, daughter and granddaughter in their small house in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia. Her husband had a blood stroke and stays home requiring constant care. Her daughter runs a small shoe store in another local market and her granddaughter is 8 and studies at local school. 

Purevdalai started her shoe retail business in a local market in 2006. She taught her daughter to run a microbusiness, and now they are both running their own businesses. She is a hardworking, responsible and diligent woman who is now requesting loan of 3,000,000 MNT to purchase a variety of shoes from China to sell at her rental counter.

loans.use: to purchase variety of shoes from China to sell at her rental counter.

loans.name: Sinin's Group

texts.en: Sinin is a villager located from Kampong Cham province. She is 35 years old. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school. To feed the family, she grows cassava and works as a construction worker for extra income. It is the business that she has been doing for ages and it has returned her with decent income. This is the first loan for Sinin and her joint-borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She and her group members are requesting a loan the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her cassava and to buy construction material. She hopes to increase her family’s income and to support her kid in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her cassava and to buy construction material.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Savoern

texts.en:
Savoern, 39, lives with her family’s member in a rural village located in the Kandal Stoeng district of Kandal province. She is married with three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. Rice farming has been the only source for her family’s income for five years. To supplement her income, she also works for others for a fee. The current business earns her about 40,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 20,000 KHR each day for her future needs. 

She has been with VisionFund for three cycles and has completely paid back the past loans which have helped her better support her family. Now she is applying for a loan to buy seeds for her farmland. She hopes to make more income from her current business.

loans.use: to buy seeds for her farmland.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Eth's Group

texts.en: Originally from Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Eth is 65 years old, a married mother of six children. She struggles for a living via rice and cassava farming as the main source of income. She has never been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before and she is the leader of two in order to take a new loan. She and her joint-borrower are requesting a loan for the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and to pay for the plowing fee for her cassava field. She hopes to increase her cassava yield more than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay the plowing fee.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Saruon's Group

texts.en: A mother of seven children, Saruon is 43 years old and a resident of the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. To strive for a living, she does rice and cassava farming, which she has done for 25 years and it has earned her 37,200 KHR per day. Saruon is an original borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is the group leader. She and her co-borrower are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her cassava. She strongly hopes to collect extra income more than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide for her cassava

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Robelyn

texts.en:
Robelyn is 33 years old and single.

Robelyn runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, coffee, sugar, toothpaste, noodles, etc. to sell.

Robelyn has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, coffee, sugar, toothpaste, noodles, etc.

In the future, Robelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, canned goods, coffee, sugar, toothpaste, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Boresha Masiha Group

texts.en:
Mathias is in his late twenties and is married. He has got two sons who are still young. Mathias has been managing a bar selling drinks (soda, water, juices, beer and spirits). He has been in this business for four years now and is able to make a small return per month. He opens his bar from 9 am to 10 pm per working day.

This is his first loan request from Tujijenge Tanzania, and he will use it to buy drinks for his bar. He dreams of improving his bar and opening another branch. He will share this loan with his loan group Boresha Masiha which totals five members who will be accountable to repay the loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks for his bar.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and animals to increase his income and be able to buy his own farm.

loans.name: Ladislas' Group

texts.en:
Ladislas is aged 62. He is married with two children. With the loan, he would like to buy fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production. He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase his production. With profits from his farming, he wishes to invest in his business so that in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. In the picture, Ladislas holds a red file as a sign of identification.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertilizer and support labor costs during rice production.

loans.name: Hon's Group

texts.en: Hon is 49 years old and married. She is blessed with seven kids, but now only three of them rely on her. One of them is in school and the two remaining are helping her business at home. For her family, rice and cassava farming are the main source for her to earn income. She has been involved with this business for years and it has generated 27,800 KHR per day. Hon is a first-cycle borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is the team leader of three members. She and her fellow group members also sought the same loan amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings and to pay for the plowing fee for her cassava farmland. She hopes to increase her family’s income more than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and cassava seedlings and to pay for the plowing fee

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Rachelle

texts.en:
Rachelle is a married woman with two children, one of whom is currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Rachelle is 21 years old.

Rachelle has a buy and sell feeds business in the Philippines. Rachelle requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feeds to sell.

Rachelle has been in this business for 5 years. Rachelle would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feeds to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase plastic slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Samet's Group

texts.en: A young mother of one child, Samet is a villager from Siem Reap province. She is a farmer who plants rice and cassava as the main source of income. It is the business that she has done for nine years. This current business has returned her 25,300 KHR per day. She is the first borrower with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader of three to get a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to pay for plowing and transplanting fees for her cassava field. She hopes to increase her income more than before.

loans.use: to pay for plowing and transplanting fees.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Hoen's Group

texts.en: Hoen is 24 years old and a married mother blessed with two children. Her main source of income is from rice and cassava farming. She also earned extra income via a pig-raising business. She can earn 25,000 KHR per day via this business to support the family. Now, she is seeking her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she is a leader of three. She and her joint-borrowers are requesting a loan of the same amount of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy pig’s feed and more pigs for raising as well as to pay for a vaccination fee for her pigs. She strongly hopes to earn increase her income via this business.

loans.use: to pay for a vaccination fee for her pigs.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Mwinyi Group

texts.en:
Elinaike, who is in her mid 50s, is married with five children. Only one is still in college and the rest are grown-ups. She has been running two businesses, raising broiler chicken and a food cafe, since 2010.  She works from 4 am to 9 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Elinaike's 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy chicken feeds and restocked the missing items in her food store. She has paid back all the loans successfully. She used the profit to pay college fees and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy chicks, chicken feeds and rice, beans, maize flour, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of buying a shamba upcountry.

Elinaike will share this loan with her loan group "Mwinyi" which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy chicks, chicken feeds and rice, beans, maize flour, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Bethy Viviana

texts.es: Viviana es  casada con un señor colombiano, ella tiene un hijo de 5 años que asiste a la escuela y está a punto de nacer otro hijo,  ella tiene dos años de experiencia en la crianza de terneros ya que sus padres se dedican a la ganadería, con este crédito va a emprender este negocio  y a comprar terneros para criarlos y luego comercializarlos, su esposo es chofer de una retroexcavadora (maquina que cava la tierra) dice que trabaja con un ingeniero y que le lleva a cualquier parte del Ecuador a realizar  esta actividad,  Viviana anhela que le vaya muy bien en este negocio y sacar adelante a sus hijos.
texts.en: Viviana is married to a Colombian man, she has one five-year-old son who attends school, and she is about to give birth to another child. She has two years of experience raising calves since her parents work in raising livestock. With this loan she will take over this business and buy calves to raise and later sell. Her husband is a backhoe operator (a machine that digs out the earth), and she says that he works with an engineer who brings him all over Ecuador to do this job. Viviana hopes to do well in this business and to thrive with her children.

loans.use: to buy calves.

loans.name: Rona Jean

texts.en:
Rona Jean is 21 years old and married with one child. 

Rona Jean is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Rona Jean has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Rona Jean would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Cooproriz Mirayi G3 Group

texts.en:
Claude is 37 years old. He is a group leader for his fellow farmers and they have spent two years in rice farming. Claude would like to secure a Kiva loan to support labor costs and buy fertilizers during rice production.  He needs to buy fertilizer in order to increase their production. With profits from his farming, Claude wishes to invest in his business so in the future he can acquire machines and tractors that will enhance his farming capacity. 

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers and support labor costs during rice production

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more gallons of palm oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Jessica Lorena

texts.es: Lorena tiene 20 años de edad, ella vive con su esposo y su hija de 2 años, Lorena lleva 2 años en la crianza de chanchos, su esposo trabaja en una planta florícola, y a Lorena le gusta ayudar de alguna manera en los gastos de su hogar, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chanchos para criarlos un una chanchera que le presta una señora, la aspiración de Lorena es incrementar su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y ponerse un centro de computo ya que esto le permitirá atender un negocio y cuidar a su hija.
texts.en:
Lorena is 20 years old and lives with her husband and their two-year-old daughter. Lorena has been raising pigs for two years. Her husband works at flower-growing facility, and Lorena likes to help in some way with the household expenses. 

She is going to use the loan to buy pigs in order to raise them in a pigpen that a woman lets her use. Lorena's ambition is to expand her business in order to improve her income and to set up an Internet café, as this will allow her to run a business and look after her daughter.

loans.use: To buy pigs.

loans.name: Villa Pumacahua Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Villa Pumacahua” La cual  está conformado por 05 socios responsables y emprendedores. Yuri de 28 años de edad es casada. Ella se dedica  a la venta y distribución de locería hace más de 01 año donde todo le va bien. Su mayor anhelo es implementar su local para poder exhibir sus productos.  Solicitó el crédito para la compra platos, tasas y vasos. El grupo “Villa Pumacahua” agradece a todas las personas que facilitaron este crédito. Yuri es la primera del lado izquierdo y viste blusa floreado.
texts.en:
This is the new “Villa Pumacahua” group, which is made up of five responsible and enterprising members. Yuri is 28 years old and married. She has been selling and distributing chinaware for more than a year, and everything is going well. Her greatest desire is to have her own shop so that she can display her products. 

She requested the loan in order to buy dishes, cups and glasses. The “Villa Pumacahua” group is grateful to all the people who have made this loan possible. Yuri is the first one on the left, wearing a flowered blouse.

loans.use: To buy dishes, cups and glasses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchasing more palm oil, rice, and cooking seasoning.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fruit for resale.

loans.name: Ghina Al Marej Group

texts.en:
Ghadir is the featured borrower of the Ghina Al Marej Group. She got along with the other group members, holding hands together and acquiring a loan from Kiva partner Al Majmoua so they can fulfill their needs.
Ghadir is a 31-year-old married mother of four children.  Six months ago, she started working at her house, selling clothes and beauty products, to support her husband in covering their increasing needs. She and her husband, who works as a bus driver, are devoted to the improvement of their family’s living conditions. Their combined incomes aren’t enough to cover their children's increasing needs. For this reason, her acquired loan will be invested in buying newly released spring and summer collections of clothing that will attract her customers’ attention and increase their income.
Ghadir hopes to expand her business in the future and move to a bigger shop. She is the first lady from the left with a green veil covering her hair. As for the other group members, Nadia is the lady at the center, and Manal is the first from the right.

loans.use: to buy newly released spring and summer collections of clothing

loans.name: Arjeles

texts.en: Arjeles is a 43-year-old mom with three children. To make a living, she owns and manages a business selling cosmetic products in her community. In order to increase her sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy more cosmetic products to resell. She hopes to improve her business to gain more income to save for the purpose of renovating her house.

loans.use: to buy more cosmetic products to resell
